cnou8q-UEl1z8oRl5YQdFA.text: As soon as I walked in I was awed by the amount of people on both levels. This is always a good sign. We were seated quickly (party of two). The waiter was very swift initially and quite friendly. I ordered the (house made) sausage egg and cheese buttermilk biscuit which came with a choice of hash browns, grits or fruit. I went with the hash browns. My cousin ordered the red velvet waffle with chicken - I should've ordered that! The biscuit itself was just ok and so was everything on and around it. I was thinking house-made sausage had to be something spectacular like Neese's... not so much. To be honest, Bojangles has a better patty. Of course I had to taste the chicken and waffles and the chicken was so tender and moist and the waffle was just sweet enough to not need any syrup but not so sweet that it caused a diabetic coma. As we were waiting for our food, I noticed the hostess walking with a half-empty plate of food ( I guess she was headed to the kitchen??) and she grabbed something from the plate and ate it! That threw me for a loop considering the ambiance given off by the restaurant. Other than that, I was pleased by the wait staff. One waiter who was not serving us even offered to check to see if our car was still on the street - apparently there are certain hours for parking on the street without being towed. Overall, I had a good experience and I will give it another try. I just know to avoid the basics and go for something more extravagant if I want some flavor.

TGM8i0mUJtSnoEiH9etyoA.text: FANTASTIC! Decor: A+, Staff: A+, Food: A+!  Just ate a delicious "full breakfast" (scrambled eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, & 2 pancakes + fruit cup). So yummy! Hashbrowns were perfect! Just the way I like them - shredded! Matt was a great waiter, too!

gcWAm-p4VzqRzzHZGy7xKg.text: The service here is awful. Walked in and asked for a table for 5... the hostess didn't take my name and said to hold on 'right there' for a few minutes. I literally stood about 5 steps in front of the stand. After about 15 minutes I went up to her and she stated, "oh I thought we seated you." Then she took my name. We waited for about 15 more minutes and in that time one of the members of our party began feeling sick. He went to lay down in the car when they called our name. We stated that we had four people now - and they said they could no longer seat us because they had a 6-top... and we would require a 4-top. We did not want to be moved to the back of the list AGAIN, so we went to get our friend from the car. After about two minutes, our friend returned and when they brought us up to our table... we were at a four seater with an additional chair jammed into the corner.  This is after them telling us they could not seat us w/ only four people because they reserved a larger table. We saw the larger table open and asked the hostess if we could move there and she said, 'she's just doing what they told her' and when someone in our party suggested we should leave after all this she said, 'that's fine' and walked away without saying anything further. We were left standing in the middle of the restaurant. We looked over the banister and saw they had moved on, seating other parties. It should also be noted that there were MANY MANY open tables. As we walked out, the manager saw us leaving and didn't say a word. A member of our party had to ask if he was the manager. As she told the manager what happened and he did not say sorry ONCE. I have been here before... and the food is good... but it is not worth the headache. The hostesses clearly do not give a sh*t and have no idea what they're doing, and the manager doesn't seem that concerned either.  We went to McDonald's across the street instead and received better customer service there. Seriously.

iQ8NYZLGn74lfabbc9f0wg.text: This was a very poor experience. The menus clearly stated drink specials but manager refused to honor. We have eaten at the Ballantyne location and it's always been good but food here was mediocre at best. All the salad dressings were like custard and the waiter said there was something wrong but never offered to change out meal. Kids meal clearly stated milk was included but charged extra because chocolate milk was ordered.  Worst part was when we told manager about issue with drink price, charging extra for chocolate milk and the salad dressings being bad he could care less.  Being a business owner I would never let a person like him deal with my customers let alone be in charge! Now it makes sense why place was empty while restaurants all around it were busy!

K09CPT9BWX5odGRSXncMlw.text: Stopped by the Terrace while visiting Charlotte and really enjoyed it. I liked the ambience and feel of the restaurant. My honey had the shrimp and grits with a mule and I had the crab cake benedict with a cranberry mimosa. The wait wasn't too bad considering it was a Saturday afternoon. However, I will add the young hostess should be a bit more attentive as they check in and seat guest. Two couples that arrived after us were seated before us and the buzzer they provided didn't go off. All in all, I'd still return.

rIEq7U3FP74y78ImlmQ_aA.text: Great healthy and flavorful options. I need to remember that brrrrr its always cold in there. Pretty noisy for a business lunch but I always end up havng biz lunches here. Must be the killer service and breakfast all day options!

alzs2KD0zqL3l0spKEf0Qg.text: The location of the place is really nice.  The staff pleasant and the food even better.  Definitely worth the effort!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle

LkGF2svyFDHXcrIV79O2vQ.text: We loved this place! My boyfriend and I went there for brunch and the food was amazing. This place is so cute and even has an upstairs overlooking the downstairs. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the few servers that we came in contact with weren't really that attentive and almost acted as if they had something better to do. Not too pricey but the food is worth it anyways. Definitely would go here again because of how good the food is.

iHs2rhna1kTJrpT3DtV6Cw.text: Wait was longer than we were quoted, but food was all as good as we had hoped for. Hubby had the red velvet waffle with fried chicken and loved it. I had the steak and eggs and it was cooked perfectly. Our server was fantastic and took good care of us.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle with fried chicken, cheddar grits, and hash browns.

zyJGvWFUPOQLrK9F8Kxxjg.text: I'm a big fan of Terrace Cafe and the secret seems to be getting out. I went a little early and put our names in, so we were seated almost as soon as the rest of the party arrived, but I heard wait times of up to 45 minutes quoted and people were actually staying! What does that tell you about how yummy their food is? That people are willing to wait & have a morning beer at Taco Mac just to eat there? Worth waiting for!  Anyway, I went for brunch with 3 other ladies and we all found something that sounded (and tasted!) excellent. However, I think I've written before about how good their food is, so I will take this opportunity to highlight their coffee. I never thought of them as a place to go specifically for coffee, but wow, they have upped their game on that front. My latte was perfection and one of my friends called her cappuccino "the best she'd ever had." Yum, will return. :D

DxQQHMQsqrfaUueyhJIHYA.text: Red velvet waffles and chicken was a good portion and very delicious, I will definitely keep this on my favorite food list. Staff was attentive and setting was nice.

SQPQcSB4EZitmeRlNCbbJw.text: Awesome food and one of best customer service experiences.  Ate the chicken and red waffles velvet with a Russian memo it was quite delicious indeed.

TN_V2UV3jpU_6lZg67cnGQ.text: Red Velvet Waffles. S'mores French Toast. I love how when it comes to breakfast, you can add tons of junkfood to any staple and suddenly it's a perfectly acceptable meal. It's like calling something a muffin instead of a cupcake...no guilt when you eat your non-cupcake at 7:30a.m.   Thanks to the fabulous Yelp reviews we used the occasion of out-of-town friends passing thru CLT as an excuse to head south and meet the fine people at Terrace. Here are the reasons for my four stars and new devotion:  1: Call ahead seating and very sweet and efficient hostesses. Makes life MUCH easier when the wait is 45min, it's sahara hot and you're schlepping two toddlers.  2: Samples of fresh, warm, house made donuts while you wait.   3: Contemporary yet comfortable atmosphere. You are equally at home in shorts/tee or a cute summer dress.  4: The service was outstanding.   5: The food was, quite simply, delicious. I do think the Red Velvet Waffle was a bit overpriced for what it is, but the S'mores french toast are so rich and gooood. The omeletts are big and full of whatever your heart desires. Shrimp and grits had a nice flavor and texture BUT isn't much food if you have a big eater in your party.  They bring snacks for the kids, deliver their food ASAP and are very engaging w/them. The servers are all helpful and concerned about your experience. Overall, a great dining experience and our friends are looking fwd to heading this way again soon for another go 'round. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. S&#39;mores French Toast. Sooooo good.

VHC27tP2-5ZfPpHGDJq6UA.text: I have to tell you that there are not too many restaurants out there who let patrons come in 10 minutes before closing but they did. The serve staff were excellent and for that and the fact they make fantastic food puts them as my go to restaurant of all time. I had the Eggs Benedict with crab cakes...love devine people  I've been back three times now and working my way through the menu.

fXF_2CrbWw0ptIDIZQ0SaQ.text: I don't usually write reviews, or ever give 5 stars, but I had one of the BEST breakfasts I have ever had at Terrace Cafe. I'm a big fan of red velvet cake, so when I saw they had a red velvet waffle, I had to try it. In a word: AMAZING. Not too sweet, light fluffy batter, cream cheese "syrup".... Like nothing I've ever had before. I ordered it with fried chicken, which was a boneless, generously sized crispy piece of all white meat, served on the side. I put it on the waffle for a pure decadent taste experience. Yum, yum, yum!  And as a side note, my order came with hash browns, which were some of the best I've ever had. Obviously they were fresh, shredded by hand with just the right amount of onion mixed in for flavor, and fried to a crispy golden finish on top. My boyfriend is kind of a picky eater, and he could not stop raving about how great the hash browns were.  Excellent service, full bar (I had a mimosa), and a nice comfortable atmosphere (we ate outside) all make this place a "must visit" whenever I'm in Charlotte.

nJ73VbwfXqH3Ol-w_REVuw.text: Went for a walk to find dinner and happened upon the Terrace Cafe`, Ian C assisted me with some suggestions and I asked which would hold up as I walked back to my room. Ian offered the chicken strips. He was very friendly and courteous.   When I opened my container I found enough food for two! It was very good and more than I could eat. I hope to return for breakfast and would recommend anyone to try the place tucked around the corner from all of the other more fancier restaurants.

zea3X7xu07N259jRETys8A.text: Average breakfast fare...had pancakes, eggs, hash browns, and ham. Nothing special...

kUcTjUsB7r6TdOLO4CcirQ.text: Love this place.  We've come here twice and both times had great weekend breakfast experiences.  If you can catch the quiche, it's fantastic... Add the cheesy grits and it's even better.  Also a fan of the berry split.... Loads of fresh fruit and granola with a side of coffee cake puts it over the top.  Both times we had a short wait but the crowd is a nice mix of people and the staff is friendly.  Great place!!

UFREyWiaW6BMo4KUY4BLlg.text: This is one of the few times that Yelp steered me wrong.  We stopped for lunch today prior to a nearby doctor's appointment and ordered the Angus Burger along with the Creole Filet Medallions.  I should have said something immediately when the latter arrived, as the meat was most certainly not filet.  I think it was sirloin.  It also was not medallions, as it wasn't a round cut, the sirloin was simply cut in half.  My companion said that the burger did not seem to have the taste or texture you would expect of Angus meat either, while the fries were too heavily salted.  The service was fine but having sirloin passed off as filet is pretty inexcusable.

p8NZ-2GwWY-MTOFdfvvk9Q.text: I enjoyed my visit here  the down side was the fact that they don't take reservations for breakfast and brunch but given the crowd I understand . It gets pack fast ! You will wait ! don't come starving because it will be a minute before your seated and not without your entire party present just fyi . The service good , and my food was yummy I ordered the Banana pecan French toast with fruit and a side of ham. The ham was way too salty . I couldn't finish eat and need water right after the first bite super salty, but he French toast was good made with banana bread and topped with huge pecans and banana slices. I will come back and try the famous red velvet waffles next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. sliced ham w/ a side of fruit
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pecan French Toast

uCZIKRXBA2ACDvOiGp4Kfw.text: I hate going out for breakfast because I don't eat eggs, but this restaurant has changed that!  Lemon Poppyseed Waffles... so good!

3XmpMLOCE3t0DZUW0GDmMw.text: Great Mothers Day brunch. First time at Terrace Cafe but will not be the last. After reading reviews about the Red Velvet Waffles that is what I had to have and they were outstanding. My wife had Cold Water Lobster Benedict. She let me taste it and it was to die for.

nbbcUMxmC0a8wG0VWGhAsA.text: S'mores French Toast. I'm tempted to leave it at that, but I guess not everyone is as taken away with sweet and gooey breakfast goodness.   It was Sunday morning around 10 and we probably should have opted for a faster meal so as to get on with our 11 hour drive, but we (I?) wanted a tasty breakfast. With Yelp as my guide, we set off to Terrace Cafe. First off, the parking garage is a wonderful convenience, it's not creepy or smelly like some can be and free, as well as perfectly located so finding a spot was stress-free, at least on Sunday morning. I mention this because one of my most common culprits of a ruined day is fighting over parking. The restaurant is a classy, fun cafe, with the restaurant seating taking most of the facility, with a decent bar at the enterance. The bathroom is clean and updated, and oddly well supplied (mouthwash?). The tables are all adorned with NASA issued salt & pepper shakers (or at least they remind me of space travel) and spiffy utensils. Enough about the scenery. The food is what we were hungry for, and a quick glance of the menu led me totally devoted to s'mores french toast. A sweet smell of amusement parks accompanied the three thick slices of fried (unconfirmed) french toast, smothered in marshmallow goo and chocolate sauce topped with graham crackers. I easily removed the crumbles (I'm not a graham fan), and quickly forked in. I savored each bite until I could eat no more. And I was sad. Because there was still one more piece. And I wanted it. It was so good. But I had to leave it, and it made me sad. My fellow breakfasters had Banana Pecan french toast, waffle w/strawberry, and hash browns, all of which they were very pleased (especially the french toast). The coffee was weak/bitter, but they offer espresso drinks as well so that might have been a better selection (though... if they can't get drip coffee right, I don't have tons of hope in the mochas). The service was friendly and prompt, nothing outstanding, but definitely no complaints.   Oh, and there was a note in the menu regarding only serving breakfast, I'm not sure if that's just Sundays or weekends.

aGICYkgi4GP5pkSqhGPG7Q.text: Lunch Spot when in South Park!  I was eager to try the Terrace Cafe having gone to school with the guy who now owns it and Ive been promising to try it.  I took my grandmother to lunch there on a Thursday around 12pm and walked right in. The front door staff seemed a bit distant and robotic, but walked us to the table up the stairs. We sat overlooking the first level and were approached by our bright and friendly server, Vivian.  We looked over the VAST menu and teetered between lunch and breakfast. Both looked Great.  We chose lunch. Granny ordered the Hawaiian Chicken Salad-Salad and I ordered the Mighty Corned Beef. Both were of good size when they arrived. Granny's salad was a Large scoop of delicious, Pineapple-laden creamy chicken salad that was Super fresh and light, over top of crisp mesclun greens. I wasn't sure what the dressing was, but it was sent on the side (love that) and granny didn't even use it.  My Mighty Corned Beef was just that! A beautiful sandwich of HOT Corned Beef, Chef's Slaw, Russian dressing, on perfectly toasted Marble Rye. Served with Thick Cut Steak Fries, this was a MEAL to write about (that's why I'm doing it). Although we were full, the dessert tray (nothing beats a tray) was brought over. The dessert portion sizes were great, small enough to have a few bits if sharing, and large enough to not feel ripped off! We shared the Blondie and it came out HOT, with a perfect scoop of vanilla and flavorful.  Service was perfect, food came out fast, drinks stayed full, it was overall a wonderful time.

zlg7gS3U4EIGGuFSM6fGzA.text: We ave been here for breakfast and dinner several times.  It's really good food and really creative.  Family friendly too.

czQZJTfW0k-28bdiGHBYlQ.text: First of all their food is slightly better than adequate.  Called the day before spoke with the Manager who told us to come in with our party of 15 and they would make sure we sat together.  Showed up waited for all 15 people to make it, when they did not show we ask for a table for 10.  They split us into two booths.  The whole idea was a get together.  The managers response was "what do you want me to do", nuff said.  When a manager of a restaurant says that the other obvious problems become much worse.  The 4 hostesses never smiled welcomed us or said goodbye or thank you.  The waiter had a lon gotee that everyone was afraid would fall in our food.  He never smiled and never said thankyou.  If semi-good food with real bad service is what you want I recommend this restaurant.  The owner needs to hire workers that smile and thank the customer who pays their wages.

1kGIvHebtkAcssEB8twFjg.text: The food was excellent as always, service was TERRIBLE. Stopped for brunch.. walked in the door and there were leaves all over the entrance (no biggie wind blowing, its fall).. that mess just carried on into the dining room. There was straw wrappers and a straw on the floor the entier HOUR we were there... tables sat dirty for long periods of time, the table we were sat at was 1/2 wiped off (the 1/2 closest to the end)... our server took our order and NEVER came back... the runner brought the food, I could have used some ketchup but nobody came by to refill drinks or check on us... eventually the server came back to see if we needed anything (we were done eating) and we asked for the check. The staff there appeared young and not very experienced, there were two hostesses and it appeared their job was to clear tables and clean the dining room... our server didnt seem to have a clue wondering around the dining room. We were there an hour due to the slow service... I noticed a lot of other tables sitting and waiting for boxes/checks. Anyways, the food, BF had shrimp and grits which is his usual... excellent as always, I took ONE bite and got a piece of shell, yuck. I had a BEC biscuit which was excellent.. the biscuits were defiantely made in house and super huge fluffy and delishious. It was too bad the service had to put a damper on our otherwise great meal

4OC0X0OKfsrrxuyPiWAQdg.text: Gourmet breakfast, delicious and inexpensive. Excellent service in nice atmosphere and free parking.

3CV-m6JlQOT0b2oawX6V-Q.text: Recently I went here for lunch and was optimistic when I saw the menu. I found the food to be good but nothing special and the service to be a bit on the slow side. I will go back, but I won't be a regular.

FMZPwb2KjnGk66--TW-cOw.text: Good job, Terrace Cafe and all who make you who you are.  As a connesiuer of fine brunch establishments, only Toast Cafe in Davidson delivers a comparable breakfast.  I applaud your effort and achievement in the breakfast arena.  The wait, which I expected, was worth it.  The decor was unconventional, a mesh of three themes, diner/cafe/loft.  Although you would wonder how those concepts can be welded together into one , Terrace Cafe you have pulled it off.

-0zB9reyBwfNeAD4Frzq9A.text: The food is good but the service is horrible. I went in there once and the server was so unprofessional me and my friends didn't even see him other then when he took our order, the server serving at the table beside us had to go get us our drinks. Then when it was time for the tab the server charged me and my friend for the same tab, I called back twice to tell the manager what happened the first time he told me to wait second time I got out on hold then hung up on. If you are gonna eat here just get the food to go. Me and my friend both have bank account statements to prove that we were charged twice. The server that we wanted to tip didn't even get the tip that we left for him because the server messed up while charging the cards. I am a broke college student and now I am $67 short. That was going to go towards my water bill. Never again. The server should get fired, he started cussing right when he got to our table smh. HORRIBLE service.

290hbNE-HKPsEl3bm90cVw.text: Ok, so we had been trying to get to this restraunt for a few months. We decided to go last night for my fiancee's birthday, and was that the biggest mistake we ever made? Yes. The night started off with ham and pimento cheese sliders which were so salty, I must have gone through 2 waters and an unsweet tea just to wash the taste out of my mouth. The barbacue sauce on the frenched chicken drummette's was waaaaaay to sweet and overpowered by the amount of ketchup and sugar they must have made it with. For dinner, the fried southern chicken came with green beans that had absolutely NO seasoning, mashed potatoes that were too salty, and gravy on the chicken that was salty. The filet came with a sauce on it that tasted like sh*t. I mean, there was no other way to describe it, and when I'm spending $25 on an 8oz filet, I at least want to be able to eat it. I mean, it was so disgusting. The sauteed mushrooms, I actually had to put salt and pepper on them. I have NEVER EVER done that at a restraunt. It's like they don't season half the food and overseason the other half. No balance anywhere. The dessert wasn't as bad, but how can you mess up a cookie? Especially one that Cracker Barrel also has but their's is way bigger and costs $5 less. The red velvet bread pudding wasn't that bad but it was way too thick and pastey. It was the WORST experience I have ever had with food at a restraunt. They need Gordan Ramsey so bad, wow. DO NOT EAT HERE. I'm paying for it today. O, and the waiter was so awkward, just kind of hovering around our table. Really strange.

xd9qeMrY-1sM_IApeFgu0A.text: A great place to enjoy a Sunday brunch with friends. :)

q1eBuyeUNwwhYnWEWTOtCA.text: Best breakfast we've had in Charlotte! The service was amazing!  The food was great! Kaitlin our server was awesome! Definitely coming back to eat again! Nothing like this from where we're from.

jKMPdOxRcGxCbkjFOZ2QIg.text: Went here for Sunday brunch recently. Little crowded. Had to wait about 15 minutes. Once seated the meal was quite enjoyable.  Fast paced service. Tried out the bacon bloody mary which was nice. Had the biscuits and gravy. Also was good. Would go here again.

bOy3d7vuGJpmJHaXqWCa0w.text: Awesome spot for breakfast brunch. Try the Red Velvet Waffle!

_11BJaEbxsKSsVsDXe8YRQ.text: I was expecting to be thoroughly impressed and I have heard so many great things about their Red Velvet Waffle. I went this past Sunday for brunch with a friend. And it was just okay. First of all the red velvet waffle just tasted like a regular waffle, it needs more cocoa in their batter to give more of a taste. At least their cream cheese syrup wasn't too sweet. Their hash browns could have used some seasoning. And the fried chicken, is really a chicken breast cut in half and battered and fried. I have had better brunch at the Cheesecake factory, Bistro La Bon, 131 Main, and Pike's Place. It just boggles my mind that there are so many good reviews when their food is just average. Also we ordered a hot chocolate and vanilla latte. The hot chocolate was just water with some cheap cocoa powder, I could have made a better hot chocolate with my godiva cocoa powder mix and the vanilla latte you could just taste a cheap vanilla abstract. I am not trying to be negative I am just keeping it very honest so others will not get disappointed like me. However, the wait staff was great.

hdTfxlyq2GByFkifVwby_Q.text: Warning:  Do NOT go here for breakfast.  Dinner is okay but breakfast is probably not a good idea.  I have to say that their mochas are tasty (when they are hot)

VafUO5X969fC64yRnQVvhw.text: Delicious food - Great Service at BOTH locations.  Breakfast ROCKS

fzNCc7HHvINw8JD1LlRa3w.text: I looooove brunch food. Usually our weekends I find myself at the stove making eggs with goat cheese and chives, but today I wanted to be lazy and have the hubby take me out. So we ended up at terrace cafe. From the outside it looks like a small store type place but the indoors is huge with an upstairs loft like feel! We had to wait a few mins so I got a mocha royal espresso athe bar and the huuby got the bloody mary! They were pricey but very yum. Once we were seated, hubby ane I quickly decided on shrimp and grits for him and the full breakfast (eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash browns) for me. The shrimp and grits were phenomanal. I might get the next time. My breakfast was good too....you can't really go wrong with the classics. The star on my plate was definitely the pancakes. Sooo good. All in all a good brunch experience but the drinks are a lil pricey for the size. Will be going back to try other meals.

GNWHqXSj4P9clIkRv8V6TQ.text: Great service and great food. I am picky with omlets but loved mine with spinach mushrooms bacon and scallions. Also we had the red velvet waffle, strawberry stuffed,French toast and sausage and cheese grits. Haha favorite was the fresh sausage and cheese grits. Try it out!

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

aOrhnXmia8jmtNArrGiIjQ.text: So this happens to be a popular place here in Charlotte and the parents were in town so we decided to take them here and they loved it.  I ordered the full breakfast which comes with a pancake, scrambled eggs, hash browns, bacon and fruit.  Well I substituted the pancake for the french toast and I was uber pleased with my decision (I'm not a fan of the pancakes, but mom's enjoyed them) and instead of the hash browns I ordered fruit and substituted the bacon for the chicken apple sausage (which is a hit BTW).  This place tends to get busy around 11 am so in order to beat the crowd, you have to get up!  They have a parking garage and all of the times I've dined here, never had an issue with parking.  One last thing, sign up for their rewards program and you will receive a free appetizer (however, you might want to redeem the free appetizer for lunch/dinner - which I have yet to try - but they have more to offer for an appetizer during those times versus breakfast).  Great to enjoy with family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Having breakfast with the family.

W_9_Sq4F1MXD1ZaNVCt4Cg.text: Wonderful - French toast was perfect. Only complaint is no butter margarine was used.

5ZD4MgfEJXcMh7W7knzAIQ.text: The food here was amazing ! Came out to Charlotte for a girls getaway and found this restaurant on Yelp! My friend and I decided to trip it out and was not disappointed. The first day I had the red velvet chicken and waffle with a side of hash browns. The one thing the set the waffle apart was the cream cream drizzle !! It was delicious. The chicken was cooked to perfection as well. My friend had the shrimp and grits ( which by the way was pretty good as well . I tasted some of hers. Nice flavor ) we decided to go the the restaurant the next day since it was close to our hotel and I had the chicken and biscuit with ghost pepper pimento cheese and jalapeno jam. Instead on placing the cheese and jam on the biscuit I asked for it on the side so I can place it on myself. However, the ghost pepper pimento cheese and that jalapeno jam on that chicken and biscuit was the right call!! It was one of the best chicken and biscuits I had .. ( chicken was cooked just right and the biscuit was good ) but it was the added extra that made it what it was !!! The server was very attentive and friendly even for a weekend. The place was extremely busy . If I ever visit Charlotte again I am going to make sure I come by this place!!

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

LZ6P-NZpJr2-j9gmqNGDQg.text: I just spent $13 on a mediocre waffle. I also got old bananas and my friend got moldy fruit.

9YpbjPP4ZosN5YF4SZuSzg.text: I recommend this place to all my family and friends.  Great spot for breakfast and lunch !

mOiU93k1z_8V-nWLLis8AQ.text: Came here on a Sunday for breakfast. We were seated immediately when we walked in at around 9 am, but it was definitely much busier when we left at around 10 am. Their benedict was okay. Poached eggs were slightly overcooked. Side of grits was very bland. The kid's pancakes were in the shape of animals, which is cute but they were also small. My favorite thing that I ordered was their white mocha. I could drink that every morning.

HHlwzuSSvD-spHiG6i1FKw.text: The first time I came here, it was for a Yelp event and at the time I felt the restaurant was five star potential. The service was on point and the food was good. However upon revisiting the restaurant a few weeks later, I can't say I can stand by that initial review. I think the first time I was there the restaurant was ready and was in stage. They had everything prepared. But that's not the way life is. My blended review would be to say the restaurant is a three star. I say that because on top of the wait, it took us forever to get our food. We sat there for 40 minutes with no food in sight. When the food did come out, the avocado put on one of the plates for garnish was rotten. Most of our food were luke warm and the service just want present. I might try this place again but not anytime soon.

K8kdL8bmVZdh2FUxFOZc8g.text: It's really good. The best part is that they have a dinner menu which has the red velvet waffle on it. So you can let the rest of Charlotte  fight it out with the lunch crowds, while you sit back and relax with a nice dinner without having to wait in any line.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Made in-house peanut butter fudge cheesecake.... I can&#39;t believe it&#39;s gluten free
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great prices

mzkXslBnn2UVjxkW9KV5Og.text: Neighborhood Gem... You're welcomed by smiling faces and quickly attended by their very friendly  servers ( Maureen, Corrine, Doug and Julie) just to name a few. Of course when they are busy you will have a wait which is well worth it. The menu choices are ample and creative and always satisfying ( Thanks Mark, EC). They are suggestive and always on the money with them. They have consistently fresh ingredients that always come through in whatever you have there. If you happen to be a frequent patron there you will feel welcomed as if you were family and friends each and every single time. Management is present and always checking in on you ( Thanks Mike) and making sure each and every experience is special and a good one for everyone that comes in. Thank you to everyone that makes our experience an AMAZING one every time.

YJ5WKexlABt1GSfWeMElsA.text: I decided to start writing reviews again. Here is the first one.  Not sure if the restaurant's name changed. I ate at Terrace restaurant for lunch 4 weeks ago while in town.   Food: chicken waffles - flavor is decent, but was dry BLT sandwich - Looked and tasted as if a 10-year old child made it Soup - Can't remember what type, but do remember it was lukewarm Steak fries - Had to chase down the waitress to get it. 5 (literally) bandage-size fries came out on a small worn-out side plate...  Bill - Waitress told us fries was included as a side, but then charged us $5. Had to ask her to remove it. 5 for 5 bandage-sized fries???

k7LJubAjs7cfSCjaQQkm4Q.text: This place is remarkably hit or miss. Usually miss. Particularly recently. I work across Fairview and have eaten here probably four dozen times for breakfast or lunch. When it's on, it's on - particularly for breakfast. Omelettes are not the best in CLT, but not bad. The waffles are impressive. And, for lunch, the Cobb salad is really good. There are many misses here though. The fruit is sometimes just not fresh. The cheese steak is flat out bad. The service is so-so: orders are regularly messed up. The decor is bland. As are the regulars, who seem to be mostly the sort of golf-playing sales guy that are so ubiquitous in Charlotte, making their sales breakfast quotas. It's just ok. And it's in a little office and restaurant center where everything is just ok to bad: it sits next to the flat out bad Brio, the mediocre Taco Mac, and the "why is it still in business" J. Sams. George's Brasserie used to be another "just ok" restaurant next door, but it's now (for good reason) recently out of business. Compared to the options immediately around it, I'd say this is the best choice. But that's not saying much.

RbMdRpcLSvP_nbx4WbBhHw.text: Popping into Terrace cafe during the early afternoon lull on a Saturday was (and is) a good decision. Previous reviews and co-worker experience frequently mentioned THE WAIT during peak breakfast/brunch hours. Thankfully, Terrace serves breakfast all day and I can eat breakfast any time of the day so being there during 'normal' brunch hours really doesn't mean much to me.  We were greeted by multiple staff members and seated immediately upon arrival. We were informed of the drink and food specials of the day and I decided to start off with a glass of pineapple-guava sangria. OHMYYUM. I inhaled this drink, it was so good. I wish I had written down the ingredients in order to recreate it at home...and I wish the glass was bigger.  I had a hard time deciding between the eggs benedict and omelet options so I decided to get some helpful advice from the friendly (and patient!) waiter Ian. I ended up going with the crab cake eggs benedict on a biscuit - per Ian's advice - with hash browns.   While I waited for the food to arrive, I took a peek at the other diners' meals and everyone else (well, it wasn't that many people) was ordering breakfast, usually one of the waffle dishes.   The eggs benedict was delicious! The crab cakes were meaty and the biscuit was a nice touch. I opted for the hollandaise sauce on the side and that was good too. The hash browns were crispy and came out already seasoned with salt + pepper.  This probably had a lot to do with the time of day that I visited but service was so well-paced and friendly. Oh as a random aside, I noticed that they keep stevia in the raw packets on the tables. I happen to use stevia in the raw on a daily basis for my everyday coffee so seeing it available at Terrace made me irrationally happy.  Terrace cafe was delicious and I really enjoyed my time dining there. I cannot wait to go back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake eggs Benedict on a biscuit with hash browns and hollandaise sauce on the side

e4bFKhH3JOhsT0d7UPFUVw.text: Oh my God. It was our first time here, and I can't say enough good things about this place. Easy parking, decent prices, beautiful mimosas, and delicious food! I had the Bavarian Cream Stuffed French Toast Sticks, and they were slightly crispy perfection on the outside. And soft and delicious on the inside. I got the fried chicken breast to go with it, and that chicken was the most savory, flavorful, juicy chicken or ever eaten. My wife had the Red Velvet Waffle with cream cheese drizzle, and it was adorable (very Instagrammable, lol) and soft, and delicious. We will be back SOON. Maybe before we leave Charlotte!

iC4PW2QEsGksucJW3-avgA.text: I was very disappointed with this restaurant! I waited 30 minutes to sit down! Then we ordered! The food came 30 minutes later! It was old! Three of the six people food never came! We sent the food back and it still came out cold! The manager admitted we would not be happy because it was his kitchen

mfnlAtcyLT7uwchtLm1lVw.text: Seth, my waiter, was super cool. Red velvet waffle, fried chicken & cheese grits are like Holidays status like yo very own mama or grandma took they time to welcome you home type meal!!

ZFU01RtMi4cdkTz9UsOFYA.text: The Southern Chicken Sandwich was the perfect combination of spicy & sweet. It is the best breakfast sandwich that I've ever had!   We went on Sunday for brunch which is a busy time. The waitstaff was slower than I expected and we had to wait for one member of our party to get their mimosa for 15 minutes while ours were served to us fairly quickly. We had to remind our waitress 3x that we needed one more. We were only a party of 4.   We were all satisfied with our meals but I think my dish was the best.

rDkxCPIKVVdY5aMu-4ULig.text: Overrated!  Big long line on Sunday and sadly, it wasn't worth the wait. Although was our waitress was nice, she was not attentive. The fried green tomatoes had no flavor. My crabs cakes were burnt and too salty. The hash browns were only toasted on only one side and the remaining were snow white!!  My turkey bacon was totally limp and undercooked. Mimosas had no garnish and no bubbles.

zvrsu5dmwuYYcUUT7l2WkA.text: Love coming here for breakfast. Never disappoints. Best biscuits and gravy in Charlotte. The staff is always friendly and have never gotten anything by great service. My go to restaurant for breakfast.

mw6oOVpptTiT9UPoGdc9YA.text: Love their breakfast. Came here for dinner on Saturday night and it was pretty empty. Ordered the crab cake hush puppies and they were almost burnt and lacked flavor. The gnocchi was ok, just a lot of pasta and not enough mushrooms. Would go again for breakfast but not for dinner again.

lK2epAcwZdAX9Jql6z3qyQ.text: If you have never experienced the red velvet waffle, you should! I have been here a handful of times and am never disappointed with anything that I have gotten! I've had there red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle...its amazingly light and fluffy and so flavorful. I also have had there Eggs benedict florentine. Its so good too, the hollendaise sauce has a whole-grain mustard in it which gives it a unique flavor. And last there bacon bloody mary is wonderful! What's not good with bacon in it... The staff is always friendly and the food never takes a long time. I recommend making a reservation though if you go on the weekend. They get busy, fast! This place is just plain good. I can't wait til I go back again! -SK

wifwgEct_lyiZnuAPK3g3g.text: Today was my second time eating here, and there will definitely be future occasions when I do so.  I normally like to go to a new place every time but this place is so tasty that I decided a return visit was in order.  On my first trip I ordered the monte cristo, which they cut into six small pieces and is simply outstanding.  Today I had the chicken and waffle, which was excellent.  The chicken was very juicy and the waffle is above average.  The coffee is very tasty, and the service is excellent.  My roommate ordered the shrimp and grits which were lovely, and today she had the biscuits and gravy, which were creamy doughy goodness.  I highly recommend this place.

xHV9t0471ItYiyBULnQphg.text: I frequent this place when I'm out on the weekends and want some breakfast/brunch. It's nice and the food is delicious. Most times I sit at the bar and they've been cool. Service has been great. Today though I couldn't because the competition for a bar seat was stiff. As I am waiting though I notice they were taking parties that came in after me. First 2 parties of two (one that put their name on the list immediately after me), then a party of 4. It wasn't until I said something about it that they decided to look for a table stating they were waiting for a two top to open. What do you mean? 2 parties of two that entered that door after me were just seated at a two and a four top. It would be one thing if they had call ahead seating but Terrace does not. Yeah I get that servers typically don't want to wait on a party of 1 but it's not about them. It's about the customer. Puts a bad taste in my mouth that they didn't feel they need to seat in the order I came in whether I was one or two ppl. I'd get it if I had 3 or more ppl and you needed a larger table but they literally could've sat me anywhere in the restaurant as a single party. Might have to find a new breakfast spot that's on my side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peach Sangria yumminess (is that a word?)

4xzm6LHC1EiPII7a0G5xVQ.text: Oh my goodness! I LOVE this place.  I have been there many mornings (FYI. Gets very busy on Sunday's after church).  There red velvet waffles are to die for! They are very friendly, get you seated reasonably quickly even when you have a decent size party and the service is great.

GwT-gHNnNLRycWrGYAJf2w.text: I'm referring only to the Ballantyne location. Nice people working there. . .that's the best I can say. Food is CONSISTENTLY INCONSISTENT. It comes out of the kitchen in various forms,  and not resembling the menu description. We should have returned several meals. . .we hate to spoil a night out, but we've given them several chances and like Forrest Gumps mom said "Life is like a box of chocolates.  .ya' never know what you are gonna get'.That sho' is the case here. Finito!!!!!!

5Wmon69csjCDCKouPWaKoA.text: I thought the food was absolutely delicious. I'm giving it a 4/5 because they wouldn't allow me to substitute the pancakes for a waffle when ordering the full breakfast. So I ordered the chicken and waffles instead and it was really good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. My friend had the velvet waffle with chicken also yummy and not overly sweet like I imagined.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles with hazelnut latte!! Really good.

tUZQ2ABJtHhRJFAbmKx1RA.text: Finally found a good breakfast place in Charlotte!  Came here for my birthday brunch a few weeks ago and all I have to say is that the Red Velved Waffle was pretty amazing! My boyfriend had an egg white omelet, which was pretty tasty and the French Press coffee was yummy too!  I cannot wait to come back and try the French Toast!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salted Caramel Latte, side    of pancakes and Y Veggie Omelet!  = Delicious!!!

nsEvdi-OA1SXu9bod-zHHg.text: So glad i found this place!  I am big on brunch and was looking for a new brunch spot in charlotte and this is certainly it! I had the red velvet waffles and they were absolutely delicious and very filling. Everything ordered at our table was great, i will definitely be back. A+ for the presentation as well, i love food that looks almost too good to eat  Highly recommended for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. red velvet waffles with fruit salad and hash browns.

xnsf3gGyfWVNXL1E-aAX3A.text: Mehh, I live right by piedmont row(walking distance) and I have walked by here on numerous occasions for walking my dog. I guess there has always been a good reason why I never tried this place. After coming here for lunch today with a friend, I am unimpressed.  We came during prime time weekday lunch hour at noon, but most of the cafe is empty...I'd say only 1/3 full. When we entered, we were greeted and seated promptly. I did like our waiter a lot, he seemed professional, good-command of the manner, efficient and courteous (epitome of a good waiter). My friend and I haven't seen each other for a while so we were busy chatting, he told us that whenever we were ready to order we just need to close our menu, that way he'll know we are ready so he would not have to keep coming by to disturb us. This is a very smart idea, more restaurants need to do this!! I ordered the 1/2 soup half sandwich of chichken salad on a croissant and italian chicken noodle soup. I was not very happy with neither the sandwich or the soup. First of all, they only have 2 soups for you to choose from, there is no soup menu, it is just whatever soup is designated for soup of the day. I've had way better chicken salad sandwich, the filling was pretty bland, I did not like the flavor. My soup was very greasy, it came out red, I've never had red chicken noodle soup.  My friend ordered the pimetto tomato sandwich with bacon with a side of fruit. Her sandwich also looked dry. The fruits that came as a side looked ok, but they are just fresh fruit, a combo of sweet melon, pineapple and large blackberry.  We ordered a lemon truffle to share for dessert. That was the BEST part of the meal. The dessert was very rich. I really like the layered presentation, the top is shredded pieces of lemon, then whip cream, then cheesecake, then lemon tart, then ground pecan. Awesome. I will be willing to come back here for dessert but definitely not for a full blown meal.  Also, they serve breakfast until 2:30PM.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Interior
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon truffle dessert

DUqDDQCeceLmQfDOYuP_xw.text: Red Velvet Waffle with Cream Cheese drizzle was perfect. I was worried it would be overwhelmingly sweet but it wasn't at all. It was surprisingly light, yet flavorful and I wanted more. I also got the chicken to make this more like a chicken and waffles but I wasn't a fan of the chicken. It was a piece of fried chicken breast. This wasn't a deal breaker for me. My hubs had the shrimp and grits and they were good. We will return here and it is a good place to try out.

Rn_lXVrw4KawphyfAvdwqg.text: This place has absolutely amazing food, probably one of the best overall restaurants I've been to in Charlotte.  My last visit I had the special Jambalaya, which was amazing. There was plenty of shrimp, the grits were cooked perfectly and the onion peels were a really nice touch.  The shrimp and grits are also great, however the Tuna is probably the best thing on the menu. The kale & cranberry salad complements the tuna perfectly.  Definitely would recommend to friends.

EbfLOmJ6YIcl5lPX69dBDw.text: The food was okay here. The service was what let me down. The waitress was really off beat. We were ready with our food order but she refused to take it. She gave us incorrect information about the menu... Just two examples from the many to choose from this night. We likely won't be back.

ijW82Yw3XOd92zAyQoQvyg.text: We generally try all independent brunch places on weekends to support local chef's. We are sorry to say we will not be supporting them again. Our wait wasn't long and the server was fine. However eggs benedict was TERRIBLE. Absolutely no flavor in the hollandaise  sauce and the meat had less. Come on meat in the south without flavor seriously.  Now this might not be what they are known for and you are thinking why would you go here if that was your order however when you go to a place that specializes in variety plates someone in the party might just want classics. I had the lemon poppy seed French toast. Very over powering and sweet. Even for me who will go out on a limb and try creative plates. OH coffee was good that is why the second star.

D5tHn0adbIlrolrnNNvYYg.text: Hello....anyone there? That's what we kept asking when we could never find our server. The food is pretty decent but the service is awful.   If you're looking for breakfast I would go somewhere else. An hour meal takes you almost 2. For breakfast! Would not recommend

0DqNM_SqO03W-V_9mLQthQ.text: I would have gave this place 5 stars but our server..was horrible. His attitude was very obvious that he did not want to be there. He gave us a couple of different names so we could not remember him. We asked what was good on the menu. He said I dont know! I only work the AM shift. Wtf? We came in after 5pm. But the food was.good. The ribs, crab soup were good.

jydzoaQ3KA8W5Iuky61ouQ.text: Came here for brunch. We were in town for the weekend and my sister happened to google this place because she wanted chicken and waffles. She ended up getting the red velvet waffles and chicken. I had the quiche of the day. It was made with sausage,onions,tomatoes,spinach, and cheese. It was fabulous.  Generally, it comes with a side of greens and fruit. I substituted the fruit for hashbrowns. Everything was wonderful. The food came out rather quickly and our waitress was very friendly. I would definitely recommend trying this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche of the day

c7LbkRbcrOQBxnC01VOHwA.text: This will be one of my staple brunch spots when I'm in Charlotte!! When we first walked in there was no wait on a saturday afternoon around 2pm and parking in the garage was free. First off let me say this restaurant provided AMAZING 5 STAR service. I went to brunch with my sister and cousin and our waitor so so kind, attentive, and quick! I ordered the popular red velvet waffle with chicken and cheesy grits! The chicken was really good and seasoned I pretty much forgot about the waffle lol it was about $17.50 for my food alone kinda pricey. I liked the chicken I don't think I'll get the waffle again. But all of our food was good!

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle with fried chicken and Cheese grits! $17.50

9wCSIeBVTP7BM4_EOgzOtQ.text: A local friend took me to brunch here over the weekend on a visit back to my old haunt, Charlotte. Terrace Cafe wasn't there when I moved away, so it was a nice change. We had a short 10 minute wait for a table upstairs.   It was crowded on this Sunday morning, and that was reflected in the very slow service. The food was good -- I had the steak and eggs with coffee.  The steak was delicious; the coffee too strong. My friend had another breakfast which she said was good.    I'll definitely eat here again on another trip to Charlotte, but will hope for better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

FYfrabPRh5qCNK8uNhhprA.text: The best chicken and waffles I have ever had! The wait on a Saturday morning around 11am was only about 20 minutes. My friend and I ordered the mimosa special for $8 and it was delicious! I decided on the chicken and red velvet waffles. Making it red velvet was an added cost, but absolutely worth it! The chicken was boneless and tender, while the heavenly waffles also came with a cream cheese icing sauce. I can't wait to go back for brunch soon!

pkpMJDF3G7YmtBX4icAC_w.text: Shrimp n grits!!!! WOW was this food excellent......great service, and the Piedmont center is beautiful. Such a refreshing change from Chicago. This was walking distance from my hotel, the Renaissance. The coffee was excellent as well; I tasted a salted carmel latte. The cafe menu is extensive, and the food menu had a good variety.  I also tasted the filet medallions and eggs meal, the steak was cooked perfectly and was tender. My shrimp and grits was the highlight, however. I got the sauce on the side (I do not like very spicy food, and that BBQ sauce WAS spicy), and it was perfect. The chorizo and fried okra were delicious in it. Such an innovative dish.  Next time I am in Charlotte, I will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Big breakfast
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

Ig6E99UzZSDKqezdrhDHxA.text: We came to Terrace for a Monday brunch and were left with a mostly average experience. I ordered the Stuffed Monte Cristo and my SO ordered the Chicken and Waffles.   The Monte Cristo was on the soggy side - so it made the sandwich hard to eat. The portion was huge, but the sogginess hurt the overall experience.  The Chicken & Waffles were great! They come highly recommended, especially if you pair it with their famous Red Velvet Waffle. However, the side of hash browns we both got were really disappointing. They were only crisped on one side, so the interior of the hash browns were soggy.  Get the chicken and waffles - but otherwise, look elsewhere.

CFoowhzcA14jBDnBFWR5qw.text: Food was pretty good. The banana bread French toast was delicious,  and the syrup wasn't overly sweet.  The chicken apple sausage was yummy too. Atmosphere is well lit, casual or dressy is fine.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full Breskfsst with Spinach and mushrooms.  Grits were pretty good too.

ntLtGKwx2HNas985b3pLvg.text: The breakfast was delicious! Raspberry pancakes with cream cheese was so good! Breakfast cocktails were the best ;)

Y58XZU5uyQtoI1kfds7Y1w.text: Great service- food was just ok. Waffles were overhyped but Breakfast is simple enough that I didn't mind.

dXH0ORGu8bnNcagHBsieYg.text: Good not great. Atmosphere, staff and service were great. I judge not just on food but whole experience. The food was pretty standard. The red velvet waffle looked amazing in pictures and in reviews, but I wasn't impressed. They weren't that fluffy or flavorful. Coffee was good, but I doubt we will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

2LzTOL_03TpTnPKvdp-1rA.text: My husband and myself with another couple came here this past Sunday for brunch. Very delicious and nice experience.  When we walked in, they had a 15 minute wait, which is not too bad for a Sunday brunch time. We were seated quickly and placed our order for drinks. The guys got French Press coffee. Only snafu of the day. Even after sitting for 5 minutes the french press coffee was the color of tea and had no coffee flavor. The waitress said there was new bar staff that day and they had been messing up drink orders all morning. Fortunately she switched it out for regular coffee for them.   My husband and I ordered an omelet with chorizo, salsa, and goat cheese with hashbrowns and a side order of biscuits and gravy. Our friends order the hash scramble of the day and a chicken and egg biscuit. The omelet was fantastic!! I also appreciated that they gave us some type of jam for the bread. It seemed and tasted homemade to me. The biscuits and gravy were definitely the winner though! Our friends even ordered one when they saw ours. Super delish!  Overall fantastic service and meal.

wDO7aFItne-FgX8sdX82iA.text: The red velvet waffle was excellent as advertised. Both my kids loved it. I had classic eggs Benedict and a side of cheese grits. The food was good, but not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict and cheese grits

Z-9E57Aa3qBHh1MUdhD8_A.text: Really good place. Totally worth the wait. Customer service  is excellent. Bar tenders are very welcoming. The bloody mary is really good and so is the food.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 story dining

kdas-Z30x3WRmVtOXP4plQ.text: Best brunch in Charlotte!  One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.   Food, drinks & service all fantastic

uWYsV7SFuzrpblRycnlZ1A.text: Excellent menus and service had the full breakfast wit a side of pecan French toast. Coffee was great. Didn't have to wait as we sat at a table near the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

5SQtbIIi-ehr06XyfALzIg.text: The food was delicious! The menu pricing was extremely affordable. They delivered the food approximately 5-10min. after we placed our order. I tried the "Lemon Poppy French Toast" and my friend had the " Florentine Egg Benedict." My friend loved her meal. Her eggs were a little more funny than she expected. I enjoyed my French toast; however, it felt like I was eating cake instead of an actual French toast.   The service was decent considering how busy the facility was. Unfortunately, they do not accept reservations so I'd plan to be there at least 30min.-1hr. prior to the time you are hoping to eat. I will certainly be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Florentine Egg Benedict
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Poppy French Toast

NdTi8xAFb8CysMVoMMGheg.text: Always delicious. Just get there early and have your whole party with you. Red velvet waffles were amazing...ask for extra glaze on the side. Hot chicken biscuit was very good...get the ghostpepper pimento cheese on the side...crazy hot. Very good service.

SB0H8VqwLuWkf63ryw3Jfg.text: I went around 11:30a so it was pretty busy but the place is nice. The atmosphere is dimly lit and relaxing.  Minus the sour faced girl who showed us to our seat, everyonw was really nice! When I was being shown upstairs to my table, a waitress stopped me to compliment my boots. The waitress that was assigned to me was very sweet and personable. I ordered the turtle latte which was not only delicious but nice to look at. The chicken and waffles were great! The chicken was pretty tender. The hash browns seemed a little undercooked but they came with the meal so I wasn't too upset. All in all, it was a great first visit.  I will definitely be back!

AEiw61--vvlw0VRcn4q0Pw.text: This place is so good! I come here a lot for brunch with friends. I usually get the make your own omelette and it is always delicious. I haven't tried the waffles yet but they always look delicious!!

2tDhCbHquDBjbQr2MfUa9Q.text: The food is excellent, but the Grits are the best I've ever eaten. All the staff are very courteous, and friendly. Once we ordered our Breakfast it arrived very quickly. Our Server Annette was excellent. Will return here next time I am in the area. Randy, Asst. Mgr. came to our table and asked if everything is okay. Good touch, that tells me they try to resolve any issues to keep the Patrons satisfied.

v9l4VJHiOJ5gP2zE06-fWg.text: Except for it being a little pricey I would recommend Stewart Penick's Terrace. The first time I Stewart Penick's Terrace was a couple of years ago for my daughter's birthday and every time there after the service, staff and was food was still good. There is a variety of of choices on the menu even for vegans. The owners came out to greet us. The only complaint in all my visits was the fresh fruit. So yes I would recommend Stewart Penick's Terrace for excellent service we have, good food and great hospitality just don't order the fruit unless it's in season.

4ivNZTlpIdLZ2y7n7TiLgA.text: Has Potential  The Terrace Cafe in South Park has a good foundation going but could use a little polish. The inside is decorated tastefully and the restaurant itself was clean. The waitstaff was very nice but it was slow considering the fact that it was a Thursday and the restaurant was somewhat empty. I ordered the Bavarian Stuffed French Toast Sticks, while the flavors and spices were delicious and it was cooked very well, there was very little cream inside the toast itself and only stuffed on one side. One out of the three sticks didn't have any cream in them at ALL. Second, I also tried the house made sausage which flavor-wise was amazing! But they were extremely over cooked and very very dry. My friend ordered the Red Velvet Waffles which I had a bite of, they were very good and well cooked so no real problem on that end. Has potential but could use a bit of polish around the corners.

r5txF0QJyss6ZEwJyTc3mQ.text: Special Thanks to Kerrin!!! She went above and beyond to get the price for a bottle of champagne even though it was not on the menu. The food was AMAZING as always. I ordered the carrot cake pancakes with a side of chicken (ahhhhh soooo Good) and my friend ordered the cinnamon swirl pancakes. Thanks Kerrin for your amazing service I will definitely ask for her next time I come!!!

goyz4Y1bscnpBNmLSILIbw.text: We went for brunch and got an omelette and a quiche. The food was pretty good. I would definitely recommend making reservations since it was very crowded.

BFhE2KP_tXq11FF_Q7u4_w.text: Heard alot of good reviews about this little brunch place. I was so excited to take my family to check it out. The atmosphere was very nice and cozy. Food and drink presentation was really nice. But unfortunately everything lacking in flavor. I ordered a cappuccino which didn't come until right before my food and it was just warm. I like my coffee nice and hot, so it left me wondering if it had been sitting for awhile before it was brought to me. Thank goodness my mom spoke up and they remade our cappuccinos. I love carrot cake and chicken and waffles. So I asked the server what was better their chicken and waffles or carrot cake pancakes. He convinced me to order the red velvet waffle with chicken. I was told previously the red velvet waffles were good so I went with the suggestion. My waffle was too soft and flavorless and the chicken was under seasoned. Everyone else's food was in that same category under seasoned. I was so looking forward to loving this places because we are moving to the area and it will be in walking distance. But unfortunately I don't think we will be back as often as I was hoping for.

SsPzrq4ItxiiA5x55Lw5tw.text: There aren't as many great places to eat in Charlotte, so the few that taste exceptionally good, are usually busier than the rest.   The Terrace Cafe gets super packed during the weekend brunch service rush, so get ready for a bit of a wait.  PROTIP: The tables in the front near the bar, in the waiting area are first-come-first-served; so if you want to avoid an hour plus wait, snag one of those seats.  Onto the star of the show: the food is pretty solid here. The red velvet waffle was delicious and would highly recommend adding the fried chicken to that order. Otherwise, the food is very much brunch-like foods.   The service was spot-on and we didn't have to wait very long for help. The coffee here is superb as well and tasty.  Pros: great food for Charlotte Cons: the wait during the weekend is absurd

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle, fried chicken and hash brown

TWf8ulogTYqcVxOQRe4djQ.text: Came here with my boyfriend a few days ago. There was a bit of a wait (~20 min for a table for 2) but it was absolutely worth it. The menu is really big and included options for vegetarians, which I really enjoyed. The place itself was really nice and the service was splendid. My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles which he LOVED and I had an omelette which was amazing as well. If you can ask for the biscuit, which was one of the best parts of my breakfast, simply deeeeeelisssshus.

3_oVKgPIovtXMvq2CULXPA.text: Confused as to why this place is highly rated. Solid 3 stars at best. Service was great, but the food was mediocre. Our selections (chicken and waffles, french toast, and some egg souffle) left us underwhelmed by the lack of "taste". Wouldn't  return.

e-cUkfe0t5DlUU8WO7AY_w.text: I visited here for brunch on my last trio to NC. The food was great. I had the red velvet chicken and waffles. A delicious take on the brunch favorite. I especially enjoyed the cream cheese glaze. I also tried the shrimp and grits. Pretty good as well. Although I was pleased with the food the service was not very good. The hostesses did not communicate well during the wait and once inside our food took forever. Our waitress only checked on us one time and for some reason they could not take the okra off the shrimp and grits. The lack of service overshadowed the food.

rRTIx2tIKqviGkVqN_PuEg.text: The service was very slow...but the WORST thing was this new policy they have about charging your credit card with a service charge. I was celebrating my sons graduation from college with my entire family and they gave me an additional service charge for using my credit card. The Terrace Cafe claims that many resturants are now doing it...I have never seen any resturant charge for using a credit card to pay....and there was no sign posted anywhere. Warning, before you go to the Tarrace Cafe, be aware they will charge you extra for using your credit card. I will never go there again.

jTrmJjSAIln12WySAcPkKA.text: The food  was ok but I'm not sure why they name their grits plantation grits , to me it's offensive .

UvJ4up8C3nprgnL0vzOavQ.text: I went her for lunch with a friend not really knowing what to expect the restaurant is clean and service is good the food is forgettable to me though I might have just ordered the wrong thing

76w-FvAQqek43FCmX1pQoA.text: This edition of "Excited about Eating" takes us to the Terrace Cafe located in the Piedmont Town Center in the heart of SouthPark. This multi-use Town Center features shops, restaurants, offices, and residential properties arranged in a walkable community. We arrived at 12:10 on a Saturday to a 75 minute wait. Honestly, we debated leaving but decided to wait and that was a great decision because it turned into a manageable 40 minutes. We had a great view of the industrial style loft area and the charm that comes with this type of structure. Terrace Cafe offers a wide variety of options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. While waiting, we noticed that most of the dishes coming out of the kitchen were breakfast. Although they looked appetizing, we opted for lunch. We started with an appetizer of Fried Green Tomatoes served with a warm pimento cheese dip. The Fried Green Tomatoes arrived quickly and were crispy outside and tender inside with a slight vinegary taste. They were great. Even my wife, who really doesn't like tomatoes, enjoyed them. I think they could serve the cheese dip on anything and it would be great. I ordered the Nashville Fried Chicken tossed in hot sauce and served over braised collard greens and mashed potatoes. The chicken was outstanding, crispy and tender, but the mashed potatoes took the prize as the best component of this dish. They were light and creamy with just enough lumps to let you know they were freshly made. The collard greens were a combination of sweet and vinegary, and tasted great. The portions were huge, and definitely not for someone who doesn't like heat as the Nashville hot sauce lived up to its name. Dora here. Definitely a "forehead slicker." lol. My wife ordered the Chicken Salad Croissant, a Hawaiian version of chicken salad on a fresh croissant served with lettuce and tomato and sweet potato waffle fries. The chicken salad, made with cream cheese instead of the normal mayo, included grapes, pineapple, pecans, and mandarin oranges. The sweet potatoes waffle fries were a first for us, but something we'd definitely order again. I finished off my meal with a Peanut Butter Cup Latte and my wife chose the Tiramisu Latte. Both were excellent and a great way to cap off our meal. Dora here. Lip-smacking yummy! Overall I would highly recommend this restaurant for someone looking for a unique restaurant offering exceptional food. I would rate this establishment 5 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving outstanding food. The restaurant was reviewed by Food Blogger Ernie Hiers. For other reviews see dorahiers.blogspot.com

4tjHcmBqSB6Z6ngsGaISTA.text: Atmosphere was amazing staff was friendly and the shrimp and grits were great. Also try the fried green tomatoes

oqhsYTulwGq8O2zoKZmZPQ.text: We had a terrible experience here today. Our server was rude and very inattentive. The food was not hot and was not good. While ordering we asked the waitress if they used shell eggs or powdered eggs and she claimed they used real eggs. It was obvious that the eggs were some type of egg beater/powder as the consistency was not those of real eggs. I would not recommend or return to Terrace Cafe. Our waitress was Carley.

bINIJVRfGpIB4_bqOoymGg.text: my husband and I came here on a saturday at about 12:45 and it was packed! we waited for about 45 minutes and were then seated. We started with the fried green tomatoes but when they arrived we had no silverware, then when we got silverware the fork was dirty. the tomatoes were okay. hubby loved them though. We got the eggs benedict, hash browns, cheese grits, and red velvet waffle. I wasn't a fan of any of the savory items and I usually like eggs benedict. Again, my husband loved it though. The red velvet waffle was the only thing that wasn't just below 'okay', it was delicious! If you like red velvet it's a must have. and it surprisingly wasn't as heavy as i expected it to be, it was perfect. I'll be back just for that and to give the other menu items a try

50jLbeP8OEBAULEUAGX_bA.text: Last weekend me and a few friends went here for brunch, visiting out of town. The atmosphere was amazing I didn't feel like unwanted there, the managers really helped out the servers there as well. Very nice place for brunch and it isn't expensive .. I will be back

aPt4hvkE5Pdpli2LDzn1VQ.text: This brunch was AMAZINNGGGG!!! I got a cajun shrimp omelet which was so delicious. The best part of all to my surprise was the strawberry jam!! I just wanted to take a gallon of that home with me.

qFwElTVgAevRwg4SCZW_zA.text: I really like this cafe. For once, a restaurant that exceeded my expectations. If I'm ever back in Charlotte I'll make a return visit for brunch.   Prices are right. Service was great. Food is done with care.  My mother ordered the beef soup and a half order of a turkey sandwich. The beef soup surprisingly came with collard greens in it, and the turkey sandwich was filled with grilled onions, melted cheese, chopped turkey, and crispy bacon.  I ordered the Egg Benedict Floratine and I appreciated the care that was taken with the dish. It came topped with crispy fried onions, and the spinach was correctly sauteed.   Only complaint is the chairs need an upgrade, and the lower level dining room floor plan could have been designed better without placing restrooms facing patrons as they eat.

Northing great or bad about it.  It was just French toast. I'm giving it more stars based on the ambience of the restaurant.

F7E3YaeRx6nzyaT68eBQ1Q.text: Hands down, this is a favorite breakfast spot! Red velvet waffle is too yummy!!! The pricing is fair and the service is good. On the down side, there us usually a long wait - especially on weekend mornings and the coffee bar isnt that great.

B-ZCxmNSWvlFDO5KTanqDg.text: Ok Terrace Cafe. The food was pretty good. The hash brown are shredded and they don't have any onions on them, I suppose you can ask for that if you wanted it. I ordered the steak benedict, the steak came out cooked the way I asked. Unfortunately it came out with scrambled eggs, I sent it back and it came out like it was supposed to. My friend ordered the strawberry and french toast, it was decent. The BLT "was good" "it tastes like a BLT." That was the feedback from the BLT. I ordered an iced coffee with the brown sugar flavoring. It was decent. Our server was slightly forgetful, he jacked up out order and it took him a while to bring things we asked for. All in all the consensus at the table was our food was good. At the time we got there we didn't have to wait, if we would have, I think the rating would have been lower.

Couldn't even drink the OJ ($4.15) because it tasted worse than what I drink at hotel vending machines. The wait was way too long so we thankfully grabbed bar seats. Really not worth the drive for my omelette and hash browns. Although their homemade jam was good on my buttered biscuit... the only highlight of my visit. And the good service.

Wl3PVIQSXj5tF9HwSGMl0w.text: This place has really good food, but not enough selection in my opinion. I came for brunch and was expecting to be wow'd however the waitstaff was a few fries short of a happy meal, if you know what I mean. Go for the food but disregard the service. I recommend it but would not come frequently.

T4Se8IyDCouUsTd3NYBe-w.text: I was excited to try this place because the pictures looked great however it left me a little disappointed. I took a seat at the bar while I waited for a table during a busy Sunday brunch. Service was good and I ordered a Terrace Bellini which was fantastic. After a little while, the table was ready so we were sat in the dining area. I ordered the red velvet waffle with fried chicken (which I had eyed hungrily while sitting at the bar with order after order of these going out) and my girlfriend ordered a build your own omelette with vegetables. My food arrived but it was a little cold and not as good as I had hoped. The chicken skin wasn't crispy but had good flavor. I tasted my girlfriend's omelette and it tasted like they hadn't used any salt at all. This place definitely has potential but they need to work on their execution.

lmF6TxC0B2EVbtGV110vPA.text: I'm such a foodie when I travel so I love to look for the awesomest creations when I'm out of town.  I was looking for a breakfast spot on yelp and stumbled upon this place, known for their red velvet waffle.  Yes please!  BF arrived here at almost 9am on a Friday and did not have to wait.  We were hoping to be in and out in less than an hour because we had a flight to catch.  Service was quick and on point throughout the meal.  Not only did they have red velvet waffles, but you could also order it with fried chicken!  So of course I had to get the fried chicken n red velvet waffle.  BF ordered an omelet with a side of fried chicken (one thing I love about the South: you can order fried food anytime of day!). My red velvet waffle was topped with cream cheese drizzle which complimented the waffle well.  The fried chicken was mediocre, but still a pleasant meal nonetheless.  There were a lot of other yummy breakfast options on the menu that looked pretty good too.  I may need to come back if I'm ever back in Charlotte for business.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle w/ fried chicken

3Xe2E5zis8wjYjwvGWG4dw.text: One of the best places in Charlotte for brunch. There is usually a wait time and they don't take reservations for brunch over the phone. Their food portions are huge and the coffee is amazing!

tSdtGb_TdwDV9HRE53FSlg.text: Stopped here for breakfast after a doctor's appointment.  I didn't realize the restaurant was as big as it is but they sat me at a 2-seater table that was crammed between two other larger tables and it was a bit uncomfortable.  They have a broad breakfast menu and I asked my server for a recommendation and she said everything was good.  Geez, that didn't help me much.  So I went with the "Full Breakfast" option which came with 2 eggs, meat of choice, side of choice and a small green salad.  Also came with a couple of pancakes.  My choice of meat was turkey bacon and the side was the hash browns.    The eggs were decent, the hash browns were made in a round patty.  The best thing was the crunchy outside and presentation.  The inside fell apart as soon as the crust was gone.  The turkey bacon was tough and the salad was a nice inclusion.  My pancakes were a bit rubbery and made me long for the ones at Toast.    Not a great first impression with the food.  But they get higher marks because my server was extra perky!  Presentation was wonderful.  And for your sweetener options, they have stevia.   Also on the menu are YMCA recommended options.  Might be worth another try if I'm in the area.  We'll see.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

z8MBkZfyXvLTjapCD2J-fA.text: I had the intention on going here and ordering the chicken and waffles... as soon as I saw they offered a RED VELVET waffle, my mind was made up. Red velvet waffles and friend chicken... weird? NOPE! It's a match made in heaven. I got a side of cheese grits and turkey bacon and cleaned basically every crumb off my plate. Also, do not get me started with their chai latte. Absolutely amazing. I swear I still have dreams about my meal, MUST come back very soon. Great service and even better food!!

856NwP1WFSrxYEeNy186qw.text: I think this is the best brunch place in Charlotte. They offer a wide variety of menu items and everything I have tried is outstanding. My favorites are the biscuits and gravy, red velvet waffle, egg casserole, and usually any hash special they have. The Bavarian cream stuffed French toast is all out of this world, though it is extremely rich. The red velvet waffle is very unique and delicious. It is perfect even for those who don't like super sweet, the cream cheese frosting drizzle adds enough sweetness to not need syrup but doesn't over do it. Really you can't go wrong with anything here. Drinks are great too! Service can be slow on occasion and there is always a wait, but in my opinion the food is worth the wait!
