sfHvF4BjpVdIHQ01Bo_cig.text: We went to this restaurant yesterday. The service and the atmosphere were wonderful. The food was also fantastic! I had the chicken and waffles and my friend had the red velvet waffles. Both entrees were very delicious! I really loved everything about this place!

qnWKnsAgxa09hvgIDWsrQQ.text: Unfortunately I did not have a chance to even place my to-go order. I tried to call and place my order, however the staff did not answer and the website would not let us order online. My co-worker and I decided to walk over and place our to-go order since we work in the same business park. Well it wasn't very busy plus it was after lunch rush hour. However, the host said we could place our orders at the bar. Well the lady at bar didn't acknowledge us and took another customer's order that came in after us. We decided to leave after that  bc we waited over 15mins. Now there was another waitress that appeared to casually standing and talking to the hostess and never offered to help us either. We ordered from Brio and returned to our office. Come to find out our  colleagues  had the same experience with customer service and decided to go to Brio as well. Terrace Cafe please work on your customer service. I've never had this experience at the Ballantyne cafe and experienced awesome customer service and food.

EG4tMjvKS4xBHD1RsEzXuw.text: Very delicious food. Love the atmosphere. I ordered the full breakfast and it was so gooood!

oR2-nYfKahkpD5rsQ5dgNw.text: A must for breakfast! The staff is friendly, the restaurant is very clean, and food is always fresh and delicious! There is typically a wait on Sunday mornings but if you're willing to wait it's worth it.   Try the omelette and red velvet waffles!

JbbNwvmF9Y2qqR8fSiBtqA.text: Oh what good Breakfast food!  Great stop after the Saturday morning Farmer's market.  Or stop before the mall opens.  Did both this morning.  Breakfast casserole is my go to.  Unbelievable pancakes...dare you to finish the plate!  Great grits, omelets or just standard breakfast plate.  Wonderful wait staff too

dGuRCJV66l-K7flfrwEgaA.text: I love this place! I loved that we were able to grab bar seating on a Sunday at noon the moment we walked it. We were able to "skip" the line because of bar seating. YES! I felt awesome because of this. Bar seating was definitely a great experience especially for our first time at Terrace Cafe as the bar is right next to the kitchen. I can see the chefs working hard to ensure that the plates of food are set correctly before sending them out to patrons to enjoy. I enjoyed observing the chefs work while I enjoy my meal.   FOOD - Steak & Eggs || two perfectly cooked filet medallions, two eggs, and choice of either grits or hash browns -- I ordered both. I requested my filet medallions to be medium and they were just perfect. I ordered my eggs over easy and placed them on top of my sliced and toasted croissant. I was scared my hash browns were going to be soggy and not crispy so I ordered them to be well done or extra crispy; however, I found out that this is not needed as mine were too crispy. The Steak & Eggs were just perfect. It's a must order. I'm craving it at this moment! - Eggs Benedict - Filet || two filet medallions, two eggs, and hollandaise sauce all on top of biscuits with a side of hash browns. Very nice twist to eggs benedict. If you're craving steak and eggs benedict at the same time --- you should try ordering this.  - Long Island Peach Tea || Adult Drink -- very good and very strong. i love the twist that they have to the traditional Long Island by adding Peach flavors. - Pineapple Guava Sangria || Adult Drink -- this drink was very light as it only has white wine and is mixed with lots of fruit juices like guava and pineapple. Something you should order if you're looking for a light adult drink with your meal.  SERVICE/AMBIANCE/LAST NOTES Service was impeccable. I know we sat a the bar and service should be the best since we are right next to the kitchen, but I can see that if we sat at a regular table, our service would be impeccable as well as you see the servers working hard to get food out to patrons. The restaurant is surprisingly very spacious as there are tables upstairs and downstairs. Parking is free as you can park around the complex. If there is a wait, please see the hostess, give your name and phone numbers and she will text you when you're table is ready.   Overall, this is my favorite restaurant by far this weekend and I will definitely come back to visit Charlotte because of Terrace Cafe. Many friends suggested that I should try the Red Velvet Waffles with a drizzle of cream cheese -- which I will try on my next visit as it is a very popular item!

V03kJSYpKj-iiHleurQeMQ.text: I think everybody in Charlotte already knows how great Terrace Cafe is but I'll still go ahead and remind you. Once again this morning, my breakfast here was 10 out of 10 as well as the restaurant itself and the service.   The food was fresh and it was served very quickly despite how many people that was already there. I had the famous red velvet waffles and chicken, with hash browns. The mimosa was tasted great as well.   All in all, Terrace Cafe is still my favorite breakfast spot in Charlotte.

BVxDcgKGlRO1Z-hAjNb7JQ.text: Whenever I say Terrace Cafe, someone always goes "ooo I heard that place was good" or "omg that place is so good!" I have recommended the place to many ppl. Just be warned, there is always a wait, especially for Sunday brunch.   The food I have had and not one has let me down:  Chicken and waffles Red velvet waffles Steak and eggs Shrimp and grits  Chicken burger French toast Chicken wings  Service is always exceptional as well.

-vIHd48XvwqUDvp1UXDmTQ.text: I went here for Sunday brunch last weekend with some friends. I've been to Charlotte many times before but never tried this place before but read good reviews about it! There's a parking deck right beside the restaurant which was very convenient. It was a 45 minute wait but the area the restaurant is in was very nice and it was a nice day outside so we decided to just walk around while we waited. After about forty minutes we got a call that our table was ready. The inside was very nice and quaint. There is an upstairs area that allows for more seating. I ended up getting the red velvet waffle with chicken and a side of fruit. Also I was stuck between getting the dueling mimosa and the regular mimosa. I asked the waitress and she told me the dueling mimosa really wasn't that great and recommended the sunshine mimosa so I ended up ordering that and it was great! Also my food was absolutely delectable!!! The chicken was boneless and very tender and well seasoned. The waffle was soft, light, and fluffy and the fruit was ripe and not too ripe! All in all, this place is a great brunch spot with delicious food!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle with chicken and side of fruit

NAfVRU3XgcChUpTCEshdDg.text: Great souther brunch and lunch in charlotte. Things to try- 1. Shrimp and grits. 2. Coffee cake- really amazing! 3. Kentucky fried chicken. 4. Red velvet waffle  The service is good. Weekends are packed with people so be weary of that.

0cv7GgoWMNrIgao797jtVQ.text: I wish I could give zero stars as our experience was not good.  We arrived early on Sunday so there was no wait. Our waitress came over quickly for our drink orders and then disappeared for about 15 minutes after giving us our drinks. We did not receive refills our entire meal. By the time we received our food it was cold. The red velvet waffle is overrated but it probably would have been better if it were hot.  Our waitress never came over to check on us or to ask how we were. We had to ask another waiter for ketchup.   We ended up waiting for our check and when we tried to get her attention, she blatantly ignored us. I would not return to this restaurant and I am glad we didn't have to wait for a table.

ehl0i20QKqfaE2fG5h4_wg.text: Terrace Cafe has a quality brunch menu.  The food is well seasoned and flavorful.  They are located in a nice walking area if you want to get a few steps in before or after the meal.  Their crab cakes eggs Benedict is my favorite dish on the menu.  Always delicious.  I've heard the red velvet waffles are amazing so I can't wait to try them on my next visit!  They have amazing shrimp and grits.  Be careful if you don't eat pork, they do put sausage in it.  I always substitute mind with the chicken sausage instead and it still tastes amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order everything!

hRXgqsClVUNHG4qIcwTJEg.text: Where to start with this place. First, the ambiance when you walk in is top notch. The layout is great with plenty of seating both downstairs and up. We sat upstairs and had a great view of the restaurant. The food is incredible. We ordered a variety of items all of which were comparable (if not a bit better!) than some of the eclectic breakfast joints in Asheville. Between the three of us we shared the red velvet waffle, banana bread French toast, bacon egg and cheese biscuit, and the egg and cheese biscuit. All were some of the best we've ever had. We will definitely be coming back to the terrace cafe. It is a must stop while in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

KUGr-hHdpaQDsCqB7Ew7Hw.text: At terrace cafe its become so popular that there's a wait! What a great problem to have. I would say the quality of the food is still top notch, the hospitality is really good and the service is good. If I had to say anything negative its the fact that this particular visit we didn't receive place settings until our food came! Thats all! This is a great spot for brunch!

A7cTONAjfpMZoi2PZ35VKQ.text: The Ballantyne location is my favorite and their Red Velvet Waffles are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana French Toast
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omlet
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle

yj9GX0zm34XYsttli_7kXg.text: Tried probably one of their most popular item - the red velvet waffle with chicken and hash browns. The waffle was definitely worth the hype. The cream cheese drizzling makes em extra yummy. You can always ask for extra cream cheese . The chicken was the regular fried chicken. The sunshine mimosa had lesser alcohol than normal mimosas, which for some reason felt good.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunshine Mimosa to start the day!

zcciXCQ_wSuw_B3EDrzE-Q.text: Super cute, well decorated restaurant. Was more upscale and put together than typical breakfast places without the stuffiness. Had a cute upstairs seating area as well that overlooked the bottom level. There was also a small bar area too. The parking deck was right beside the restaurant and provided easy parking and access to the restaurant. Also appreciated that they text you when your table is ready.   FOOD:    I got the spicy chicken biscuit with hash browns (I added the peppers and onions to mine for $1 extra). And it was okay. The biscuit was awkwardly large and crumbly to eat like a typical biscuit, would have been better suited as an open face dish. But the flavors were good, was a little spicier than I had anticipated. My boyfriend ordered the full breakfast and absolutely LOVED it. He isn't a huge pancake person but said those were some of the best pancakes that he had ever had!  SERVICE:    The two hostesses at the front were very friendly and gave a very good first impression. Our waitress was nice, and did a good job. Nothing over the top. The manager did come over and check on things, which is always a nice touch. I feel that the manager coming around isn't as common anymore.   OVERALL:   It was a nice, enjoyable breakfast. Will we be back? Yes! Will I order the same thing? No, it was good just not amazing and would like to try some of their signature waffles next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

lqTfZmGEpmywiUX7ArTg8Q.text: Every Sunday I try to convince myself to branch out and experience a new brunch place in Charlotte. And every Sunday without fail I'm back here again. I just can't get enough of this place. The Bavarian Creme Stuffed French Toast and Red Velvet Waffle are currently dueling for top spot on the sweet side. The Southern Biscuits and Gravy reigns supreme as far as savory is concerned.   The food is 5 stars all the way, but the service has often left something to be desired. Granted, I'm going during what I imagine is their busiest time on their busiest day of the week, but I always feel a bit like an inconvenience to the wait staff.   I also struggle to understand a brunch place that doesn't incorporate bacon as a preset side, particularly with their sweet dishes. When asked if the hash browns or grits that accompany the waffles could be switched out for bacon, I've always been told no, not even for an extra charge. And $4.25 is just too extravagant a price for a few strips of bacon.    Apart from those aspects though, I've always left overly full and overall pleased.   Pro tip: if visiting on a Sunday at prime time, put your name on the list and walk around the corner for a manicure at Cachet. By the time your nails are drying, you should be getting a text that your table is ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Biscuits and Gravy, Cheese grits, and the Red Velvet Waffle

qD25JlvRJlzIEPxkjO-nQA.text: I came here on a Saturday morning with my girlfriend for breakfast for the first time. The service was great.. since it was a Saturday morning I was expecting a long wait but that didn't occur...we were seated immediately and within 5 minutes we were greeted by our waiter...our food came pronto once we order and everything was really tasteful.. I enjoyed my blueberry vegan waffle.. vegan chorizo sausage paired with a pineapple mimosa..prices were in reason and great proportions. I will for sure come back here for another meal

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. First time here and order the vegan breakfast.. blueberry waffle w/ a vegan chorizo sausage
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

PGmWr2J7u5k_vMb7D00Ulw.text: I've been here for brunch a few times. It's always busy so get there early if you can. It's usually always a wait if you're going Saturday or Sunday mid morning through the afternoon. I've been to both locations but the South Park location by far is the busiest. I didn't find their breakfast to be anything super special. I ordered the chicken and waffles a few times. I like my chicken a little more seasoned but it wasn't bad. It's cool you can order drinks at the bar while you wait. I like how there is seating upstairs as well. Parking is plentiful in the garage.

q93hNo3huDxhktXVrzCqpQ.text: Come here all the time. Terrace Cafe offers some of the best breakfast around. Grant it i always get the same thing when i come here which is the red velvet waffle and chicken with a side of grits. Everything is indescribably good! I brought my father and daughter here my dad had never been here before and he scraped his plate pass cleaned. So i take it he likes it as much as i do.Saturdays are always one big party here, i have never came here on a Saturday and didn't have to wait. You will have at least a 30 minute wait on Saturdays guaranteed. On the weekends they don't allow reservations because of this reason they are very aware that Saturday is pretty much one of their most bustiest days. I salute the breakfast, team, and staff here at terrace cafe this will always be a breakfast home for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle n chicken w cheese grits
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

FYwsb7XEZN_jHQXOx9aUjw.text: I really enjoyed my breakfast here. My server was very attentive, the views from the second deck were nice, and the overall atmosphere lent to a pleasurable experience. I had a fruit covered waffle with cream cheese drizzle and a bowl of fruit, and quite enjoyed it. A tad pricey, but that seems to be the price point in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. This waffle (special for the day) was exactly what I needed this morning.

klSQ5oxiGqGVHjgGv1k6xQ.text: Terrace was pretty good! Though the restaurant is pretty big, This place gets super crowded on the weekends for brunch so I suggest going early. I am not sure if they take reservations.  I ordered the chef's special skillet.... amazing! They give you a ton of food and prices are reasonable. I will def be back next time I'm in Charlotte!

DWdiqsWr7qFGbw-LgjEqug.text: This place is off the hook good. All your brunch, lunch or breakfast needs should be graded for the city of Charlotte based on this place. They are the bar. They are standard for greatness. If you've ever been to a restaurant and afterwards judged every meal based on that experience...then you'll know this is the place to eat. I had the red velvet waffles with chicken. My my my...it was good. The hazelnut latte was outstanding. My fiancee also enjoyed her meal. Thank you so much to all staff at this place, especially the chef.

WnmOSAEtAg_eaVOfSpSnOA.text: From the look of the place I thought the food would be better. Why a 2 instead of 1? Because at least my friends had better food, and the hostess was a nice girl.   1) I don't know why the waitress did not like me, but she was curt to me. She was not with anybody else at the table. My friends did not appreciate that either. When I ordered my food, she did not let me finish what I was saying. My boyfriend had to basically tell her I was not done ordering.   2) What I ordered was not as advertised. Don't call something Nashville hot chicken, or chicken with Nashville hot sauce when all you did was use buffalo sauce. I have actually had great Nashville hot chicken and this was not even close. There was not a hint of Nashville sauce on it. My fries were also cold.   3) I ordered the dueling mimosa. I saw the pictures of it and mine did not even resemble that. What I got was a plain mimosa. I was very irritated about that, and my fries being cold.   I will not be back here. If the waitress was not rude to me, maybe I would consider it but that was not a good experience for me. If you have mediocre food, your service better be perfect and this was far, far below that.

7rNRD-p0SQVA9Q06x78TiQ.text: Absolutely AWFUL!!! Do not waste your monies here!!! Food is bland, over-priced, and extremely greasy. The restaurant is filthy, and the service is below average. Believe me, you're much better off going to IHOP in comparison to this place. Thank me later.

Ijn0dOJ3p38L7Ano7dpc6Q.text: Delicious chicken and waffles!   I totally get the hype of this place, it's very cute with great service and even better food. The waffle was delicious, especially with the soft butter they serve it with. And the fried chicken was surprisingly good-- I'm picky about chicken and am always worried it will be too dry, but this one was really juicy and flavorful.

r9FfCmbIXDrOrQcpDp7Uwg.text: Oh boyyyyyy!!! I usually LOVE Terrace Cafe as my breakfast spot. The sausage egg and cheese biscuit is amazing and it typically take about 10 mins. Enough time to call it in and wake down to get it. Usually I can call it in and place the same order with the same waitress/bartender. Perfection! Today I decide to go grab a cup of milk to have with my breakfast. I walk in with a co worker and ask the waitress for a cup of milk. She said "Ok, $4.87"...as I'm reaching for the $3.00 cash I had in my pocket.  I repeat back to her.."did you say Four Dollars and Eighty-seven cents?" I was hoping since she had just made a messed up on the order before mines and she was clearing have a bad day, that she was wrong. Nope, she continued to grab the 16oz(at the most) cup and the gallon of milk. I quickly said oh nevermind. And walked out. Who charge $4.87 for a small cup of regular/whole milk...a gallon is $2.50 with tax in any grocery store. To Panera Bread I went($1.79).

vnX7dbiX-3AeAl0lORr6jg.text: We arrived around 10am on Saturday and there was 1 party ahead of us. We were seated promptly and service was helping us within 5 minutes. I ordered steak and eggs and it was SO GOOD! 2 steak medallions are served and they are well SEASONED!!! Loved that the food didn't taste bland. What I really enjoyed was the hash browns were seasoned as well. GREAT TOUCH! Will def recommend and be back

9f0rCyyFSubXTv99zlPKmw.text: We've been here twice. Both times there was a wait, it seems as if there is ALWAYS a wait on a Sunday late morning/early afternoon. The service is nice. The food is great. The first time we had the stuffed french toast. IT WAS AMAZING! When we returned, it said they were french toast sticks, not sure why they changed it. Also, the first time we had the chicken and waffles. IT WAS AMAZING! The chicken was fried to perfection and the waffle was so yummy.   This recent time we ordered the Lemon Poppy french toast, which tasted more like a pound cake, but it was AMAZING! We also ordered the special for that day which was a chocolate chip waffle, with white chocolate drizzle. I was also amazing and not super sweet or chocolatey.   This is in our Yelp "Favorites" collection.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

VnuJ9Vd63_ZsIfv1OEj92A.text: Food: I ordered the Shrimp & Grits (gluten free) and it was a life altering experience. I walked into Terrace as a broken man. The Shrimp & Grits put me back together   Service: very friendly despite how busy they were   Will I come back? YES

nh7l42XLhr8QxQNoSMZI0A.text: This is one of the best brunch places in Charlotte! Amazing food and service! The crab Benedict won't disappoint!! -Ronnie

bjLQ1lhFbBo5HFLySSzCSA.text: This is a great place for brunch. On Sundays, the line for a table is super long, but luckily for me, my boyfriend made reservations. We were immediately seated and our orders were taken. Although the waitress took quite some time to bring our drinks, the customer service was overall good.   I ordered the red velvet chicken and waffle with a side of cheese grits. The red velvet waffle was really good and the cream cheese icing on the waffle was not overly sweet, so it was perfect. The chicken was crisp and well seasoned. I asked for cheddar cheese on the grits but I could tell that it was American cheese, but it still wasn't bad... I ate all of it. The peach moscato punch i ordered Was terrible. It almost tasted like a mildly flavored beer. the red velvet  waffle itself was $11 but if you get chicken added that's an additional $6... I find this strange because generally people order chicken and waffles together so the up charge shouldn't be so high but other than that, I have no real complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peach moscato punch
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle and cheese grits
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

3QT-OXzHRo6cZFJMgp2IPQ.text: The food here is good. However, maybe the worst hostesses I have ever seen!   Terrace employs 3 hostesses on weekends however, at one time my husband and I counted 10 open tables . We looked down and saw the hostesses just checking their phones, literally  no cares in the world- as more guests come in- one explains that there is a 25 min wait (huh?).  One 4 seater remained empty for the enitre hour my husband and I were eatting, yet there  are like 15 people outside (including toddlers) in heat desperately waiting to sat in nice cool AC. I was a hosteess for many years and don't feel that it was explained to these girls that  servers can't make money unless you seat their tables. These girls are costing this resturant and it's servers money, in this economy not a joke.

yXY9hYW95EMGlNQvYGsBPw.text: Came for brunch on a Sunday around 930am and it was perfectly open with tables available. We walked in and were seated immediately. I've been to the Ballantyne location several times and have loved it.   Ordered the BBQ Chicken quiche for my entree and where I can say it had great flavor, it definitely lacked in structure. Think it was just a matter of being cooked long enough, but it was definitely falling apart. Also, the dressing on the salad as a little wonky. I did love that the fruit on the side had the option of being all berries. Big plus.   The rest of the meal was stellar per usual. Killer oatmeal, hashbrowns, orange juice, and silly, tilty glasses.   Keep it rockin', Terrace. You've got a space in my heart. Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hash browns
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ chicken quiche

NcQW-vuDHym5ZzOoNZj5TA.text: Ate here for breakfast this morning. My mom and I ordered the lemon poppyseed French toast and the breakfast casserole with cheese grits and split them. The lemon poppyseed French toast was amazing! I will definitely order it again! The breakfast casserole was very underwhelming- there was nothing special about it and it was quite bland. We both took a few bites of it and left the rest on our plate. The cheese grits tasted decent, but had a film over the top as if they sat out for a while. Our table was pushed against the dining room wall- and we noticed the wall could use a good cleaning as it was pretty dirty with splattered food/beverages that looked to have been there for quite some time. Overall, our experience was good, not great, and if it weren't for the delicious poppyseed French toast I'd probably give this establishment 3 stars.

JYj1I2gEzZhbJIjTzTk6GA.text: Maybe I came on an understaffed day or a bad day in general. I arrived on a beautiful Wednesday around noon craving breakfast after reading the rave reviews. The decor was lovely- the general ambiance was very intimate and upscale without being stuffy. The hostess and server were okay. Not the nicest and friendliest but not the worst service either. Downfall was that it was extremely loud even though we were seated upstairs.  My boyfriend loved his bacon waffle with fried chicken and a side of fruit. He wished that there was more bacon inside the waffle, but he did thoroughly enjoy it. I had a lot of problems with my food. I ordered a cappuccino (yummy!), the strawberry pancakes, side of fruit, and 2 sunny side up eggs. I could tell my food was ready first and sat for a while because the strawberries inside the pancakes made the pancakes soggier than they should have been- they were also lukewarm but I was starving so I just ate them. My eggs were also stone cold and I had to send then back. I can't comprehend how kitchen staff can send out cold eggs; sunny side up eggs are the easiest type of eggs to cook! After waiting so long on my meal the first time, I didn't even want to waste more time getting a replacement side for the eggs. Our meal came out to $32 which wasn't too bad at all.   Maybe I'm a little biased since I work in a restaurant myself and am super critical due to that. I've had a better breakfast at IHOP than here and that's saying a lot! I will probably try to come here again on a weekend and try to get the amazing, delicious food that everyone else has enjoyed since I have apparently missed out on a good thing.

F6Up__6Mf7P-PjZKCd8rXA.text: This is well worth the wait and drive: the red velvet waffles are amazing and the eggs Benedict tasted fresh and delicious. The drop coffee and fresh orange juice were great compliments to the sweet and salty meal.   Highly recommended for the atmosphere and the food. Service was a tad bid slow but  we went at prime time on a Saturday and that is expected. Everyone was extremely nice and helpful though. On par with my favorite places in Cali...enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tastes as good as it looks.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

GFUt85ARLhx_HAbWWjiO1A.text: Had the famous red velvet waffles and chicken with fruit salad. It was delicious and the fruit was fresh. Absolutely no complaints.  Meant to review last time I went, this was actually my third time going and I will be back again for sure.

lfRBZaIFDA3iQHMP_SR6xQ.text: Thanks to Yelp, I got a chance to check this place out during restaurant week.  This place is really tasty and I can't wait to check out brunch sometime!  Here's a breakdown of what we got to try:  Fried Green Tomatoes (4/5): Great level of crispiness in the batter, which was a little plain-tasting.  However, the pimento cheese served with them adds a great touch and makes them much more flavorful.  Biscuits (4/5): I love that they are served with some sort of pepper jelly.  They are so tiny, maybe 2 inches in diameter.  They were not dry and surprisingly flaky.  Blue crab bisque (4.5/5): Very rich and flavorful.  Full of great crab flavor.  The sherry really complemented the flavors.  Wedge salad (3.5/5): The bleu cheese is relatively smooth in this, so I appreciated it.  I loved the crispy red onion - they were the BOMB!  However, it's a little too much wedge and not enough of the delicious toppings.  Terrace fried chicken (4.5/5): The fried chicken was excellent!  The batter was great, it was a good size, and the gravy was fantastic.  The mashed potatoes were rich and creamy, just how I like them.  The collard greens were good as well, and they reminded me of these fantastic ones that made me fall in love with cooked greens.  Chicken and Waffle (5/5):  Ok, this was seriously amazeballs!  The watermelon salad paired so well and was so refreshing with everything.  I could have eaten a whole plate of this alone.  The waffled and chicken were good on their own, but then came the red hot syrup.  Holy guacamole!  It had the perfect level of spicy sweetness that just brought the whole meal together.  This is my favorite chicken and waffles dish I've ever had.  We also ordered drinks, and mine came out a great electric green, which ruled.  Since we came on a weeknight, it wasn't too busy, which was fantastic.  I am glad I made a reservation just in case, though.  The service was good, but some weirdness came when the bill got there.  I had a gift card for $60 and with the drinks it should have come up to around $75.  However, the bill was around $85.  I called the waitress over to ask about it, and she never really gave me a very good explanation about what the extra charges were.  It was not added gratuity because I asked.  I did not see a manager or anyone else around, and by that time we were headed to a movie we did not want to miss.  It never did get resolved and I'm pretty sure we got overcharged.  I would just caution people using a gift card to watch out what the final bill ends up being.  This was very annoying.  Still, the food was good and I think I would probably come back.

GhTHxAJ97rgn5II7Lbe11Q.text: I looooooove the Terrace Cafe! The only downside is the ridiculous wait on Sundays (often 1/2 hour or more with almost non-existent seating for the amount of people who are waiting).  The food is so delicious and I HIGHLY recommend their coffee drinks - I always get a Black and White (which I think is a regular mocha and a white mocha combined).  A+ (but seriously, guys, figure out a way to make the wait less crazy -- maybe a bigger location?)

WfAN7ysGfBQ3HAbFKsLSPA.text: This place has been on my bookmarks for the longest time.  Whenever it is expected for you to have a wait for brunch, seems like they have a good thing going here.  Overall I was pretty impressed with the place despite all the buildup and anticipation I had.  Our group of 5 was seated after about 45 min of waiting for a table (the hostess was actually dead on with the wait time which was pretty impressive).  The unfortunate thing about Terrace Cafe is that they do not take reservations, you can call ahead if your party is more than 6 people (we were almost tempted to grab someone off the street to eat brunch with us to save us on time, but that didn't happen).  After we were lead upstairs on the terrace level to a wide booth, our server got our drinks and went through the specials.  It took us a while to decide on food but when you want to try everything on the menu, it's a good problem to have.  You could tell that the servers here have to work their butts off due to the stairs (I'm assuming the kitchen is all below the terrace level seating).  I had the Southern Sausage Benedict... and I about had to change my pants once I cut into the perfectly poached egg and watched it soak into the muffin and sausage below it.  My plate was cleaned in about 10 minutes and I was full to the brim.  The other (slight) downside is that we were looking to get mimosas and get our drink on, but we forgot about NC laws that prohibit the sale of alcohol before noon on Sundays.  DOH!  A slight hitch in our plans, but we just rolled with it.  Next time we'll just meet "later" but it seems like the crowd doesn't really die down.  We were trying to beat the church crowd, but I think everyone else had that same idea as well.

LX9vATBaQ9cExiNPBgWeWQ.text: I heard about Terrace Cafe not from Yelp or friends in Charlotte but from a friend in Texas and my sister in Indianapolis. When both of them mentioned Terrace Cafe's Red Velvet Waffle, I knew a meeting with said waffle would be in my future.   And today was that day. When I rolled up to Terrace Cafe, it was right before the churchie crowd and for some reason, I was expecting them to have a huge patio but no dice--just an inside dining area with an upstairs and downstairs.   I shouldn't have even looked at the menu but did against my better judgment and started to feel conflicted. I've been wanting that damn red velvet waffle for the past few months but then I started to see other tasty items like S'more french toast, a variety of eggs Benedict, etc but stuck to my guns and got the waffle.   It was everything I dreamed of and more. And from fear of going into sugar shock, I finished 3/4 of it and threw in the towel.   I had a skim latte which was smooth and light and priced the same as a Starbucks latte. The french press wasn't too shabby either. Service was fantastic and right on point. I definitely recommend this place for brunch--be sure to get there early though--they don't take reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

6Ouy3q9yBq5iS4arQOqR_A.text: I've been here twice. Both times I had excellent lattes. I've also had both the red velvet and lemon poppyseed waffles. Both were phenomenal. Good service, too.

CCFFnhmqoHSnvLeyyatuDA.text: The first time I went to this restaurant about four years ago, I was blown away with service, the atmosphere, the variety on the menu and most importantly the food. We ordered their pancakes, fruit, shrimp and grits and a few other items. They were all amazing. We had a bit of a wait for our table but it was well worth it. (This was the South Park location). Then we went a second and third time and the wait was particularly long, the service was very average and while the menu didn't seem different, the quality of the food was significantly different. So we decided to try the Ballantyne location and we were shocked at the difference between the two locations. The Ballantyne restaurant didn't have as long of a wait and the menu was the same, but the restaurant itself was not very clean, the food did not taste good and the atmosphere was crowded and not very friendly. I have not since returned to this restaurant at either location.

ECKaBzYsNIiSelqxKIly8w.text: Great atmosphere for breakfast and brunch. Convenient parking. Quality coffee! Nice staff

8aIzK5L2lhaE9mCk9b6gSQ.text: I LOVE their Red Velvet Waffle. Even though you automatically think of cake, it's not too heavy or sweet. I actually prefer this waffle over a slice of red velvet cake, which I don't really like. The hash-browns were pretty good, very circular, lol! I've tried the turkey sandwich, and it was fine, but I wouldn't get it again. My servers have always been very nice and helpful. Whenever I go, I like to sit upstairs because I like the quaint, intimate feel. I've never experienced an outrageous wait or an unsatisfactory experience. Their prices aren't too bad either.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle &amp; Hash browns.

4_i6sOCskgt_BgsCHWNxIw.text: I wrote a review about the other location, but I had to come back and write a review about this location as we were there just this past weekend per a request of my sister and brother in law when they came to visit.  My sister ordered the red velvet waffle, good as always.  My brother in law ordered Eggs benedict and a side of the biscuits and gravy.  Their gravy is one of the bests that I have ever had, I will have to remember to get a side of that in the future!  Kevin has some pork quiche.  I liked this much better than the quiche that I had last time at the other location.  This one was cooked better and just had a much better flavor.  Fantastic!  I had the special waffle - it was a cinnamon bun waffle.  It was the best waffle that I have had, and I really wish they would put this on their regular menu, it is fabulous!    My only complaint was that it took awhile for us to get seated, but food was fast and excellent!

m8qu-884FrP69XGIKUO63A.text: The red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle was delicious! I placed a to go order and was out in less than 10 minutes.

i_BoXkd2ZWORrAP2ajFweA.text: I've been coming to this place for at least four years, this place is a hidden gem in South Park, the food is always fresh and delicious, breakfast is the best, on weekends it can get busy in the mornings, the service is superb, never had a disappointing meal here, he menu has plenty to choose from. Their omelette is really good, try the spinach and feta cheese. French toast variety is ample, yum yum yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pecan French Toast

MdL_SuZfwF-zcutcFhgxHw.text: Three of us ate brunch here Sunday afternoon.  We came in and were told the wait would be 45 minutes. We waited about 30 minutes to get seated because many people on the wait list had left.  When we were sat we all ordered waters and one person ordered the house Bloody Mary.  Waters came out quickly but the Bloody Mary took about 10 minutes.  When it came out it had no garnish and looked lack luster.  We ordered our food, a Monte Cristo and two chicken sandwiches.  I was really excited about the Monte Cristo because I used to get one at another restaurant but it was taken off their menu.  The chicken sandwiches were described as served with skillet potatoes.  We waited close to 30 minutes for our food.  When it came out they told us it would be a few extra minutes for the skillet potatoes.  My Monte Cristo was so salty it was almost inedible.  The hash browns that came with it lacked any flavor and were more like the consistency of mash potatoes.  The chicken sandwiches were okay at best.  The skillet potatoes came out and also lacked flavor and were sitting in oil.  When the bill came there was an extra dollar charge for the skillet potatoes...that were described as served with the sandwich...and came out late...When we asked about the charge the answer we got was yes they come with the sandwich but there is an extra charge.  Needless to say we were very underwhelmed and will not be back.

iviimz4JbjS011nkS59N0g.text: This is probably the worst breakfast my family has experienced. We are very familiar with this restaurant and we have no idea what has recently changed. Our Canadian bacon eggs Benedict came out with Crab Cakes, the plain French toast came out as toast without a French toast batter to be seen, the Canadian bacon was super thick, very disappointing bs thingy sliced and crispy, the grits came out with cheese twice we ordered without cheese, the onions added to the top of our hash browns were not grilled and mixed in, the arrived as a glob on top so mushy twice, I sent those back as well.  Not to mention we waited for our meal 40 minutes. We had 5 different people dealing with our table however no where near organized like Famous Toastery one of the 5 we found out was the manager, we didn't realize it. We had to even get up and ask someone for the check. Nothing was resolved for such a disappointing breakfast outing.  We simply had a lady say "I'm so sorry for all the mix ups."

I1gKxySJSJ4rwtVP6Ozyqg.text: This place always has a wait on a sunday.. at least an hour but it is well worth the wait.. there brunch is amazing. I always get the red velvet waffle which is soooooo delicious. They also have the shredded has browns which is my all time favorite hash browns. The shredded ones are the best kind. We just went and they had a special for pumpkin waffles but by the time we got in they had already run out which was a bummer. My fiancee got the grits and he said they were also amazing

LAH0I55Cr8ecAysXpzgyHg.text: My experiences at Terrace have come up a bit mixed. The first time I went it was good and the second time less so.  On both visits I ordered the red velvet waffle with chicken breast. A figured this would make for a very unique chicken and waffles experience. I was not disappointed the first time. The waffle was crisp and glazed in a delicious cream cheese icing and the chicken perfectly fried for a delectable combination. My friend got quiche and while it didn't look anything spectacular, it tasted good. On my more recent visit the waffle was barely cooked - mushy and unsupportive of the chicken. The chicken was not crispy, but otherwise not horrible. The cream cheese glaze was close to non existent.  On my most recent visit the waitress was not friendly at all. Basically she just didn't even care. Never presented us with the specials menu; it was not service with a smile. My friends complained that the shrimp and grits were too salty. I didn't mind them, but admit that it didn't taste cohesive. More like grits plus chili plus shrimp. The mimosas with a "twist" are pretty dang good. Like a standard mimosa but with some other kind of juice - creates a cool separation in your glass that's both neat to look at and to drink. Another ding for the waitress - she never once asked my friend if he didn't like his drink (it was still full to the top) or offer to replace it. I felt sort of sorry for her, starting a morning off in such a bad mood.  Inside I feel like the ambiance is a bit awkward. The restaurant feels too open while the food is meant to make it feel cozy. But, what can you do? They're super popular despite the small size and at brunch time you're destined to be waiting to get a table. I won't write them off, but I doubt I'll come back for brunch. I guess they were just overworked with the crowd and it showed in the quality of food and service. I recommend picking a more obscure day and time to eat here.

5nC-9_RNjyVN6ZnUhiIkHw.text: Went for brunch early Saturday morning. Was greeted promptly & asked what drinks we wanted. We ordered coffee & mimosas. The coffee was awful, very acidic. The waitress said it was a strong brew so we opted for the latte. So much better. I got the omelette w chorizo, fresh spinach & mushrooms. It was fresh & perfectly cooked. I also got a side of grits & they were good as well, most places they are hard. My mom got the breakfast casserole & it was awful, it was old looking & dry. Service was very good, our waitress checked on us several times & food came out fast as well.

2-ZoG4AkOsmA3o9aTRpyBQ.text: This place was great! Came with three friends on a late Saturday morning, around 11:30/12ish. We were told it would be a 25-30 minute wait, but we're seated within 10 minutes! I got the Bavarian Cream Stuffed French Toast Sticks, with a side of hash browns and both were delicious! My friends had the chicken sandwich, basic french toast, and the croissant sandwich. Everyone enjoyed their meals. I could not finish my whole meal, as the portions are pretty huge. Our waitress was so nice and attentive and the manager, Randy, came by halfway through our meal to see how we were doing. The ambience is great. This is a great place to bring family, or visitors for a nice brunch/breakfast, but no need to dress super fancy (although you can, and that wouldn't be weird either). There is a wide variety of food on their menu, with differing price points. You can find something cheap like a basic omelet or french toast, to things like crab cakes and salmon burgers. Loved it! Will definitely be back.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

b-WqKjoXoUJLpLOeZAxuLw.text: Excellent brunch - great service , will definitely be back for another outing!!  Sunday was a little crowded and a bit of a wait , although well worth it!

E3ZOn_54zr8GiUMMuFaRxA.text: This is an wonderful breakfast/brunch restaurant! The turtle latte is a must! We always get the Steak Benedict and they always cook it perfectly! We've order the following:  Banana Pecan Toast - this was delicious but definitely on the sweet side. If you don't like sweet items, do not order this.   Steak Benedict - this was my favorite! Ordered with a side of hash browns added mushrooms, onions and cheese on top.   Spicy Chicken Biscuit - this was spicy! The pimento cheese is a great combo BUT the ghost peppers aren't a joke.   Shrimp and grits - this definitely had a True Cajun flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salted Caramel Latte
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pecan French Toast
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

NUje_PBAJrw-WqwYqz8cDw.text: The first five star is for the hostess who stopped what she was doing to warmly  greet and seat us!  The second five star is for server Tina. One would think you were a guest in her own home. She was amazing and humorous. Finally, the food is picture worthy and delicious! One can see from the front door to the kitchen to the table--this place is blessed! We love the cheerful atmosphere!

qHpXBrOGfphJK1m0yXX1TA.text: Oh yea, baby.  On our continuation of exploring Sunday brunch places, we put our names in at the South Park location (sits in that little circle of restaurants off the beaten path) and were told 45 minutes, which we were expecting. We wandered over to Cast Iron Waffles (also on the list) and checked out the menu there, just to be gluttons for punishment and torture our already-rumbling stomachs.  Anyways, after about a half hour, we were seated. Gorgeous interior, two stories and wicked high ceilings. After deliberation and compromise, I decided that I was going to get the Lemon Poppyseed French Toast, while the Lady would order the Banana Pecan French Toast. We both thought they looked delicious, so we thought we'd eat half and then trade.  Bad decision.  The lemon poppyseed toast was out of this world! It was super moist and had an incredible flavor, and the berries that went with it were a fantastic compliment. The banana pecan was good, don't get my wrong. But wowww.   I was in a group of 6 and I don't think there was a single complaint. The benedicts looked wonderful, chicken and waffles was a really generous portion. Will definitely be back again to try out other things. Prices are reasonable for Sunday brunch, comparable to Toast I'd say. Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Poppyseed French Toast.... Amazing.

UHH3AyINkadcjspfRpHXpA.text: We go to brunch here very frequently. Food is amazing! Best brunch in Charlotte. Mimosas are yummy at well. Great wait staff.

_eNYSXJU3I0lj4N2OXhGsw.text: This place has really fell off in the last couple of years. Everyone in my party had to send back their food due to temperature or wrong order. This is their 3rd strike with me, and I won't be returning.

wHNiN5cYMGAO9QMyZs8JOw.text: Led astray by The Charlotte Agenda and Yelp. This place was mediocre at best.   Unremarkable food and drink: Flavorless but expensive mimosa, bland crab cake eggs benedict, fine fried green tomatoes. My friend found the shrimp and grits less than edible. Just-okay cheese grits, but The Flying Biscuit has spoiled me there.   Slow and spotty service: We stood in the middle of the restaurant while our hostess checked tables after she already told us to follow her. They were out of Splenda. Didn't bring my coffee until the end of the meal, and had to ask three times for it -- and then again for cream.   Why would people eat here? I don't get it. Sorry I subjected my friends to this subpar brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Layered mimosa and Bellini. Bellini tasted like nothing. Expensive and not so great.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes. Pretty good but really greasy and pretty bland pimento cheese.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake eggs Benedict. Just okay.

LHLrHdLxBbaiIXg7vAfCMg.text: I always enjoy my visit. I took the kiddies and they enjoyed the chicken and waffles, pancakes and fruit, while I had the shrimp and grits. The space is little small, the staff is friendly it seems depending on who's your server that day. Overall the food is always good.

I would have licked my plate if I thought people wouldn't stare.  We got seated immediately and our waitress was super friendly and helpful

I would skip on the chicken since it was dry and flavorless. The service was prompt and great. It cost about $25 with tip for the waffle and two sides of the tomato and chicken.

SYl-Y9LWpyVwcGuF3JSQDQ.text: Incredibly delicious brunch place!! The menu options are hard to choose between, yet I was thoroughly impressed with their banana nut french toast. Very generous portions and so many creative sweet options that I will have to be a repeat customer to try them all!

d3w7d8XF3l7wog3Aj7DUoA.text: Awesome restaurant, but always a wait on the weekends, but I guess that's because it's so good.  They have made some menu changes that's I'm not 100% happy about, but still one of my favorite brunch places

EwFeYojXXMRI83AXYX0vxg.text: DO NOT order takeout from this place. The staff is either incompetent or just have zero regard for ensuring customers get exactly what they are paying for. Twice now we've ordered pick up and both times half the order has been wrong or parts of the order were missing.  Each time, our order was read back to us and was correct.  Not sure if the kitchen staff is illiterate or if no one is capable of doing their due diligence of checking orders COMPLETELY before handing them off to the customer but this will be the last time we waste our money here.   The best part, the manager on duty has zero idea how to handle situations like this. He made no attempt to apologize for us having wasted our time and made no attempt to try to keep us as customers. News flash, what your employees do or don't do in our case, reflects just as much on you as it does them.

IzHTeMfaaSNZUk4sJBAfUg.text: I had a feeling from their menu that Terrace would be a winner and I was right. We showed up at 10am on a Saturday as a party of 2 and waited about 20 minutes. Our waitress was bubbly and very attentive. The food was a bit slow but nothing egregious and she was very apologetic. We had carrot cake pancakes, a veggie omelet, and a side of chocolate chip pancakes. The pancakes are so fluffy! A great spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carrot cake pancakes

ZPU2Mn3mevNLbIglzO-mAQ.text: Breakfast was was so disappointing, server shrugged it off. Presentation was enough to turn us off, from the dried up"fresh fruit" dish to the "skillet potatoes" that turned out to be undercooked frozen cubed potatoes, eggs were dry, the Florentine Benedick was less than sub par, truly unappetizing. I left most of it on my plate and I was hungry. When the manager came to the table to ask how everything was, I pointed to the fresh fruits which was obviously cut several hours before and told him that I had asked the server if the fruit was fresh. He offered to go get me a new serving and he did and that fruit proved to be Shriveled up as well. Neither the manager or the server appeared to care that we left most of our food on our plates. I asked our server if the ownership or management had changed recently, it was that different from our last experience. When we left I gave the manager our comment card and told him that we had been to the Terrace restaurant earlier in the summer and had a wonderful breakfast and that is why we had returned. When I told him how disappointed we were, he told me that he was sorry that I felt that way. We felt patronized. The date and time of our visit was October 27, 2018, 10:00 AM

1yzpYPNR-QgzQp5--1dmag.text: I came for breakfast. Let me tell you their shrimp and grits is freaking amazing!! I would definitely come back and try them out for lunch and dinner.
