Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

PJHLOl9J4DcGn4bfn6tgOQ.text: This place is amazing! I got the chef skillet with fried chicken and gravy and it was toooo die for. Our waitress, Kyler was super helpful and extremely funny. I would definitely recommend this place to anybody that is Charlotte!

Y_BL13l8gVRXiyIyzghZEQ.text: Visited here on a Sunday morning, relatively early. Glad we got there when we did, because it sure got crowded fast! The food was delicious. We both had the chicken and waffles and I was so satisfied with the crispy chicken and yummy waffle. The only recommendation I would make is that the place might need a bit of a face lift. We sat upstairs and you could see right into the galley, see dirty carpets, and an air conditioner or something on the ceiling in great disrepair.

sEiQivIln7dKeYNtjRltCA.text: Great atmosphere and food was amazing !! Will go again and recommend   The red velvet waffle and fried chicken was really great

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

WqFlmqIPzBPS8j5YXRiLFg.text: Just went in during Father's Day brunch rush, although it was just me who came in, I got served promptly at the bar area and with such welcoming service from my server, Deron! He recommended the Bavarian French toast (which I would have honestly paid more than $12.50 for they were THAT good) and got my husband the red velvet waffle to-go which is just as delicious!! This was my second time at Terrace Cafe, and both times I've been in here it's been absolutely perfect all around. I 100% recommend coming here for brunch/breakfast any day of the week!!!

T3o6VLujbb5j5a8XBgUnyQ.text: We came for Saturday brunch. Service upstairs was horrible. Looking down it seems that the downstairs service were on point.  The upstairs servers were looking at a video on our server's cell phone, joking around in the kitchen area by the stairs. Our water was never refilled. Coffee was refilled once (it was also cold) by the team leader (I think since she had an earpiece).  We saw our server at our table three times: when she took our drink order, when she gave our drinks and got our food order, and when she finally gave our check. I think we could have just walked out and not pay and no one would notice.    Thinking back to my food, I didn't realize my order was incomplete. I ordered the Southern style Benedict with the optional sausage gravy. The gravy was missing.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern style Benedict. Missing the optional sausage gravy that I asked for.

gQjhOfH_uiyWT5e6-8NCUA.text: Had a really good meal here today. I ordered the full breakfast... eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, two pancakes, and I added on a biscuit. My friend got the same thing big with a waffle. The pancakes were really really melted in your mouth good. The biscuit was a little crunchy on the outside but fluffy on the inside. We got the to early for mimosas. Would definitely recommend. We went on a Sunday around 9 with no wait. Around 10-10:30 the seem to be a wait so come early.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two full breakfasts one with red velvet waffle the other with two packages.

C072Kvr-OBBCyAV5SrbaEQ.text: When I am out of town, I tend to rely on Yelp to find me good restaurants. Most of the time, I really enjoy them. Especially the ones with hundreds of reviews and 4+ stars. Welp, I was quite disappointed with this one.   We came in for Saturday brunch. We were seated upstairs after a 30 minute wait. As a lot of others have said, upstairs service was not the greatest. And the food that we received was definitely not worth the wait. I couldn't disagree more with their current rating of 4 stars.

2M0DtzC4YLXwc1XlfbsmhA.text: This place is overrated and over hyped. Not sure how this place got some of the awards.... not sure if there is any credibility to the awards the proclaim. Food is mediocre at best and overly greasy. Also.... They don't know how to make Benedict's.  It would be best described as fanfare for fast type food served in a "sit down" setting. Service was mediocre as well. No silver ware and minor things like that. Overall we wouldn't go back.

kYGu0GP7il5jA1FRUU5c8Q.text: Terrace Cafe is probably my favorite brunch spot in Charlotte. My go to is the French toast - which is always on point. Lately, I've been ordering the red velvet waffle with chicken (an extra $6). I'm typically not a fan of cream cheese, but the drizzle on the waffle is so delicious!   I've never been here for anything other than brunch, but if the rest of the menu tastes anything like brunch then I'm sure it's yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

nai-jbm3AOqSS8dPC6ncmA.text: Great food, great service. Can't say any different than what others have said except come hungry

eb4kTIaHpW707wmrs5SfUQ.text: I found a long hair in my grits!  The waitress took it back but my meal never made it back to the table. After a while, I just told the waitress not to worry about it.    The waitress was nice but wasn't as punctual as we would've like her to be.    My meal was comp'ed. I actually was hungry though. Now I have to go to Starbucks to find something to eats

5Wb-phADSi5bjk_ewvIvKQ.text: Umm so yea! This is definitely the spot for breakfast if you're in Charlotte. I was between the chicken and waffles, French toast & egg white omelette. I decided to go with the poppy seed lemon French toast w/ a side of fried chicken. Most definitely worth it, plus a cappuccino!  The terrace had a cozy vibe & customer service was awesome. Can't wait to go back, we need places like this in Raleigh!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

4PpXKG2wkDLiOfk9gg3KfA.text: Great service and nice atmosphere! Red velvet waffles was so good! Coffee was delicious and so were my sides!

uArp2PBBUZ0UZukpgAU8Iw.text: Mmm yum, brunch is amazing! Cocktails/ mimosas are great. The service was great especially for being to busy.  I had the stuffed french toast and hubby had the BYO omelette. Definitely worth a try if you hadn't before. Oh and don't forget to try the pimento appetizer. Thats what we came in for ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed french toast and the omelette. Side of carrot cake pancakes.

PA53QK1RIPUUhtAQFQeBhA.text: This was a super disappointment from all of the rage I have heard. Service was slow and your could see multiple employees eating Doritos behind our table "hiding." I was super embarrassed when I brought guests from Raleigh here. I had spoke about how great this place looked. The food tasted like something we could have gotten at Denny's. The hash browns were cold with no flavor or salt. My biscuit was burnt on the bottom and very dry. We had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 10:30am. Was not worth the wait at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

tA5ohhFS03VuDPWmLUjCEA.text: Boiiii, I don't know where to start. This was my first time here. My friend used to work at the Terrace near South Park mall and I never got a chance to check it out. This morning, I tried it for my first time and it was a huge explosion of different flavors in your mouth. Unreal. I got the skillet with thin slice steak, pepper jack cheese, potatoes, onions, peppers and topped with two eggs of your choosing. On the side I got a homemade biscuit with their homemade jelly, am amazing. It is up there with Pop eyes biscuits because those are my absolute favorite.  Laura was our waitress. She was very nice and quick. Didn't check on us too much. Great service. I will definitely be back again for those biscuits forsure !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

aa8RseoIh6AYmbGCAFYjFw.text: God is in the red velvet waffles. I cannot bring myself to order a dish here without making certain that I have the chicken and waffles. The service has always been exceptional no matter which location I decide  to dine in. I appreciate the consistency. Additionally, this is my usual go to when pals who are not from the area want brunch. Can't wait share this with more loved ones.

wPq09b-v_aIEgLYulJC8aQ.text: In full disclosure I removed a star due to the fact that we ( a party of 6) waited an hour for a table at brunch when one was open at least a 1/2 hour before we were sat. I had to ask the hostess why we weren't being seated at the open table and was told they were waiting for a booth and the family wouldn't leave but then sat us at the open table. Unfortunately after you wait an hour you have higher expectations (as in, I waited an hour this better be Frikkin awesome)...and it wasn't. My choc chip pancakes were great but I wasn't a fan of the chicken apple sausage (it was burnt & didn't taste like breakfast sausage). Our friends weren't impressed with their eggs Benedict. I probably wouldn't go back for brunch as I hate waiting more than 20 minutes unless the food is spectacular and this wasn't.

RbMOijCoR5JHeYsXoUXtEw.text: So, I feel bad submitting this review but I'm doing it anyway. I'm in Charlotte often and Terrace used to be my go-to breakfast spot. Two previous visits I went to the Ballantine location and was so disappointed. Went to the Piedmont location this time and was disappointed as well.  3 strikes: your out! Table not cleaned well, server was less than welcoming, had to ask for silverware after food was served. Quality of food has declined sharply. Same tempting recipes in a nice atmosphere but my food was so heavy on the cooking grease (Chef's daily special Hash) that's really all I tasted, daughters poppyseed French toast was burnt on one side, sons eggs were cold; asked for over easy on 2 eggs, 1 yoke was broken and cooked hard and other yoke was in tacked but pretty much hard too. Regular coffee was barely warm, and cup came with lipstick stain from previous user. Second cup of coffee I ordered, decaf this time, was same low temp. The bill was a steep $125.00 for 6 of us and honestly IHOP would of (& has) done a better job for much less  $$.  I won't be back.

zIAWMilv0WFM8w8ZEXlcQA.text: First time at Terrace.  We met some friends for Brunch and it was great.  Had the Chicken and Waffles with Fruit with a side of Hashbrowns.  Everything was great with the exception of the fruit.  Just disappointed in the quality.  Otherwise everything was perfect.  Will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles with Fruit and Hashbrowns

pzvpvcVIyC5wjjrD3M75Ww.text: Solid 3 star place. I had the lemon poppy french toast - it's more like a lemon pound cake that's been sliced and then pan fried, it's very sweet so it needs fruit to cut the sweetness. It comes drizzled with lemon curd, too! I also ordered a latte - nice and creamy, none of that sour coffee taste. It was expensive for what it was - $20 plus tip for the french toast, extra side of berries and a latte.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage egg biscuit and fruit
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon poppy French toast

PDXwRyWoh51rBPPrzfv5Mg.text: This was my first brunch experience in Charlotte and it has yet to be topped. I was really in the mood for some hot chocolate and it was perfection.   We were waiting for a table, but ended up getting lucky and sat at one of the bar tables. I don't think I've ever had a better waiter. He was so attentive, gave us amazing recommendations and genuinely wanted to make sure that we had the best dining experience.   On top of the amazing service the food was delicious. We had the quiche, pancakes, eggs, hash browns, and bacon. Everything was amazing, especially the quiche! I would recommend this place to anyone and often do!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot Chocolate

Jg-tEqRQTuFYnPZuDi3_Qg.text: Omg I love this place! The hubby and I have been twice for brunch and both times were amazing. Yes the wait is long but it's worth it. The mimosas and bellinis are on point and the fried green tomatoes are perfect. My absolute favorite is the red waffle and chicken. It's not too sweat and the flavors come together nicely.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffles, cream cheese drizzle and chicken!

K7q1zdI6INQpFHV7cM85vg.text: STOP, PUSH THE DIRECTIONS BUTTON, DRIVE HERE NOW!  This is a breakfast experience not to be missed. I think I might throw a tent up and stay here for a while and try all their items for the next several days. I ordered the banana/pecan waffles. They were amazing! They were perfectly prepared, fluffy, not doughey, flavorful and not too sweet - definitely gourmet. The menu is diverse with options to satisfy even the pickiest eater. Service was prompt and courteous. Cafe Au Lait was perfect. Can't say enough about this restaurant. We will come here every time we visit Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana/Pecan French Toast
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Quiche

GbN5TIxljkJz6PdCBUe51g.text: This was a very nice place. A friend and I had brunch there. It was packed so apparently the locals love it. Pancakes were DELICIOUS, the food was great, & our waitress was very friendly. The manager went around to each table as well to make sure everything was ok. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was since there was a wait people were piling up in the front right by the door. I'm sure people would have waited outside had it been warmer but a little area for waiting may have been more accommodating. Pagers would also be a suggestion so you can wait in your car if you wanted. Although it got crowded we were seated in no time.

H2sqsvpLDso0o0e9xTF2Kw.text: Great brunch!! Fresh, delicious ingredients.  Service can be a little slow.  A lot of items are pricey, but mostly worth it because of the flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily Special, waffle..waffle cones..yum

a6dZmfwyKKV7uSIaQeESCg.text: Love this restaurant so much! It is consistently delicious every time and the staff are so friendly! It's a lovely environment and it is always a pleasure to visit. Lastly, do NOT forget to give the red velvet waffle a try! It is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle

Q2C-3TsNuduH0Dorf0mOog.text: Love this restaurant!! Have been here twice for lunch. Food was great both times! Wait staff does a great job. Everyone is very friendly. Awesome looking food for breakfast too!!

u6qbBsFZE-cfPyTzWhZWgA.text: I kept bragging about how good this places. I encouraged our wedding group to order the banana bread French toast. Glad I was the only one. I couldn't even eat it. It was literally swimming in syrup. You could not taste the banana bread. It was remarkable how much syrup was on this plate. I wish I had taken a picture of it but I was embarrassed because it was a small party of six... A wedding brunch. The berry martini was good. But I sat there and picked at the food and just could not eat it. Even someone else at the table remarked on how much syrup there was. It was so disappointing and I left hungry.

wzesJMpADnHUzNkWL3CfUA.text: Best brunch in Charlotte, no competition.  This place get absolutely packed on Sundays. Come early and bring yourself a book or buy yourself a few Bloody's. Or both. They have a Diablo (extra spicy), bacon Bloody and regular Bloody. I always get the bacon Bloody with a little extra spice. The latte's are also tasty and come in flavors ranging from blueberry to peanut butter. Can't speak on the blueberry, but peanut butter is phenomenal.  Unfortunately, they removed the s'mores french toast from the menu last year, which was my favorite, but they still have the famed red velvet waffle. Yes, you can also add fried chicken. Yes, it is as good as it sounds.  Grits are fluffy and creamy. Hashbrowns are shredded and deep fried - probably not made in house but still pretty good.   The biscuits and gravy and bacon, sausage and cheese sandwiches are delicious as well.  Go here. Seriously.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle + fried chicken

lCYy5kIxrerzO3TWgfxZzg.text: We sat at the bar and Michael gave us EXCELLENT SUGGESTIONS for brunch items! All of the staff was attentive even though we were necessarily "their" customers. The Monte Cristo and crab Benedict were outstanding along with a great cucumber cocktail. Super impressed by the food and by the professionalism of all the staff.

v1qCR5JShoJuMttvZFdsJw.text: This is my absolute favorite place for brunch - any time of day, every day! The food is delicious and the restaurant itself is classy and quirky.   My favorite thing to order is the red velvet waffle - everyone should try it at least once (AT LEAST!!). I wasn't as impressed with the Banana Pecan French Toast, which was drowned in maple syrup to the point of being as soft as apple sauce. Nonetheless, at least the flavor was still good. I've also tried a latte here before (I forgot the flavor), which was tasty and had cool latte art.  I read a lot of review with complaints about long lines, but each time I've been I've gotten a seat immediately. I went on weekdays both times and the first time I went was after 1pm while the second time was after 7pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana pecan French toast with maple syrup
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle + latte

uXJwaer454e3Md_I6BMKKQ.text: I have been to the Ballantyne location for lunch before but I've yet to experience the legendary brunch I've heard so much about. Apparently everyone else has heard a lot about it because there was a 30 min wait. In fact they stayed on a wait during the entire time we were there. That's always a good sign.  We were seated at 11:30 and our waiter was right there to take care of us. We both got caramel lattes. I was impressed by their amazing coffee selection/espresso bar. It's not often that you find that in a restaurant. The coffee was delicious and came complete with some foam designs.  I got the eggs Benedict and it was delicious. I also got a side of the fried green tomatoes with pimento cheese. They were awesome!! My friend got the full breakfast and she enjoyed it. Service was excellent from beginning to end. Worth the wait!!!

0lZLChcfaKzttVwl5d6Q6A.text: The service here was wonderful! I got the most simple thing every and wish I had tried something more worth giving critique on, like their chicken. I will try it again before basing my overall opinion on the food. My family however loved their food. My husband got the steak and eggs and my daughter got scrambled eggs and bacon. I got a red velvet waffle that my son's devoured for me I ended up ordering another so I could try it. My son is picky so The fact that he ate it so fast had me curious and it was worth it ! Looooved that dang waffle! Again the service was perfect and our waitress Savanah was so cute and great!!

wBj6sNxh2oshOiId2JtJYg.text: Good breakfast spot!  The service was great and sooo nice. Loved my egg white turkey omelette! And the banana pecan pancake was really yummy. Their biscuits are a must too.

RYQ4w_YHUNPvH3ucXiChBw.text: This was a cute place! Looks like it's suppose to be a fancy place. The silverware and cups were all curvy shaped which fascinated me. The red velvet waffle came with a white sauce that had a good touch to it. The chicken is boneless and easy to cut and eat with the waffles. The hash browns were alright but at least everything else was good! I'd definitely come back for some more dishes with the chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle

bd8XAZLaVMjjXosfdgsKmw.text: We came for dinner at the restaurant known for brunch.  The food and service was great.  I have food allergies and they went above and beyond to make sure I had a good, allergy-free meal.

teE9WFBGpZ6YKlFJSD2uqA.text: Am I in Heaven?  I think I'm in love with this place.  One of my besties' took me to this place for brunch and that's when I fell in love.  Yeah, I went there for the Red Velvet Waffles w/ cream cheese drizzled on top because it sound intriguing but that wasn't the highligh of my experience.    When we walked into this beautiful establishment, I loved the soft and easy low-key tones of the restaurant.  I felt like we were in a movie.  Although it was packed, the ambiance was very relaxing and comforting.  The star of the show for me was definitely the chicken apple sausage (which is made fresh at the restaurant).  It is so delicious that I am still at a loss for words!  It is definitely something that you'd have to try for yourself.  So let me back up a bit,  I ordered the red velvet waffles, chicken apple sausage, and stone ground grits w/ cheese.   Lately, I have to admit, I have not liked anyone's grits besides my own, but let me tell you...if you're craving grits and you don't want to make them yourself--give this place a try.  I personally cannot wait to go back and try other things on the menu.

F4aB87T7LXCUsNJW7Ny2Fg.text: Disgusting. Seriously the chicken and waffles are chicken tenders and waffles. The hash browns are so nasty they taste like the smell of the hotel glasses they keep in the room. Musty! Yuck never again. No wonder ppl from Charlotte think it's good because Charlotte has some of the worst food I've ever had. I'm a northern we have real food and real restaurants. I won't come back nasty! And my waitress never checked on me either. So terrible service so disappointed

VrMz8nWc6VvrCZGsGN7dWA.text: Delicious ! Nice variety of food perfect for brunch the red velvet waffles are to die for and the cream cheese drizzle puts it over the edge the shrimp in grits are savory and hearty nice portions and great atmosphere get there early on Sunday

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits and a red velvet waffles !! A++

ixIA_p8WeL3sQLF-li25dA.text: Tried this place with my wife for valentine's weekend breakfast.  The adventure started with one of the rudest hosts that we have ever encountered. Waited while he sat people he knew in front if us and empty tables were visible. Waitress and wonderful food made up for the awful host. Try the red velvet waffles.  They are fabulous.

8d4-W4auvUATY-ZRmPipCg.text: Very nice place, lovely wait staff, great location. the place is pricey, but overall has good food and good atmosphere. its a tad chilly in there but rather be chilly than hot. our waitress was great, i asked to try a sauce before ordering the eggs benedict. which was good but not fantastic, the canadian bacon is good, i just was surprised how thick of slices they point on there. i could have used just one of them sliced in half, kinda overpowered the Benedict. cant wait to try something different next time, the shrimp and grits were amazing according to my mom. it comes with fried spears of okra on the top of the shrimp and grits. lovely place, will return.

rAd6zcQbMiVXs6tdw3dh5Q.text: After reading the positive review  for Terrace Cafe in Charlotte Magazine, my hubby and I knew we had to try them for breakfast.  And not only are really glad we did, we expect to return often (even though it's a bit of hike for us)!    Just be forewarned that you should expect a wait. Terrace Cafe is totally worth the wait, though. They are also very efficient, so our expected 30-minute wait for a table on a Sunday turned into just 20 minutes.  To start, they have a full espresso bar with options that few other restaurants have -- like the white chocolate blackberry mousse latte that my husband got, or the pumpkin spice latte that I got. Both were yummy, but the pumpkin was a tad sweeter than my hubby's white chocolate blackberry.    For the meal, I got the red velvet waffle with cream cheese topping and fruit. I loved the fact that the fruit was served room temperature and not ice cold, like I usually get it. The fruit was also a nice selection of blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, strawberries, pineapple, melon, and kiwi. The waffle was a perfect-sized portion but could have used a bit more cream cheese topping. (I like my toppings sweet!) I'll probably ask for an extra bit the next time.    My hubby got the full breakfast with two fried eggs, bacon, hash browns, and chocolate chip pancakes. The choco pancakes were light and delicious and probably my favorite thing out of everything we got.  I also loved that they served the syrup heated. What a nice touch! We were both really impressed by the entire meal. (And did I already say the coffee was yummy? I swear, bad coffee can absolutely destroy a good meal!)  Service was really quick, and we did not have to wait long for the meal to arrive. Our server was also extremely attentive and checked back with us several times to make sure we were happy. We really appreciated that.  It's great that Terrace Cafe is open for breakfast on both Saturdays and Sundays.  So few places in Charlotte offer breakfast on Saturdays!  They have the winning combination of great coffee, delicious food, and quick and attentive service...we'll definitely be back!

JLuKK7wi9nvT3YR6ndVyww.text: I was so excited to try their red velvet waffle because waffle is one of my absolute favorite food. What a disappointment. It just tasted so plain and normal to me. I don't think it tasted any different than any other place. We may try it again sometime but we were definitely not impressed the first time.

h25IAe5910Byr1LyL0ezEw.text: The food is amazing and the service could not have been better.  We went on a Saturday and were seated quickly at the bar.  The chicken and waffle was great.  We also had the shrimp and grits and the red velvet waffle as well.  Each were wonderful.  The accompanying chicken breast is moist and delicious. If I lived in Charlotte, NC this would be my new favorite place for breakfast / brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chicken and waffel is awesome. The chicken is moist and the waffel is fluffy and delicious.

xj3aI3tmXxLL4x_B_-WJYw.text: Got the 1/2 sandwich and soup......very good.....they made to many red velvet waffles so our table got one for FREE.....OMG THE BOMB

MjjR1RI1rBl9Nw6kz-cEfQ.text: I've been there a few times and enjoy the food and service. The only complaint is that when the restaurant is packed the tables feel very close together.

kDXTqnwKE0cX5c7DZauGpw.text: Best brunch in Southpark. Very crowded when I went on a Sunday so expect to wait a bit, but the food is well worth it.

n_bfwXtOlgRw3vJu064caQ.text: My wife and I went here during restaurant week. And we enjoyed our meal.  I'm a sucker for prime rib so I ordered that. I'm not sure if it's still on their regular menu, but it was delicious. The sides were good too!  Our server was very friendly and the food came out pretty quickly. From what I remember, the dining room could use a little reno, but it wasn't too bad. It wouldn't deter me from coming back.   I've heard that brunch is awesome here. We've been meaning to give it a try.   But from what I did experience at Terrace Cafe on our first visit, I would definitely like to return.

Pg2Pr-8QbozTRhr1K3naeA.text: I have been a few times, but haven't gotten around to writing my review. Can we say SHRIMP & GRITS? One of their most popular dishes is the red velvet waffles and chicken-also equally good. Each time I have went, there was a wait unless you opt to sit at the bar. You will have to see them prepare all the food through the window to the kitchen, which for me takes the fun out of it, but it definitely doesn't take away from the taste. Get there early to avoid a line but GO!

rnhOgZnv5uL63i1X8qvCAQ.text: Great place for breakfast, waiter was on point. Clean restaurant, with nice decor. Very friendly atmosphere...

7MDLGVtxjkEfc95f8iAVdA.text: After a long and treacherous New Year's Eve (picture being cut off at the bar below Gastro Lounge, and continuing to drink out of a Stella can tucked in my trenchcoat)-- well, yea. We needed breakfast recovery. So to Terrace Cafe we went.  The notorious "wait" ensued. We weren't the only hungover ones, and as the rain drizzled, we recanted the night before, before being seated 30 mins later.  We spotted about 6 open tables as we're led in, we wondered why we weren't seated earlier.  Ordered foamy cappuccinos, and fresh squeezed OJ. Started feeling the road to recovery.  The menu looked great. We wanted to order everything. But I stuck to something I've missed, poached eggs. We ordered:      Eggs Florentine.     Full breakfast, and     the Cajun Shrimp Omelet.  My eggs were perfectly poached, which made me happy. The Hollandaise sauce actually tasted like Hollandaise sauce. My English muffin however was a tad over fried and hard. Oh well. Overall tasty. Good salad. Good hash.  My friends dug their meals. The Cajun Shrimp was a bit too pungent of a thing to eat hungover (eggs and fishyness...) but seemed OK. Bit over the top onion-y.  Finished. Service was just OK.  Bit pricey, but the best hangover cure. Will come here again.  Rankings      # of times dined here: 1st     Cost of Bill: $12-18 for 1person     Food Rating: 8/10     Service Rating: 7/10

Ij_gLuAW3DMMm_dp9s5OXw.text: Phenomenal breakfast. The Terrace Cafe is a must go there culinary gem. Wonderful, satisfying, and unique breakfast fare. A red velvet waffle topped with a light cream cheese drizzle was placed in front of me with a perfectly cooked piece of boneless fried chicken. The waffle was magical; not too heavy and not over-the-top sweet. It was decadent. The chicken came out piping hot and was cooked perfectly; moist and encapsulated in a light and crunchy breading; the kind of breading that inspires you to pick the remnants up off the plate with the pads of your fingers. The chicken was so delicious, I ordered a fried chicken eggs benedict. The same amazing chicken with two perfectly poached eggs; not to runny, not too hard. And the hollandaise sauce was rich and light all at once and didn't over-power the eggs.  The staff here is amazing. They have incredible coffee that was served to us by a coffee genius named Ben. The heart atop my cappuccino stayed until I finished it.  Our waiter Chris was fantastic and friendly and very patient with my food indecisiveness. Patrick the chef as incredible. It's obvious the staff here care about their product and their service. I can't say enough about the wonderful experience my husband and I had here. Counter area seating is first come first serve but if you do encounter a line, you must wait. It will be worth it.  There are not enough stars to give. We will definitely return.

aqIt4DRh72DnWSYH2HAA8g.text: Won't be back.  Our party of 6 adults went here for breakfast last Saturday and I was disappointed.  We had really bad service - the waiter brought about 1 oz of cream for 4 people to have in coffee. It's still ok to put cream in coffee, isn't it? Anyone?? After the rough start, it got worse.  Forgotten drinks, cold food and I don't know what the other reviewers see in the grits.  Homemade sausage was flavorless.  Better choice for sausage biscuits and gravy:  Zada Janes in Plaza Midwood. Better choice for cheese grits:  Boudreaux's in NoDa (Sunday brunch.  YUM.)    To their credit, the manager of this place did the right thing when we brought our bad experience to his attention so I feel a little bad about posting this review. But the food, service and atmosphere just didn't live up to the reviews.

9musgzsgdDrFPF77W-lEeg.text: Terrace Cafe is a great brunch spot.  We stopped in here a Saturday morning/afternoon to get some brunch and of course mimosas.  We you first walk in, you see a bar, some seating on ground level, and then an exposed upstairs which is where we sat.  This place just feels new and clean, while still having some charm to it.       The food here is awesome.  I had the red velvet waffle and the lady had the eggs benedict  The egg was poached nicely, but the red velvte waffle reigned supreme. I honestly wanted to lather my body with the cream cheese drizzle, though I don't know what unwanted person I may attract.      The food, mimosas, and the service were great.  I aso distinctly remember the odd shaped glasses for some reason. The only thing that put me off a little bit is the price.  It was a bit higher for brunch, but you do get what you pay for.  Overall I would definitely return.

D0wIJ7_OpaJsyQAOkaIjUA.text: Freaking Fabulous! Went there on a Sunday! I suggest going early or be prepared to wait. Got there around 12:45 pm and it was packed! Waited while I had a mimosa (they were good). I went with my friend and we decided to get two dishes and split them. I got to try more than I would have eating alone! I got the eggs Benedict florentine style and added Canadian bacon. It came with cheese grits on the side. This dish was absolutely delicious. I even enjoyed the grits (I'm a bit skeptical of other states' grits). My friend ordered the red velvet waffles with hash browns as her side item. It was like eating Coke for breakfast! Sooooo good! The hash browns were on point as well! Overall good experience and the waiter was awesome as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict Florentine with Canadian Bacon

zyJVVgsjd_Q9UjaJU0Db4Q.text: Food is awesome! Lots of different options including breakfast for any meal! The interior is nothing exciting but the service and food is always on point. Definitely a great spot for any meal.

xltdsUDwqaHQMkGKpqHSFg.text: Kids favorite of all brunch/breakfast places we have been.  Had eggs Benedict, quite good! At our table we ordered waffles.  Blueberry pancakes and a order of French toast.   Oj fresh squeezed.  Coffee excellent

v7JSzMCU62Q6kOD2flN2Xg.text: Red velvet waffles, tasty. Sunday brunch is a zoo - but worth the wait. Great coffee selection. Fresh, simple foods. Service needs some work but all in all a good thing going over at Terrace.

9heSZnRuQC10UxLJ99mZBg.text: Awesome!!! The food and the waiter.  Other than the crazy NC law that meant I couldn't have a brunch mimosa this is one of the greatest brunches I have ever hat!

YO0tDJH8E5dwqWyZ_g8Hmg.text: My wife and I love this place.  We go at least 3 times a month for breakfast.  The food is always delicious and timely.  The kitchen staff is top notch. The waitstaff is very professional and friendly.  We highly recommend.

YabfxdVtJ8LPfke8vnJn1A.text: I visited this restaurant for breakfast and was I in for a surprise. If you are looking for some unique breakfast selections and a very nice atmosphere, check it out. It's a great addition to the South Park area.   I had a fine experience with our waiter, food was served quickly and as ordered. I tried the chocolate smore french toast. This plate is huge! Way more than a normal person could/should eat in one sitting. But, maybe a good idea to share. Or perhaps they offer a half size if you request it? I think I will try that next time. It is absolutely delicious by the way, especially if you are a french toast addict like myself. I am always going to restaurants and trying whatever unique french toast offering they have come up with. This one certainly did not disappoint. I also tried some of my husbands grits, and they were to die for.

ER9sumgufUI3ncM1gurThw.text: Delicious! OMG, the red velvet waffle was mind blowingly good! Everything is a la carte so I ordered a side of the inhouse made sausage... shut the front door! It was an explosion of flavor! I will be a regular here for sure!

GK_AFNM4SEeWOqKgkYjXiA.text: Heard of this place plenty of times, didn't really know what to expect.  Since we're trying to avoid mad traffic in the Dilworth area due to Greek Festival, my friend and I headed to Piedmont Row for brunch instead.  Granted I didn't have expectations, I guess I'm just one of those people who aren't easily impressed.    Decor/atmosphere: simple, cafe-like, bright and appealing, causal dressy if that's such a thing... nice high ceiling showcasing the upper level seating... feel bad for food runners who have to climb those stairs   Menu: extensive breakfast/lunch options, maybe a little too extensive because it was hard to make a decision.  Most items are low to mid $10s during breakfast/brunch/lunch time  Food: I'm a soup freak... can't pass on a blue crab bisque.  It was creamy, lumps of yummy fresh crab meat, and OMG salty!  That's an achievement of its kind for me to think something is high sodium (maybe not a good kind of achievement).  Finished it still... but really could have held back the salt.  I ordered the Fried Oysters Spinach Salad... the thing is HUGE.  I swear there's a pound of spinach in that bowl.  Tons of oysters.  Impressive looking.  But unfortunately they went too heavy handed on the vinaigrette.  The menu said hot bacon vinaigrette.  As much as you and I know, it's easy to taste bacon.  Somehow they managed to cover up all things bacon, caramelized onions & sauteed mushrooms... the main reasons I ordered the salad besides the oysters.  The oysters didn't disappoint...  but not enough to save the dish.  For $12.50, it's a big portion, but I can't say the taste justify for it.  Service:Ok.  Little slow on the water refill.  Coffee was amazing though.  Reminded me of Italy.   In conclusion, I was little disappointed by the food.  I know they're known for their red velvet waffle... but I should be able to order something else that isn't sweet and still be yummy.  The menu is a little pricey for "cafe" (especially for dinner).  Another good looking place in Charlotte that didn't deliver in the food department.

2yGYB9SL_OeBjB4_RKU7OA.text: Great brunch on Mother's Day!  Thought we would have a long wait but only 20 minutes! Very delicious!  Tried Full Breakfast, Croque Madame, Shrimp and Grits, and Southern Sausage Eggs Benedict with Hollandaise Sauce!  All great!  Can't wait to go back!

npbdcXkeUx9Qb_v3g06OQw.text: We came a little after 1 on a Sunday afternoon.  The place was pretty full but we got a table right away. Despite how busy the place was there was kind of a calm ambiance, which my hubs attributed to strategic not-so-bright lighting and color scheme.  It feels like a nice place.  The sanitation rating inspired confidence too. I got a strawberry waffle with sausage, he got the quiche of the day (ham, cheese, broc and tomato).  My waffle was tasty, but then again, most waffles are.  The sausage patties had a little zing to them.  Hubs' quiche was promising but seemed to have been sitting for a little too long.  He said my quiches are better - to which you might say, of course he did, but he's more the type to say "hon, you've got to learn how to make this" if that is more True to the situation.  They had other items that looked interesting - crab benedict, for example, and some of their breakfast sandwiches - but between us we were neither wowed nor wigged out. The place is neither a deal nor highway robbery.  Overall it's kind of average.

_4Z5hjsP8-ZWroiw7M9Bwg.text: This is a new restaurant that opened up in the trendy mixed use (residential/commercial) area called Piedmont Row.  Very close to South Park mall.     A very welcomed addition!  Although I stopped in at lunch time, they have a great breakfast menu.  Will is great to have another option other than the Original Pancake House in the S Park area.  Lunch was great and the service was friendly.  I sat at the bar area and ordered a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.  Was cooked perfectly.  Sitting at the bar, you could see the kitchen area and you could tell they were still working some of the bugs out on the computer system and still perfecting the food presentation.  Still, there was nothing that prevented the service and food from being wonderful.  I can not wait to get there for breakfast!

q_JdBzEtP8m2R1Tw4w3CKw.text: The food here is nothing short of amazing I love the shrimp and grits the red velvet waffle and  drinks. Always great service and great food I have been many times

f8-2G8AAxEI37hGCCNNJxg.text: Had breakfast at Terrace Cafe last Sunday. I'm glad we got there early ( 9 am ) as a long line was waiting when we left.  Food was delicious and so much that we could not finish.  We 4 should have only ordered 1 order of fried green tomatoes instead of 2.  We had 4 different items and they were all great.  Service was also excellent.  I would definitely return.  French press coffee was not as good as I would have thought  but that's probably because we did not wait long enough.  Also it gets cold quick in that glass pot.

Sh297H83PU_lSyMjPvqEEw.text: went to terrace cafe for breakfast this morning for a quick meeting.  i wasn't starving so i ordered a bacon/cheese biscuit which came with hashbrowns.  the food was good but not great.    the cafe was pretty busy for a wednesday morning and our waiter had a party upstairs so the service could have been better but i'd probably give it another try when i have a bigger appetite.

pLGodvXHilmTwYOaqFCJEQ.text: We tried this restaurant while on vacation in NC. I had the Shrimp & Grits and it was AMAZING!!!!!!!! It was spicy, but the creamy grits cooled off my mouth! I couldn't get enough of it!! I would recommend this place to anyone and the next time I am in Charlotte, I will be visiting this restaurant. It was fabulous!!!!!

qWo72kDQSK7_AIKxTdTbUg.text: My wife and I went here for the first time yesterday and we will be back frequently. We both agree it was one of the best breakfasts we've had in a long time. I had the filet benedict and she had an omelette both were excellent. Everything was very fresh and had a nice homemade quality to it. Next time I'm going to give the red velvet waffle a shot.

muhMZ8g9TiG6G4VhnjSL-w.text: I really enjoyed having brunch here. The food was delicious and the coffee was great. However, it didn't seem like the wait staff could handle the large crowd that comes for a Sunday brunch. Our waiter seemed flustered and kept forgetting about us. The hostess was even a little rude and short tempered. They didin't seem understaffed so I'm not sure what the deal was. I would definitely go back here but it would be nice if they had better servers who could handle more than a couple of tables. For this reason I gave Terrace 3 out of 5.

NE3XHm0bxkcFUka_dULXng.text: I've only been here for brunch but I must say, the food is amazing! I go here every time I go to Charlotte and each time it has been very good. The Omelettes are my favorite along with their hashbrowns.  The service could be a bit better but it is understandable since they are always so busy.

MRa0QcUe9MkvI0768lseEQ.text: All the food is great.  Order from the specials menu.  You wont be disappointed.  Service is lacking unless you sit at the bar.  Atmosphere is OK, but the food really is worth the trip, especially breakfast and lunch.  Great fruit side dish.

Y9Z7bO7xNFLR-Srj9nHoYw.text: Yum this place is so good.  I had a chance to stop in for lunch and I was just as impressed with my lunch selection as I was when I had dinner here.   If you get a chance the roasted red pepper & gouda soup is out of this world amazing.  This place is hopping during lunch.  The food and service were both excellent.  Now I must make it back for some brunch next time.

ZLYi9rlmb4vB1ijxj6ZCpA.text: Went here for breakfast and it was terrific!   Although it has eccentric silverware and plates the food is amazing.  I had the shrimp and grits which was a very hearty and filling breakfast.  I fully recommended it to anyone passing through Charlotte.

5q9G2uWN-3w80bnPJNjdmg.text: My husband and I were on our way to IHOP when I said let's try something different. I want real breakfast and a real dining experience. The Terrace Cafe didn't disappoint. We found it by doing a google search and said anything beats IHOP. I had the shrimp and grits, my daughter had the egg omelet and my husband had the steak and eggs and we all shared the red velvet waffle which was especially light and yummy! HANDS down one of the best restaurants we have been to since we moved to Charlotte 6 months ago.

tfSTskqgV1JUacKRNUHoxQ.text: Underwhelmed... We were hungry for breakfast and it got the job done but didn't deliver beyond that. Our server has a bit of a 'tude. But hey, we're fed and caffeinated. The coffe cake was really good if you have a sweet tooth.

DzNznVymk1TBiaRBWoYx1w.text: Good experience for dinner date. Definitely was pretty empty/quiet. Go for brunch if you want it to feel like a "terrace cafe". Food's always good. Server accommodated paleo request to boot!

B0lGG31d_y429I9ylijRCg.text: This place has to be the best breakfast/brunch spot in Charlotte. Omelets and hashbrowns are great.

jPD4ma61o2DbqEfxV1IAOA.text: I had a 5 hour layover in Charlotte last week so a friend picked my husband and me up at the airport for a nice breakfast. Hence how we ended up at the Terrace Cafe. What a treat that ended up turning into.  I had the sausage gravy over biscuits. I'm a big fan of Bob Evans S&B but don't live near one now so I'm always looking to top the deliciousness of those. The Terrace Cafe exceeded my expectations. The biscuits where light and fluffy and the sausage (made fresh in their kitchen) was tasty but not greasy. The perfect blend of flavors in a light creamy gravy. It came with a side salad which I thought was a bit weird for breakfast and then regretted that I didn't eat it since later my husband and our friend told me it was really good with a light dressing that was actually complementary to the meal (so what do I know?).  Our friend had the eggs benedict which he raved about and my husband had the full breakfast which included eggs, bacon and pancakes. Being quite the connoisseur on pancakes my husband raved about them.  The only complaint I had was that I thought they must have been packing meat in their dining room because it was FREEZING in there. When I asked the waiter about it he told me that apparently it gets so warm in the afternoon that they have to keep it cool in the morning. That's great for the afternoon diners but why should I have to be uncomfortable to accommodate later diners? We were all uncomfortably cold and left as soon as we were finished eating which was too made because we would have liked to hang out a bit have more coffee and visit. My husband even said that by the time he got to the end of his meal it wasn't warm any longer. Now THAT'S cold.  Overall though the food was wonderful and I'd definitely recommend it. You may however want to try it in the afternoon!

HXJ_eFZ_RO_Sq9wy9WU7Uw.text: I moved to Charlotte about a year and a half ago and this is where I take all of my visitors for breakfast or brunch. The chicken and waffles here are the best! The grits are really good and so are the fish and chips. They do not take reservations so there is usually a wait but it is worth it! Sometimes you can get a seat at the bar when you first go in.

8AGhekfZYg6lrjqibWKr9A.text: Atmosphere good Service excellent Timeliness average Accomodating Food average- bisquits and gravy ok but we've had better.  Trademark breakfast casserole was good, not great - a little dry and overcooked.   Trendy. Value for price was ok.  Bacon was awesome - nice & crispy.  Steak was average - little guy added ketsup.  Service staff awesome Atmosphere awesome Food good.  We'll be back!

IRDkDefsfDB3fsI1qpDuCg.text: Wow what a surprise. I have skipped the place for a while. Just forgot about because it is hidden gem. The trout was outstanding and the service was too. I am always hard to please and they were great. The prices seemed to have come down too. After I had a 20 dollar breakfast I avoided them. I will be back for sure.

fW6efHMG1pOJBuqhVQle1Q.text: Very family friendly! That counts for a lot in this house. Breakfast is the only meal that we actually attempt to eat out with 3 preschoolers. Last week, the wait on a Sunday morning was almost 45 minutes but once we were seated our server was incredibly prompt and attentive. I was most impressed when my 2 year old ordered a hot chocolate and they brought her a mildly tepid version - kudos for that! The kids menu is simple and priced right - $5. They added chocolate chips to the kids pancakes for$.50. The kids' meals all came with a huge dish of beautiful fruit. My husband ordered an omelet special and it was fantastic. I ordered the banana pecan French toast and it really was too sweet for my taste.  Today we had no wait but the service was slightly less fantastic. My husband was served coffee with no cream or sugar and our salt shaker was empty. Our food was excellent but I was ready to bus my own table at the end because my kids were so antsy and the check was nowhere in sight. My husband finally had to give in and just take the kids out while I waited for the check. Still our fave breakfast place - will probably be back soon!

4oAB7-46LUZoxUQU6teriA.text: Had brunch at the Terrace Cafe on a recent weekend morning. It is a bit ironic that a place called the Terrace Cafe doesn't have any outdoor seating, but my understanding is that the other location does? We waited about 20 minutes for a table and were seated upstairs. Our waitress was very friendly and personable (Julie, I think.) I had the salted caramel latte, which was delicious, as well as the biscuit and gravy with fruit salad. They make the sausage in house, and it was very good. The dish comes with one large biscuit, smothered in their cream sausage gravy. I was a happy camper. My one complaint was that the fruit salad was a little bit warm - I would have preferred it cold and fresh out of the fridge. I'm sure we'll return for brunch, but I'd also like to try some of their lunch and dinner offerings -

WFtmP_pwzkpZl8O23zIasg.text: my favorite brunch spot. you will have to wait unless you are there at like 930am, but its worth it. get a latte, fruit cup, hash browns, waffle or benedict. the oyster salad and she crab soup are AWESOME.

8x1vAjTmDNnR8_6JhIi9QA.text: So, I was down in Charlotte for a couple days for a wedding.  The hotel I was staying at had an overpriced, lackluster breakfast buffet, so I decided to venture out to find food elsewhere.  After reading the reviews here on Yelp, I headed to The Terrace Cafe.  Normally when I'm in a strange town, I never eat at the same place twice as I want to try as much of the local scene as possible.  But after going to the Terrace Cafe on the first day, I decided to break this rule and head back on the second day.  On the first day, my wife and I were quickly seated.  She ordered the SEC breakfast sandwich, and I ordered the Belgian malted waffles.  Seth, the waiter, said to me "Do you like bacon?"  Which I replied "I'm a guy.  Of course I like bacon."  He then told me that I should try the bacon waffle.  I decided to give a shot.  Now, Seth made it sound like the Bacon Waffle was better than sex.  Poor guy looked so disappointed when I told him it was "pretty good" (That really is a very high compliment from me.)  So, Bacon Waffle not better than sex, but definitely amongst the top breakfast's out there.  Wife enjoyed her SEC as well.    The next day, more relatives arrived for the wedding and we decided to head back to Terrace Cafe, but this time with a group of 8.    Again, we were sat very quickly, and Seth even remembered the wife and I from the day before.  I went with the more traditional Eggs Benedict, and Wife had an omelet.  The eggs benedict were the best I've had in quite some time (It's amazing how the hollandaise sauce can vary so much from restaurant to restaurant.)  Wife thoroughly enjoyed her omelet.  Now, as if the main breakfast entrees aren't enough to get you to come to Terrace Cafe, Then consider their sides.  I had their hash browns both days.  Pure fried shredded potato goodness.  Wife had the fruit cup, which she said is the best fruit she's ever had at a restaurant as it included some more exotic fruits.    I wish we had one more day in Charlotte as I really wanted to try the red velvet waffle.  Someone at the table next to us on the first day had it as a breakfast desert (seriously, they both had eggs benedict, which is quite filling, then split a red velvet waffle afterwards.)  I recommend this place for anyone in the Charlotte area.  It's traditional southern breakfast with a modern twist.

KGGsMbK8gbrZoQqCS19Vdg.text: Awesome brunch and dinner us actually pretty good. Red velvet waffle is to die for. Must try if you are looking for a great Sunday brunch.

N8DUebznLOF1i5kpkoMdOg.text: Food is really good.  But, the service is extremely slow. For some reason, they have difficulty with large groups.  Strange for a breakfast and brunch restaurant.  If you have plenty of time and don't mind a long wait, this is definitely a great option.  If you have a group of six or more, call ahead.

nNEPNAtxO5HYqPBpakmOXw.text: Love the ambience, vibe, and the food. Enough said.

hGXmpNC9eQwYTnVkh4x6Bw.text: Well, where to begin... so we ate there at around 9 on a weekday, Rather slow time of the day, yet you couldn't tell from server presence. Real nice guy that served us. He started out super nice and approachable, then he just vanished after opening spiel. This is when it's crumbled, bad food plus lack of care on staffs part. Shrimp m grits, shrimp grotesquely undercooked, and it was possible either microwaved or boiled. . Nastee!!! Then my friends hash browns we're burned on outside yet chilled in center. This is when you know that nobody is concerned is when all the shrimp are still on plate yet grits r eaten. One would think to ask if there was something wrong with the dish, being main component was not ate. SERVER SIMPLY HURRIED ALONG AND DROPPED CHECK, NOT ONCE ASKING HOW OUR MEAL WAS. POOR FORM. LACKLUSTER STAFF WILL/AND DOES BRING THE RESTAURANT DOWN. A CHARISMATIC  SERVER WOULD OF HANDLED THIS WITH CARE AND WOULD MAKE ME NOT CONCERNED WITH THE FOOD PROBLEM, NOT HEIGHTEN CURRENT SITUATION.

XKsnCm9qQTKCesHUC8ccOw.text: Recently, I was asked to head over to Terrace Cafe and I must say that I was reluctant to do so.  I usually avoid cafes, especially new and modern ones, as I always feel that I am not part of their target demographic.  Atmosphere - Bright, Clean, Open, IKEA-ish, Funky Drink Glasses (that I have seen before...I know I have) and Fake Wood menus (not sure where that comes from)?  Food - While their menu has an extensive breakfast listing, I opted for lunch...a healthy one...and an apparently charitable one.  I ordered the Fruit Salad w/ chicken, one of the two YMCA nutritionist approved items (look for the black and red "Y") with a portion of the sale going to the YMCA.  This way I ate healthy and felt good about myself...wow, I am a great person!  This salad is very similar to the one I enjoy at the now Chapter 11-filed Max & Erma's.  This salad, like M&E's consists of mixed greens, grilled chicken, pecans, blue cheese, apples, and grapes, which is then topped with some red (or pink) raspberry vinaigrette dressing.  As the norm for me, I asked for the dressing on the side...it is healthier...wow, I am smart too.  The chicken was just okay as it tasted like they wiped the "black char" off the grill with it.  I mean it had the grill marks that I expected but it was also pretty much smeared with black grill soot (I doubt that the nutritionist approved that!).  The portion size of the salad was fine to a little on the skimpy side.  The dressing, while it was pink (see second sentence in this review), was all right and not too sweet.  Overall, it was a decent salad for lunch.   Service - Hmmm...okay the place was busy and it was lunchtime...the order was received as placed...water filled once...it was...15% tip type service.  Price - Salad $11.  For the quantity of the grilled chicken given in the salad...go to Max & Erma's.  Then again, maybe that is why they are going broke.  Overall - The menu did have several other items listed that seemed interesting.  Okay, would I go here again... maybe...maybe with a date...like a lunch date?  Now, I must go drink a beer and work on my car or something manly...pink dressing...um, what???

YifrCLh40pCUWqupwWsQTQ.text: All I should have to say is...S'mores French Toast!!! But, then this wouldn't be a review!!   We ventured in for a late lunch a while back it wasn't very busy with just a few tables in there. I had the Buffalo Chicken sandwich it was ok nothing that really stood out to be bad but not that good either.  I forget what my boss ordered I know it was a special, but he didn't care for it. My sister had the Quiche it was ice cold and then had to sit there with nothing to eat because the server wasn't around...when he did come over he ran to the kitchen to get it fixed she said it was of course much better!!   Now the real reason this place is getting 3 stars is because of the S'mores French Toast that we decided to have for dessert!!! OMG this was ridiculously good!! I highly recommend it not for your entree but to share with others as a dessert because it is huge and sweet!!

A0ZFIMQNPwTYkVMFZqBu_g.text: I really enjoyed my breakfast. I couldn't finish my steak and eggs so I took the rest to go. It was still good later on as a snack. The staff was polite. The atmosphere was peaceful.

PTWbqtmsKXg1kOhwu2gVYw.text: So sad. This location is excellent. The food is above average. The decor is lovely. The service...ugh. Why? Why? Why? It's so easy to fix?!? SMILE a little!! Even my teen-age sons said that our server didn't look like he enjoyed his job very much. Couldn't get refills on coffee to save my life. I admit, it was brunch...so coffee is a crazy request! He really missed out too. I'm a 50% tipper if the service is at least fair - as I understand everyone has a bad day. But NOBODY was smiling. Everyone looked miserable. And if your servers are miserable, that means your management is miserable. And if your management is miserable, than I certainly don't want to add to the funds of an owner that makes people miserable. Will give it another go, as I try to give everyone a 2nd chance, have even experienced a couple of turn-arounds...but man - it could be such a warm, successful, happy place...{sigh}

uTMt02MObNmskN1fkVnAoA.text: The food was good but if you're going there on a weekend to sit at the bar, don't expect the best service. It took at least ten minutes for someone to actually come over and say anything to me. I had to yell to someone over the noise "can I get a menu?" Finally when the girl said she was coming to wipe down the area where I was sitting, she never came back so when I saw her again I had to ask if she was going to wipe it down. She said "we're super busy I'm so sorry I'll get to it as soon as I can." She finally came back five minutes later wiped it down and finally asked what I wanted, 15 minutes after I'd arrived. Then some woman, who is barely dressed, halter top, skin showing, boobs out, THE WORKS, comes in, sits at the bar, takes off her expensive sunglasses and places her expensive purse down, and all the staff behind the bar come rushing to her asking what she needs, does she want water, how's she doing. Its funny because even with all her expensive possessions, she was asking "well how much if I do this or that?" If you can afford those expensive glasses but can't buy some eggs, get your priorities in order. All I can do is look like "well perhaps next time I'll show a little more skin and flash a flirty smile so people will wait on me hand and foot." It's amazing what people will do when they "think" customers have money. This is crazy. I thought I left crap like that in Atlanta but I guess it's all the same in Charlotte. (ps chick took a pic of her food to post on Soc media when it came, wow. Real classy) Thanks for the omelette tho, Terrace Cafe. -Sincerely, Frustrated ISU Doc Student on a writing break looking for good food and service

TzOoWoB6FW4F9LdLhDVxBQ.text: I highly recommend this place to everyone! They close their breakfast and brunch at 2:30 (which is a bummer) and reopen later for dinner. I love everything on their menu but some of my all time favorites is shimp & gritz, fillet Benedict, salmon Asian salad, crab cake blt and the red velvet waffle. Their servers are just the sweetest!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asian Salad with salmon! And the top dish is the Crab Cake BLT! YUMMERZZZ

jQ4nAzDyY-VIlC0UxJgIFw.text: 11/15/10 Terrace Cafe was a place I'd bookmarked weeks before my sister had mentioned hearing about its red velvet waffle from a coworker. It sounded so delicious to her, she couldn't wait for us to try it! Thank goodness her GPS system was cooperating that morning-- we found the parking garage easily. Reaching the cafe proved a little bit tougher, even when I stopped to ask a security guard. Or maybe we were just a little past the point of starving?? I really liked the entrance of the cafe, which had a nice-looking deli case full of specialty juices, pre-made salads, and dessert. I really liked the energy here and was hoping we'd be able to sit at one of the two empty tables, but we were relegated to the back of the restaurant, where the energy was significantly muted (quite sleepy, actually), and the atmosphere there (from the large and dull wall paintings and dim lighting) made me think we were dining at a generic hotel chain restaurant after the buffet rush. Service was very slow, as well, which I thought was odd, given that there was only one other occupied table besides ours. After much deliberation as to what to order, we decided on the Red velvet waffle ($10), the California French toast ($10), a side of bacon ($3.50), and a side of two eggs, scrambled ($2.50). We also ordered coffee for the table. Mom and sister enjoyed their scrambled eggs, and we all liked the hash browns, extra-crispy on the outside by request, that I chose to accompany the waffle (options also included grits and fruit). The bacon slices were thick-cut, wonderfully-crisped, and flavorful-- well-worth the $3.50 price tag. Mom and I found the coffee to be very weak... Funny that sis and I were drawn to this place w/ the promise of earth-shattering delicious red velvet waffle, which she found to be boring, and I to be too fluffy and lacking of rich, chocolatey goodness, w/ its cream cheese drizzle proving to be too sweet to flip over this flop of a breakfast treat! yelp.com/biz_photos/bzbN... BUT there was a light at the end of the tunnel, and it was the California French toast! yelp.com/biz_photos/bzbN... This beauty of a dish consisted of three large slices of orange-scented French toast, which were drizzled w/ orange-infused honey and a side of wonderful cranberry butter! I wished I'd ordered this, instead! I wished I'd ordered anything other than that silly waffle! But I digress... Really, the French toast is not to be missed. I would, however, request for a crispier crust, should we ever return.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

b9aKtR-4KHMclDYwZme0XQ.text: If you leave here after breakfast and are able to eat lunch, you are not human. Food is wonderful here and very filling from all sorts of breakfast options.

EBfHQbLWU4Jb31OytiefZw.text: Great brunch! Gourmet waffles, French toast, pancakes, and wonderful service. Will surely become a must-have for us!

moewV3BVxE1_lOG2x2FM7g.text: Love this place. Everything is delicious. The drinks are amazing. The orange juice makes me never want to drink any other orange juice. And they have this blueberry jam or maybe blueberry peach. It is uhhh-mazing.

cKyEEw9hS57IURqUbdr2jw.text: The food here was good but nothing on the menu was stand-out. The eggs benedict with crab cakes was okay but the cheesy grits, fried green tomatoes, and chicken waffle were pretty good. The service was decent but the ambiance of the place was pretty lame. Overall, it was a decent experience but not amazing.

KOVUfUf4DFfhJune9Sl03w.text: First time at the Terrace Cafe and I can say that it definitely live up to the hype.    I am rather discerning about my desserts and red velvet is my favorite however I rarely find a really good red velvet anything. With that said, the red velvet waffles were amazing.  Light and fluffy; kinda opposite of how a red velvet cake or cupcake is but it works.  It is flavorful and the cream cheese icing is as light and perfect.  I am extremely impressed.    The shrimp and grits was delicious and savory.  I only had a bite but will definitely order it on another occasion.    I may not be a connoisseur of fried green tomatoes since I am not a Southerner and thought these were alright. I probably wouldn't order them again.  If you are in the Queen City, definitely make the time to come to the Terrace Cafe! A must stop on your culinary path.

cj95HHCxJGAKsmwgKvj91g.text: We just had a horrific experience at this restaurant. 4 ladies trying to have a nice lunch. It took 2 hours to complete the lunch! Servers got mixed up, no refills offered and once we ordered- it took over 35 minutes to get the food. I got a salad. Ridiculous. After I spoke to the manager, he took $1 off of the tickets. Are you kidding me? This is horrible customer service. Don't waste your time. You can find a salad anywhere- cheaper and quicker.

JRCMDT35quAtKvHBPmyE2A.text: Went to Terrace Cafe for lunch and had an excellent experience.  Portions were large and filling and service was excellent.  The Shrimp and Grits is definitely a great menu item.  The Steak salad is a more than generous portion.  I would recommend this to anyone...each time I go, I have a good experience.    Service was excellent as Matthew did a phenomenal job.  A manager even stopped by and was very pleasant as well.

XvETjvCYJTYLPG5ml075Ow.text: I'm writing the review as I'm sitting at the booth. I was really excited to try this restaurant but I know I will NEVER be coming back. The waitress was nice (Jennifer) however she had no idea what she was doing. She never brought us straws or silverware we had to ask for both. When our food finally arrived it was cold and we were missing hash browns. Jennifer said they would be right out however they never came. after 25 mins I asked for the manager and he brought them back in two mins. The manager even said "that is the easiest dish to get" After all that we were informed that the credit card machine was down so we waited an additional 20 minutes. This place is overpriced for the poor quality and service. Save your money.

rCmg1Zi3N1GWfsiQsVUaCg.text: Went for breakfast today for the first time. I had the steak with egg whites, hash browns and a biscuit.  The steak was juicy and tender.  I usually ask for my hash browns to be well done but not here.  They were crunchy on the top just right in the middle.  The way I like them.  New spot definitely.

zT-CmUOzBB-ZP5fTmJj_gg.text: The breakfast here is amazing! Specifically the big breakfast... The only thing odd here is the parking situation but the service has been great the few times I've been here the atmosphere is great even though it is rather tiny in size but don't let that fool you

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love the glasses here

0fbeCIOXyCUEOkJYYEr2Kw.text: I'm very confused how this restaurant has positive reviews. We just finished our third (and hopefully last) time eating here, and every experience has been disappointing.  From mediocre service to poor quality food, this restaurant is a miss.

kLkDoc3-Edv2v5ZoDVqbdg.text: During the Holiday season, my family and I enjoyed an amazing meal at Terrace Cafe.  It was my second visit there and I was so excited to take my girls back for a treat.  As with my first visit, the food was phenomenal and the service matched the food.  Our table was well represented with egg dishes and sweet bites...two orders of veggie omelet, a California Waffle, and Blueberry Buttermilk Pancakes.  The coffee is good and the wait staff was on stand-by for refills.  This was a great way to spend some quality family time together.

an6NnzKPWRHNQDMSI6mvBw.text: I was staying nearby and wanted a yummy spot for breakfast, yelp told me this was a good spot. I was not disappointed. I was there around 9am on a weekday, so not very busy. All the staff were super friendly and accommodating. I really like how the menu has some funny, quirky items, like the red velvet waffle (what I had and holey-moley was it awesome!), the banana split yogurt parfait, and a chocolate covered cherry latte. The food was very good and service great. When I told my server I thought the latte was not flavored enough, she took it back and added more syrup.  There was a lot of seating, but I could see why this place might get packed with people at peak times. I will be going back here again the next time I am in Charlotte for sure!

QaCyLMQFG1uJCLIwlyMvGw.text: The steak seems getting smaller but the flavor is still there. The Texas chili bowl is tasty

VEOl1guZQZDYGFYhW48iAg.text: Best food for breakfast! I love their coffee and I've tried many different breakfasts and loved them all. The staff is great with service and very friendly. The wait is never too long either.

ZqDcxVjXSh61wXq1MHDDXA.text: I've been coming to Terrace Cafe for almost 5 years and it has always been one of my go to spots - until recently. The last 4 times were awful, but I kept coming back hoping that the experience was an anomaly. I've found hair in my food more times than I can count. My food has often come out cold. The waitress/waiter has taken an unbelievably long time to even take our drink order and most recently, a simple water and coffee order was botched. It's hard to justify coming here anymore - even though the food is really good, what's the point in experiencing bad service, cold food, and finding a hair in your eggs.

V6Nhaqx7ipYzLkF81HvdxA.text: Food was good and atmosphere was good.  And apparently Friday night was $5 glass of wine night!   I am already predisposed to love any place with breakfast all day anyway but the menu was a good mix of other options as well.  I had the red velvet waffles with chicken. Yeah pretty awesome. My wife had the strange-sounding but delicious crab cake BLT.  We will definitely go back!

sqpsLYT7iV-3VwjznhUfrw.text: We ordered the Velvet Waffle.  It was Oh boy super delicious.  It was cruchy outside and soft inside so perfect.  I can eat about 20 of their waffles in one meal no problem.  The price is reasonable average about 10 dollars per dishes.  The seating is so cute, upstair and downstair.  On the upstair, they set up as a terrace so u could see thru the down stairs.

I5XYCqM-Z9kAhi04M18E2Q.text: I have been here a handful of times in the past and it was pretty good.  I went this week and it was terrible.  The food just didn't taste good and came out sort of warm.  The staff seemed too busy taking pictures of stuff that day and we were one of only 3 tables of people.  My friend asked for some salsa to try to add some flavor to her eggs and there was a $3 charge for it on her bill, which she was not told about ahead of time.  I had several $1 charges on my bill for random things also not mentioned to me.  My omelette and my one year old's kids meal was $30.

29H_SaTie2FOaFtGU8ivJA.text: I went here with my girlfriend a few times now and it is officially confirmed... 5 stars. If you want mind blowing breakfast this is the place. Be ready for a wait on the weekends. The word is out that this place is good because there is always a crowd. Our waitress was great too!! Ask for Savanna she was quick and accurate and always smiling and made our experience all the better! Try the stuffed French toast! Wow!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

I32bkVeiWYaOwlZV-NIlIA.text: Terrance Cafe is such an awesome place. The staff is very welcoming and the restaurant is inviting. I thought it was so nice that they had upstairs seating which overlooked the whole restaurant. Although this place is known for their brunch I ordered from the lunch menu. I order some type of fried chicken and veggies. My brother ordered the same thing but subbed the veggies out for a salad. When my brother got his check the price of subbing the salad was the full price of the salad. When asking the Server about it she took off $2. The portions aren't very big so if you have a big Appetite like myself this may not be the place for you. Over all the food was good along with the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nashville Fried Chicken-cheesy mashed potatoes-veggie melody
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cakes

iJkwsuuHEn_TTPOYiKWOzA.text: I thoroughly enjoyed celebrating my birthday here with friends at brunch. The red velvet waffle is perfection. I would recommend that to anyone. It was surprisingly soft & spongy, while tender at the same time. The flavors were perfect. I had shrimp & grits & the flavors there were great as well- kind of remenecent of fajitas. While I loved the shrimp & grits I do think they were in need of a texture variant. It a BIG bowl of soft, kind of mushiness... i didn't think the shrimp & okra alone provided enough texture. A friend offered me her toast & I thought that worked great with the grits (they should consider always serving it with toast) Mimosas- while I wouldn't say they're worth the $8, I still thought they were nice. The poppy seed French toast- while I loved the flavors of that, I found the poppy seed in the toast I could've done without. Service was great, bathrooms were small but nice & clean. Overall, I loved it & will definitely return soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

IP_wqedtkX9HjCySAhjhaA.text: Red Velvet Waffles were definitely a winner but I have tried a few more items and they were equally delicious. For me the lemon poppyseed pancakes were on the thicker side very dense but everything else I have had her has been delicious!

rDBNSGoZpUf4m2pSLrjf4w.text: Love, love, love. I have only been for breakfast but it is amazing. I got the waffle and fried green tomatoes, nice portion.  Coffee is good. Quality of food is outstanding. For the price can't beat it. Will be back.

sUTDKnZxGQw6Fg-7lIBDQA.text: It is very disappointing to give this place one star because, the food is very very good! However, the last THREE times we have dined here have been disastrous each time. The hostess is unfriendly and cannot quote a wait time properly, the waiters have no sense of urgency and all seem unhappy and other employees seem miserable too. I ordered a fruit platter which was missing coffee cake and half the fruit, our French press only filled half of each coffee cup and we were charged full price for both of these items... we didn't want to ask for anything extra because it was so busy!! Previously we had dined here and service was exceptional along with food quality but they have taken an unfortunate turn for the worse. Despite the great food and dining here more than ten times we will not be returning.

jC_EW-nq8_Lm5cwnbFqR7Q.text: The red velvet was good,but I've tasted better...Just being honest...The server was on point...The shrimp and grits was very good...I must say it was different...So Come try them out...Nice environment and very nice people
