lSWwmyjjHYnASmZYWNWeXQ.text: So many of my friends have told me of this place.  I went today for the first time!!! Wow! All the Food looked so amazing and it taste Great!!  We were seated quickly and they were very welcoming, however the Food I loved the flavor and it taste delicious tried to eat it but it was cold :( even after we sent it back still came back cold  I was sad because I ordered the Caramel Apple French Toast "it was cold and my cheese eggs where ok except they were cold so the cheese didn't really melt. Didnt get the full French Toast  you get 2 for $11 to add eggs is $4 to add cheese is  $1  .. it was all cold.. kitchen at the door,,,, plates at the window ppl sitting waiting to eat waitresses talking and not helping each other push food out to customers is why my food was cold! They are a great business and Food is A++++++ but it was cold because they were not helping to push the Food out to customers"  Experience

7_dWN7tBmhEz2taanXrOCw.text: My first time here today and went with girlfriends for brunch. It was a Saturday morning and pretty busy. Took about 45 minutes to get a table around 10:30 am and everyone needs to be there before you'll be seated. No reservations are taken for brunch at this location.   All of us enjoyed our food. I had the famous red velvet waffles with hash browns and mimosas. Delicious and I would go back for the breakfast casserole, biscuits and gravy or chicken and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet waffles with cream cheese topping, hash browns and a mimosa!

vmLC6n7B774gDJkIaZVImg.text: Food: I had the red velvet waffle, grits and biscuit & gravy.  The red velvet waffle is soft and not the crispy kind that you may get at some restaurant. On top of the waffle, they add white chocolate sauce and strawberry. Overall, it's pretty tasty. It's probably my fav thing here this far.   Grits is pretty blend. There's not enough seasoning on it. I may ask to upgrade to cheesy grits next time.  Biscuit and gravy: the biscuit is crispier than I would like. It's not those soft and fluffy kind. The gravy is pretty good. It has real chuck of ground beef not bitty tiny piece of ground beef which I can appreciate.   Customer service: the wait time is about 30 mins when we got here this morning. They promptly let us know when the table is ready. Our waitress is really attentive. The food came out in 10 mins. We are pretty happy with the service.   Location: The place is easy to find and free parking is right next to the building.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits &amp; biscuit and gravy

fqxAXs5NHlCnK70tXpewRQ.text: Great ambiance, reasonable wait, AMAZING food. Get the red velvet waffle and eggs Benedict. The waffle is soft and sweet but not overly so, and just thinking about the melted cream cheese atop makes me salivate. The eggs Benedict florentine was also incredible, with an excellent balance of salty mustard with crispy fried onions and tomato and perfectly poached eggs that broke beautifully before oozing into the warm English muffin.  Pro-tip: if you just order the waffle without the sides, it's $8. Perfect for sharing ;)  Terrace Cafe doesn't take brunch reservations, but our party of 4 arrived on a Saturday at 11am. We waited for only 30 minutes.

7INlGIMs51kyVxa_L-Ouxg.text: We stoped into Terrace Cafe for brunch on a Monday afternoon. We were promptly greeted and quoted a 20 minute wait time. After about 5-7 minutes we were sat and greeted by our server, Julie. It seemed as though Ms. Julie was a little overwhelmed by being sat multiple times in a row, but she still provided decent service. Our food came out in a little over 10 minutes. We ordered a Full Breakfast with grits, bacon, scrambled eggs and a Belgium waffle( substituted for two pancakes). As well as the Lemon Poppyseed French Toast with a side of cheesy stone grits and bacon.   Both meals were served piping hot and were very delicious!   I must say we enjoyed almost everything from the food to the restaurants classy, but relaxed atmosphere! We'll definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full Breakfast with grits, eggs, bacon, and a waffle
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. From Terrace Cafe&#39;s Southern Kitchen: Cheesy Stone Grits- Well seasoned, thick and creamy grits. - a side of bacon
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. From Terrace Cafe&#39;s Southern Kitchen: Lemon Poppyseed French Toast

ul-y-4TXoOh_YrgIMyWcJw.text: Dont believe the hype with this place  Red Velvet Waffle with chicken!!! The cream cheese drizzle on top of the waffle  was decent. Chicken was two small tenders and not enough meat to be satisfied. I couldn't eat the hash browns, it smell weird and were under cooked. The waffle was tasteless and a bust.  The food  was a big disappointment and definitely not worth paying $18.00! It looked much better than it tasted.  Dont waste your time coming here. It is located in a nice area, but the cafe is very small with limited seating and looks outdated for the area.   Go somewhere else if your craving chicken and waffles. There was another location in Charlotte that sells it for $5.00-$7.00 with great reviews. If you choose to go here and feel disappointed after. You can only blame yourself, you was warned

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small chicken tenders

gvhaBtP4U7QNjmx_4SdiAw.text: Very cute place in the cut. Drive past it all the time and never went. My sister brought me and said the food was amazing. Everything was good from the food to the service. My sister ordered hot tea and it was so good(peach). Across from the mall under some apartments(or maybe condos). Chris was so nice and very attentive. I had the chicken and plain waffle. Loved it. I ate it all. Didn't like my hash browns though. Tasteless. Everything else was delicious. It was 29 for both of our meals. Not bad. Def worth it. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked great. Def will go back. Parked across the street at ENT office(so not sure about the parking). Came after an appointment. No wait. Sat ourselves at the bar. Was after lunch time so it wasn't too busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Terrace cafe

Ydx37kUz4ZKRAT_6phfAiA.text: Went on a Sunday morning about 10. Got one of the last empty seats. When we came out there was a crowd waiting.   Food was good. Ordered the crispy chicken biscuit. It has some heat to it. The hashbrowns were ok. Nothing special. My husband really enjoyed his red velvet waffle. And my parents enjoyed their omelets.   The waiter left something to be desired. No personality. Made weird comments and never checked on us once the food was delivered. My husband didn't get his side of hasbrowns until after he had finished his waffle and we all needed refills.   The water also has a weird taste.

j6jTRtZdp5YpSfSkBJTkhg.text: I hate to do this, but my last few visits to Terrace Cafe have just been ok... certainly not worthy of the 5 stars I gave them a couple of years ago.  During today's breakfast visit, the fella and I sat at the bar. Our server was kind of arrogant and yet didn't know what was in the Berry Split I ordered (my usual). Thankfully, another server overheard him and corrected him. It also took him forever to bring our check, and we finally had to stop him and ask for it since he was too busy talking to the other 3 guys behind the bar.  When I got the Berry Split, it was literally half the size it used to be. There was one, small dollop of yogurt and maybe one banana split in half. Sprinkle on a tiny bit of granola and fruit, and that was it. However, they certainly didn't lower the price; it was still $11! The fella ordered a small OJ, which was $3.50 and maybe 8 ounces. Yikes. His benedict and grits were fine, but there just wasn't anything stellar on this visit or our last few. Pretty disappointing since this used to be my hands-down favorite breakfast in town.

_bYt2bE26p2a46rh0u5F9g.text: Might just be one of the best breakfasts I've had in my entire life. Everything about our meal was pure passion. My woman had the chicken and red velvet waffles (so good I always had an orgasm) I had the chef's skillet and lemon poppy French toast which put me in heaven

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

bzeqWASFsKdQo7s0wII4ow.text: Decided to try Terrace Cafe with my family coming from in town for brunch, so I wanted to show my expertise on good brunch food and hopefully score a big win for Terrace Cafe. The hostess got us a table in a timely manner and that was unexpected especially with the amount of people waiting. After seating, the waitress was prompt in getting us water and drinks ordered in and even after a change in servers we were able to get our orders in. The food for the most part was delicious, but the vegan chicken was not well received by my sister in-law. However everything else was amazing and it is a highly recommended brunch spot for anyone who enjoy good meals and won't break the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Out to eat with mom.

AqBU5UuQ1ivDvwjl-3_AiA.text: The food was very delicious, very immaculate place, great service. Just a very good experience

u67roSgqlIgMsdyJmPSE4A.text: While in Charlotte decided to visit this place, I had read that it was a great place for breakfast. First of all I imagine an actual terrace , but it was just two floors indoors. Their menu was large with a lot of options. I got the eggs Benedict and fruit. The fruit was blah and it tasted old unfortunately, The eggs where good.  The service was super slow almost, I had to go get my own condiments since waitress never came to check after I got my food ( by another person). She checked on me once the entire time, only because I waved for more coffee . Other than that, the place was nice, it had more of a business atmosphere. I wouldn't say it was the best breakfast I ever had, it was ok. But maybe it depends what you eat. Would I eat there again? Prob not .

X_S8MQK0pGBKT_v8gyDxgQ.text: This is by far the best breakfast I have had. Their efficiency, cleanliness, customer service and the food IS AMAZING !!!! They are so professional, food comes out quickly even on their busiest times! They are courteous and the crab cakes Benedict is to die for! Their carrot cake pancakes?!? AHMAZING ! We sat at the bar both times and watched the employees work together and the food come out. Such a great environment, everyone worked so well together and they wore gloves etc. I can't explain how amazing it is. JUST COME AND EAT! Their mimosas are great as well!

Am12ZHPfZ4TkP2J_PfGZUA.text: I'm from Louisiana so I've had many types of shrimp and grits. They come in different flavors depending on the chef preference. These are in my top 5. They were very flavorful with a good amount of spice. The grits were creamy and blended great with the gravy. I highly suggest trying them if you are here.   The employees are wonderful here, very friendly and always smiling. The regulars know all their names and tell them stories like they are old friends.   They have a really good coffee bar where people can order to go coffee at the front and the line moves quickly.   A great little find in this cute town so glad I came and might come back tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

nbztirWjn4V5JSBJK6_wiA.text: Approximate wait time on weekends can be over an hour! But worth the wait. I have been here multiple times to Grab latte during weekdays but never really had brunch/lunch here until one weekend we decide to go there and realize wait time is way too much given that we were starving ! But this weekend managed to wait for 1hr 10 mins before getting  a table. Good service and good food made it up for this though. Had the "Benedict-Florentine" which has fried onions on the top that really adds twist and great flavor. Also tried "Smothered Chicken" from Lunch menu. Must mention the orange juice was very fresh and so the cafe au lait was great! Highly recommended..

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Left- smothered chicken Right- Benedict Florentine with fried onions on the top!!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Orange Juice  Cafe au Lait

-W57Y0os0F4jjRoM_DnxRA.text: This is one of my most favorite Charlotte brunch spots! They never fail at providing a especially tasteful meal. I went here Saturday around 1pm with my mom and baby cousin for brunch. I would love to give this place 5 stars but I've been here 3 times and I experience similar issues every time. It seems the kitchen and staff have a hard time handling the volume of service they get because they either mess up your food, forget to bring something out (and you have to keep reminding them) or your food never makes it back out after a mess up. This time they forgot to bring out the baby's (he's 3) Teddy Bear waffle so I had to share my food with him so he didn't go hungry. The waiter came back without the waffle and asked if we were okay (completely forgetting that we never got the teddy bear waffle). She apologized and ran off to get it but by the time she returned my mom and I both had finished out food (the teddy bear waffle was taken off the check).   Despite the mishaps the food is great enough to be patient with the staff. I had a red velvet waffle with chicken on the side which was perfectly seasoned to pair perfectly with the waffle. My mom had the shrimp and grits with was flavorful and interestingly enough came topped with a couple pieces of fried okra. We also had Sunrise Mimosas to compliment our meal because what's brunch without mimosas, right? In the past I have had the lemon poppy seed french toast which is topped with berries, also a great choice to try!  I highly recommend this place for brunch just expect a wait on the weekends and prepare to be patient with the staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z2HhWexTp4LqJSUyB-z8bQ.text: Good food, poor customer service. We are not sure if it was a 1 ratio of waiter to all the customers in there, but our waiter made our experience here horrible. When he took our order and came back with our drinks, he never bothered giving us utensils. We had to ask from the server who gave us our food if we can have some utensils. The waiter came around when he saw we finished our food. He took away our food and then came back with the check. Hmm..how did he know we didn't want to order something else? He didn't. On the mini bright side, the red velvet waffles were good. Other than that, I would not come back if I were to visit Charlotte again.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit, eggs, bacon and chicken sausage
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Check in here

SJpeO1TLqqBcBOg8cgxscg.text: This is my spot in South Park for brunch.  Consistently good food, and a cosy, warm atmosphere.  Great for a date or to bring the whole family!  When I take my girl we usually split one of their sweet options to start like Brioche French toast or Lemon Poppy Seed French toast!  Plus they have a full bar with flavored mimosas or lattes if you have things to do later!   We usually like to sit on the balcony overlooking the downstairs of the restaurant.

BTQiI5evm-_rhNsoaGcg7Q.text: My first time going. Was visiting Charlotte for the weekend and wanted some good breakfast. Definitely wasn't disappointed. Food was great. Even had vegan options for my brother. The red velvet waffles were amazing. Next time I'm in Charlotte I'll be sure to be back.  Great service also.

LFgOvaOnSCg0m3S7KnF0uA.text: Breakfast: eggwhite omelette with a side of tasted fresh and delicious, I recommend.  Lunch: My first time having Shrimp and Grits EVER and I absolutely loved it, the shrimp was cooked perfectly, the grits was creamy, the sauce and peppers was a perfect compliment to the dish. I can't wait to go back. I highly recommend this dish.

oJg0AzHGbNn2m-mR5Mms5Q.text: This place! There were 3 of us in our Saturday brunch party, and we had a 15 minute wait around 1130 am. NOTE - they take reservations, but not for weekends.  We chose this Piedmont location - great area, not too crowded, and free garage parking literally next to the restaurant.   The place has a super cute, classy feel to it. There are 2 stories, and we were seated upstairs.   My sister got their stuffed French toast and it was unbelievable. Slightly crispy on the outside, soft otherwise, and the filling was delicious. My other sister tried the red velvet chicken and waffles - the waffle was one of the best red velvet waffles I've tried - drizzled to perfection with cream cheese.    I tried the Nasheville hot chicken with the sauce on the side! The chicken was a large, boneless piece and the sauce was perfect - not overly spicy, but definitely with a kick to it. I switched out my side to fries which were probably twice fried, but that much tastier, too!  Service was great and quick! Definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nashville Fried Chicken with fries
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bavarian Creme Stuffed French Toast Sticks

8x5NJVXL9zEU1KRekMNsOQ.text: Great breakfast spot. Menu has a variety. Fast and friendly service. Very attentive. Coffee was nice and hot. I had the chicken and waffles, it was good. Not giving 5 stars because it wasn't over the top different from other breakfast spots. I will go again but isn't one the places I have to go to when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu and coffee

cFEs5gSuNuiGrme4x5G2Qw.text: Back again as tradition would have it. In town for the Charlotte Cup and the customary celebration feast of coach with competitors.  I am here annually and this time I ordered  just the chicken and red velvet waffle while my company tried buttermilk waffle, lemon poppyseed french toast and shrimp and grits. I could see a few modifications were made on the dishes like the addition of hush puppies and reduction of spicy gravy. Our server was pleasant and service was on point until the food came and my company kept ducking because the food was passed around across our faces and servers reached over our plates instead of around us to the left or even from behind. You lost a star for that because it was obvious we were getting annoyed.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon poppyseed french toast with berries. Bacon and sausage sides

x3kyyMU_66bzCgUrElSAOg.text: Located in a very lovely shopping area inside is Charlotte, this lovely breakfast spot was a bit difficult to find if you don't know what you're looking for. If you're on the look out for it, look for "terrace place" the "Stewart..." Portion of the sign is so small it'll throw you off.   Anyways enough rambling, this place is all about southern hospitality. The food is amazing and really brings you back to fresh home cooking. The staff is friendly and fun. The service is extremely fast but not rushed so you get to enjoy the food but don't have to wait too long to enjoy it. Would go back there simply to try the rest of their amazing menu as the selections all looked very appealing!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon poppy seed French toast. Amazingly delicious without any extra syrup. The French toast just melts in your mouth. An absolute must try!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunny side croissants
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict. The eggs were prepared just right!

IxAk5JCnWkTQxOeIOZTqKg.text: Oh my goodness I have died and gone to brunch heaven. Found this place through my fellow Yelpers and could not be happier with the food!! Crab cake Benedict was to die for. I ordered it with the hash browns and ended up mixing my plate all together- beautiful bites of hash browns, crispy crab cake and runny egg! We also got the spicy chicken biscuit and that was the perfect combination of spicy/sweet/salty! The jam was delicious! To finish off the meal we ordered the infamous red velvet waffle for dessert- DEAD. The waffle was cooked perfectly, slightly crisp on the outside and super fluffy interior. The waffle was not sweet but the cream cheese icing added the perfect level of sweet. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Still made with love even when finished!!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs cooked perfectly!!

P8OyOwfqe6NP22bjkTKskg.text: I was drawn to this restaurant because of its Red Velvet Waffle and I was not disappointed. The combination of the sweet waffle and savory chicken breast melted my taste buds. A great spin on a classic, Southern dish.   The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is welcoming. Upon arrival, I was immediately greeted by a hostess and seated. Within minutes of being seated, a waitress appeared. There was little to no wait. The food and beverage service is phenomenal.

22pWyfdrd4cSZLyZh_25nw.text: We came during Sunday Brunch. It was pretty packed. We got seated upstairs, and this was actually my second time here at Terrace. After hearing my parents rave about this place, we decided to go with them and sadly it wasn't the best.  The food was alright, but what really brought our visit down was the service. We literally saw the waitress three times the whole time we were there.  Once to ask for drinks, second for the order, and last for getting our bill. Literally no service at all.   The funny thing was that upstairs, you can sort of see what staff is doing... And let's just say our waiter was having her phone out, watching videos, and distracting other waiters of doing their job...seems like having a grand ol' time. I mean, who wouldn't like that? Go to work, only work a little... And then get tipped? I still tipped, but nothing like what I usually tip.  For food, I got the breakfast casserole. I thought it wasn't bad, but felt like it was missing maybe a sauce as it was a little dry on the outside. Maybe a gravy? I don't know. It was missing something I felt. It came with ketchup, but it didn't fulfill what was missing. It came out like a block straight from a casserole dish, which was what I was expecting, but then when you bit into it... it just tasted dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Casserole

1bBBMptuSQx7BO9YkPEqAw.text: Just nasty and not worth the price you pay. Never again would I come back here unless it's for a coffee. There waffle is not fluffy, it's like a waffle from a holiday inn Continental breakfast you get.

Pk4Pxu9tKTOK4NwGHK9t2A.text: The red velvet waffles are fantastic! Easily one of the best brunches in Charlotte.

p2YJet4uT_Bktqx9B2sxnQ.text: Good but not great. Service was relatively fast for a moderately busy Saturday morning. Though no lines when we arrived at 9am. Velvet waffles were good but wouldn't return just for those. Restaurant does have a nice ambiance.

uAS6wUAtaBLfBLzC0XhbHw.text: This is a fantastic brunch spot! That is evidenced by the fact that the place was packed! When my friend and I arrived, we were told the wait was 25 minutes but thankfully a table in the bar area opened up and we sat down quicker than the quoted 25 minutes. Chris was our server and he was very friendly, knowledgable about the menu and gave us his honest opinions about the dishes we had questions about. The food was so delicious and there was so much on the menu that looked good. I had the breakfast casserole, which was absolutely delicious but I can't wait to go back to try the shrimp and grits because they looked amazing! The bartender that morning (I wish I had gotten his name!) was amazing as well. Great service, great food, get there early!

cxbBnh3pCzOdutlrrLxg0w.text: The food was extremely awesome. The service was good. Wait time for food a little bit slow but worth to wait. Over all awesome

OHS3e4b3-NIK7E2g52asVw.text: I always have a wonderful experiece at Terrace Cafe. From the friendly staff to the kitchen crew, to the coffee bar.  I always have the most complicated orders and taste in food. I change up whatever is on the menu and create my own and being as to how I work for service industry I know how irrtating this can be. The waiter will always smile and say lets see what we can do and 9 times out of 10 pull through. When they can not fulfill they always have a way to still deliver the message without any issues.  Today my friend and I sat at the bar behind the expiditer Ryan Duncan (I believe thats what I read on his chef's coat) and the window to the cooks. They hustled their ass's off, getting food out Hot, sauces on point and out in timely fashion at the peak time of brunch.  My hat off to them, excellent staff overall, food is always fantastic. Great Job Terrace! My bill came out to $36 (I ordered a ton of food) and I left a $26 tip. If I had more I would tip even more. They deserve it!!! I am your biggest fan!!

ZAh2r7ysjbg8z__SrKD_3w.text: This was my first time visiting Terrace Cafe but it won't be my last. Everything was pleasant. The inside is a nice little cafe atmosphere with two levels to it. From the time we walked it we were greeted with friendly smiles. Our wait was only 30 mins so that wasn't bad. I had the Red Velvet. Waffles with Fried Chicken. Everything was deliscious. The chicken wasn't over cooked and had a great flavor to it. The Grits were just how I like them, nice and creamy. The Mimosa was even great. I look forward to coming back and trying the Crab Cakes Eggs Benedict.

J0wmIhDIJOILY5Yx_-Lf9A.text: Red velvet waffle is soooooo good!  Will try the chicken and waffles next time... One of my favorite combinations!

F9f3lRDkhGs6cfpOVuu3Yg.text: A la carte pricing isn't my favorite thing but the food is good. Nice atmosphere, parking, not bad....

BN0LX_UPe7qYfH8hldMqRQ.text: Don't know if it was a particular rough day or normal brunch.  Based on other reviews it seems like they are always busy so that doesn't explain the bartender that had a meltdown while we were waiting to order. He actually threw a lime. Service was great once seated.  Food came out luke-warm and needed seasoning.  Then again prefer that to over-salted.  Might give it another try or maybe not given the many other options in Charlotte.

g4N3fdD9jwSN4uMZSKK5Dw.text: May I vent first thing about Piedmont Row, not Terrace Cafe?  I was all excited about trying TC, I decided to meet  one of my friends for an early lunch.   I hop on my bike, a brand new orange Electra Townie no less and park it in between Terrace Cafe and Dolcetto, two businesses that we should frequent so they can thrive.  Don't you know some man from somewhere does not like my bike locked  to a light post, rats me out to the security guard and there is a ruckus to get me to move my bike.We had already been seated and ordered and our food was on the tray on the way out of the kitchen.  I am in the restroom and  my friend sees them shaking my lock and  looking at my bike, she goes out and they tell her to park it somewhere else.  My friend said, "our food is on the way, can't we move it in a minute?"  It had to be taken care of that instant.    What were they going to do?  Fine me?  Tow my bike?  Jeez.  I moved it, but now I think I should have protested.  WTF?  Anyway, back to the matter at hand.    Terrace Cafe....  When I arrive, I  order some coffee, my friend shakes her head and makes me try her coffee first.  WEAK.  Am I the only person that hates weak coffee in a breakfast establishment?  I don't want cowboy coffee, I just want some decent coffee.  So, I order a latte.  A beautiful latte comes out.  Yeah!!!   I vacillate between breakfast and lunch, what a big decision.  Lunch wins, I decide on a half sandwich and 2 soups.  Interesting.  The concept of two soups, why make a decision, have both!!!  Boo, they were redundant.  Two broth soups.  The server said chicken noodle and vegetable.  Maybe it was my Campbell soup upbringing thinking veggie soup was tomato, my bad.   The BLT was thick sourdough bread, one slice was soggy, they were slathered in butter and then barely toasted.  Tomatoes had been in the fridge.  I think they care, but maybe just need some honest feedback.    My server was very nice and sincere and she was appalled that they made me move my bike. Even the security guard thought the guy was crazy too.    Did I mention I had to move my bike to the back of the shops at Piedmont Row near the YMCA?    I will go back to Terrace Cafe, they did have cocktails, so I am going back for breakfast and a bloody mary.  I will park my bike near the Y, so the uptight man can get on with his work and not be bothered with the eyesore of my Townie parked at a light post. GASP.  Follow up: went today (2oct) with another friend, we sat at the bar and ordered bloody marys and an order of onion rings.  The bloody marys were fabulous and garnished with bacon, need I say more?  Since my return, the coffee was much better!!!

xhBBhp8VAt0nzn0CxZhSFA.text: Outstanding Chicken & Waffles!   Only weird thing was the alternative music and town square setting.  Service was fantastic.  Serving sufficient to feed my wife with a to go box.

y2uL369obc108hI0olwO2A.text: This place is finger licking good. A very nice setting and the food us very good! Portions seen to be big. The red velvet pancakes are a must have!

5pKR-FQLfvsSfOPFbLSSpg.text: I've had fried chicken and waffles before but none like this! The Red Velvet Waffle and Fried Chicken is to die for!!! The chicken is seasoned perfectly and the Waffle isn't too sweet! The eggs and everything else are great too! This brunch spot is a must go to!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and red velvet waffles

w-xUy3IYgAvkwYDZ9zIyJA.text: Love this place. The way have a little Southern flare with there food.  The fried chicken is awesome. Love the bar setup. Seems to be a lot of turnover with staff, but they are always friendly. I love the outside seating as well.  Just a cool vibe.

wq867nIAYhYiVNmxfBe88Q.text: I'm just gonna jump right to it. Today was my last visit to TC. I have been coming here since around 2009, 10 and it's dived into a giant pool of mediocre. I'd say over the last 3 visits they have pretty much missed on everything. Today, we literally had the overall worse service  EVER! We waited over 45 minutes to be seated and people who came after us were seat before us. Once seated, we waited for water/drinks. After our food was served, we waited for utensils, we waited for coffee refills,  we waited for our check. We pretty much blew a whole Saturday on breakfast. They were very slow at cleaning the tables around us as we ate and those tables sat empty longer than expected. The larger parties received quick service and more attention and had I'd been paying, I wouldn't have left a tip at all. I felt totally disregarded as a customer from the moment I stepped in, until I walked out. There are much better breakfast /brunch spots in Charlotte. I will spend my time and money there.

P8XmIA9LGcimUw7bH8swlA.text: Best pumpkin latte I have ever had in my life. Awesome southern style biscuits and gravy, perfect soft scrambled eggs and creative french toast options. So glad we tried them out on our short visit to Charlotte!

p3LaPpWpKIXzZEQu5aB-6A.text: One of my favorite brunch places in Charlotte! Right down the road from my home, this places never disappoints. The service is always top-notch and the staff is extremely friendly.   I always get the Red Velvet Waffle with extra cream cheese drizzle (no shame) with a side of cheese grits. HEAVEN! I go to school in New England and I'm always overjoyed when I get to come home and head to the Terrace Cafe.

fMJyT29E2NhJK1j8JK4VdA.text: The below review was written by my husband....  Went on Sunday. Supposedly, you can't make reservations for Sunday, but I heard people doing "call aheads" ... which is the same as a reservation in my book! Put name on list for 15-20 minute wait. Waited more that 20 minutes. Went inside and asked for update. Hostess said she texted our phone twice with no response and then deleted our spot. We received absolutely NO texts. This happened to 2-3 other people that I personally witnessed. Other groups of more people arrived ahead of us, ate and left before us (on a day with no reservations). The chicken apple sausage used to be two links (I think) and now it's one link cut lengthwise. The crab cakes benedict were ok and my wife's pancakes were ok, but they didn't say that the cakes came with powdered sugar by default which is something she doesn't like. So, the wait and the "ok" food are enough of a reason to not go back for Sunday breakfast for quite a while. We loved our server and the hostess seated us immediately after I asked for an update. So, I'd have to say that the service was decent, but was  the overall experience compelling enough to warrant a return visit (any time soon)? No.

0zjiZUa2aql87aZlfyZnMQ.text: Simply one of the best places to have a weekend brunch in Charlotte period. Rarely do you find this level of consistency in a food place without breaking the bank. Service is also great and their attention to your needs is . One thing to keep in mind, this place is popular so expect some wait, but I suggest you do, it's worth it.

CCZYGA43TuI_0DTVoTNDfQ.text: The food was delicious and our server was really knowledgeable and friendly. I got the Filet Bendict and my bf got the shrimp and grits, both we're amazing! The homemade coffee cake is too delicious for words! The best part is this place is not expensive.

6YmhEekCw3mBcVbr9JYQVw.text: Love!! Love!! Love!! This place!! The breakfast is amazing no matter what you order. Service is great and so friendly.

SLGuoREoEVhryLh07UAjEA.text: Thought it was pretty good.  First time going here after I had heard a lot of great things so I suppose my expectations were pretty high.  That being said I wasn't compelled to come back here with haste.  I had the Chicken and waffles which I found to be just okay.  I did enjoy the mocha though and the also thought the biscuits were above average.  Also kind of expensive for breakfast food, but I'd be happy to pay if it was worth it.  Probably won't be back soon.

RiLk945RIPS-eyGbfX427A.text: The best! I first went here after all the tag reviews and I have not been to a lot of place in which their pancakes rival IHOP but this place did it ! Everything was amazing!!!! The restaurant is found in the heart of Southpark not far from Southpark mall. The restaurant has multiple floors which is great for parties. The waist staff is attentive, knows the menu very well, and kept the drinks flowing. Although I do wish they had mimosa specials the food comes hot and fast which makes up for it.

q3sGUm4kBw_gfvigL5nz4w.text: I always get to Terrace when my family is visiting from Australia and it never disappoints. Now don't get me wrong I am just as happy being at waffle house when it comes to a hangover cure so I'm not a brunch snob but this is a great place to have a meal.  Only giving it 4 stars because the staff can be a little grumpy and I have had a few grumpy hostesses when I took my baby and stroller in. Otherwise the food is exceptional and the bloody Mary El Diablo is the best thing to happen to the bloody mary.

KGG019QawlfLXFigwTcHHg.text: Wow, less than impressed here! Placed a to-go order on the phone for mushroom crostini, shrimp po boy with no side and sweet tea. Showed up, was told to check with the bar. Bartender gave me unsweetened tea, had to ask for sweet and lemons. Got the sweet tea, had to ask again for lemons. And a straw. Didn't check the bag as I had to get back to training. Yummy smells had me digging into the bag in the car, only to discover no napkins and no utensils. Got back to training to eat, mushroom crostini was literally amazing, best thing about this whole experience! The po boy on the other hand sucked! 5 whole shrimp, no tarter sauce despite it being listed on the menu, very stale roll, slimy arugula and soggy fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blech shrimp po boy, so disappointing
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mushroom crostini, yum!

GU5yUFhSDS2pWY3Iw8MLOQ.text: So when we first got here we waited quite a while (my party is a group of 7) . We watched several party's be seated and receive their food . In the same time we didn't even get a drink order for ten minutes , come to find out there was a party of 16-20 that was seated quick and received their food ( explains why it took so long) . My table didn't get to order at the same time until the manager showed up (who was friendly).  The food was really good . Everyone enjoyed . However the service was slow and w happened to be the only ones left in the restaurant waiting to end our service . Regardless , if you have time to WAIT . Cool.

-LDow2iFg1YAb63Fzi2puQ.text: Good breakfast, and a great place and you get a lot of food, just wish they chicken wings. Lol

r7ZL8kBjNXt1Z4h8kjuYrg.text: After an 11.5 hour drive from South FL, aka SoFlo, we figured we'd stop by a brunch place to perk ourselves back up again. The drive into Charlotte, specifically South Park, was a beautiful experience... like the plaza alone is something I've never seen in SoFlo. And there it is, Terrace Cafe.  I ordered the Red Velvet Chicken & Waffles. It came out more like a rose color instead of the infamous deep red color you see in red velvet cake, but it still tasted just like red velvet, with the sweet cream cheese drizzle to compliment. Despite the drizzle, it wasn't soggy to my surprise. The waffle maintained it's outer crisp and inner fluffiness. The chicken was good, but I've had better. They use boneless chicken, and I'm into the kind you can gnaw on. I had ordered a cheesy grits for my side dish, and I was not impressed. It tasted like regular grits, and I wasn't sure if it had cheese. I should've asked for butter for taste, but there was no point, I didn't finish my waffle and chicken because I got full quick, so I knew I won't finish the grits either.  We ate til we got our fill, and I would consider coming back if I tried other stuff from the menu. Other items did entice me, so if I do hit Charlotte again, I'll consider coming back!

JmD1ZZTSzU15u56l4qVd3A.text: I went here with my son for dinner one Wednesday night. I wasn't very hungry so I asked the waitress if I could have a waffle only (not wanting the 2 fried chicken breasts with the Chicken & Waffles). She said that wasn't a problem. Well, when she delivered the bill I was charged $17 for the waffle.  I reminded her I only got the waffle and I thought the price should be adjusted. She told me they didn't have time to "customize orders". The manager wouldn't take the time to come over and address the issue either. It was a very slow night in there (so he couldn't use the excuse he was too busy). There were only 2 other tables with customers in the  restaurant.   I will never go back here because my compliant was not addressed. The waitress couldn't even comprehend what I was telling her and the manager didn't want to be bothered.

s4rm1-Hy9107IFl9XRK-pQ.text: Went there for birthday brunch.  Food was very good and lots of options as a vegetarian.  Waitress was very friendly and helpful.   Deducted one star because we tried calling for 4 days in a row at various times, emailing, and using the online private dining and reservation link and no one ever got back to us.  Didn't even answer the phone (two of us tried over and over).  Somehow ran out of breakfast staples, but what we did get everyone was very pleased with.  Had people coming in from an hour and a half away specifically for brunch, so we wanted to make sure we knew we had a table the process.  Ended up waiting outside for an hour.  Will definitely go again, just would like the phones/emails to be answered.

-gm9RbyT6x5q7lvcm0MGNQ.text: I came here to visit family and they suggested this place. Long wait, but the service was fantastic. I ordered a hot chocolate that was absolutely delicious. Food was good but there was quite the wait for it. They almost forgot my soup appetizer, but apologized for the wait. A different daily drink every day; since we came on a Monday we had mimosas. They are famous for their red velvet waffles, but their lemon and poppy seed French toast is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

15ChSEFc9qQ1tmoWU9_jDA.text: Awful experience with the General Manager  Michael A.Lynah. My family was visiting from Chicago and figured why not give them a great experience at decent restaurant. My grandmother brought her service dog. The dog did bark once or twice but that was cause she felt uncomfortable about her surroundings. Michael then comes around the corner and said and I quote " Like really? I've never heard of a service dog act that way"  my whole family could not believe what he said immediately gave everyone a bad taste and to think he's a General Manager is disappointing to act that way. Horrible horrible horrible..

__CVLOCYKHhzsROG8iSsUA.text: Top brunch spot in Charlotte!! Get here early on Sundays, the wait is long. However it is worth the wait. Mimosas are strong, customer service is great, atmosphere is family friendly and spacious. I recently went on Sunday and ordered the crab cake Benedict - amazing! This is my first time having a crab Benedict and I'm hooked. Portions are large which is worth the cost.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake Benedict and Mimosa

P_Ri4KEXSjeVZoqhTKaO6Q.text: 2.75 stars  The food in Charlotte left me so underwhelmed. I thought for sure this town would have good food. Honestly, the restaurants in Raleigh-Durham are much better in comparison. Who would have thought!?? But, that is enough of my spiel...  I went to Terrace on my last morning in Charlotte in search of a great brunch near my hotel. Parking was easy, and so was seating. I quickly ordered a peach cider mimosa and the red velvet chicken & waffles. It was good, but not great. The chicken left much to be desired. It was a little burnt and lacked in the seasoning department. Meh. The red velvet waffle was great however! Cooked well throughout and perfectly sweet. The cream cheese icing that they drizzle on top of it is amazing! I was one step away from asking for more lol! This is not someplace I'd think I'd return, but the ambiance was nice.

9mJjXPRqLd4yZnoU_SWBEA.text: Red velvet waffles and chicken are the only dish I can personally speak for as I can't seem to try anything else.  The waffle is nice and crisp on the outside and soft moist and flavorful on in the inside.  The cream cheese drizzle is the icing on the cake, no need for syrup.  The chicken is extremely moist and well seasoned and fried to perfection.  I get ranch as my dipping sauce and it  too is delicious and fresh made.    The sweet tea never disappoints and they also make a delicious cup of coffee.  My kids love their pancakes and bacon.  My husband enjoyed their shrimp and grits when he's not getting chicken and waffles.  I have found the food and service to be better going during the week vs. on Sunday's for brunch.  This could be because of the crowd for Sunday brunch.

HpUHGRGiNV4oYFHnJM3pGg.text: Perfect spot for brunch. Loved the red velvet waffle. Baby and stroller friendly as well. Good customer service.

zW-fTmVeU3ziu6jYD7icnQ.text: We had a wonderful post Patty's day breakfast at Terrace. We were seated quickly and received service in a timely manner. Savana was our server and she blew us away with her great attitude and vast knowledge of the menu. She guided us through our picks and made us feel great about our choices. Our food came out so fast and was absolutely delicious. I had the green waffle with a cream cheese drizzle, house made sausage, and cheddar cheese grits. My boyfriend had the full breakfast which included two eggs, country potatoes, chicken apple sausage, and banana pancakes. We loved every bite and the whole experience was phenomenal from start to finish. Thank you Savana! You are the best. We will absolutely be returning to this great South Park restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

dkA646F0S7qM1s2Sg_Daxg.text: This place has AMAZING food especially for brunch!! Their Banana Nut French Toast is to die for (it's worth a picture but totally dove in and started eating before I remembered to take one)!  A few things to know which is the reason for the four stars is that vegetarian options are limited and it can have a very lengthy wait. It's not advertised well but we found out that the bar and the tables right at the door are first come first serve which might help with the wait if you are a small party.

rulgpJUl-OqY9bEFu-OCSg.text: I have visited this restaurant twice now and have gotten the crabcakes benedict.....my mouth jumps for joy when I receive this scrumptious plate of tastiness!!! So good. I can't wait to move on to other entrees. But until then....I'll keep asking for the "crabcakes benedict please !"

0npM31UeASV2qpkNPeYanA.text: Saw reviews and was excited to try. Eggs cold, "fresh" fruit tasted and looked like it was cut days ago, and husband's bacon was cold.

QNMvAYOJEEB1CRpPFHy3yA.text: I am going to start off by saying my experience today was one for the books. The restaurant was very busy so expected to have a longer wait than normal but thats all I expected. Unfortunately that was just the beginning of a bad experience. Our server took our order (Biscuits & Gravy w/ Loaded hash browns and Filet Eggs Benedict). Asked two times for waters still none. Finally the meals come out about 30 min later and my egg yolks already broken w/ English muffin soggy mess served Luke warm. To make things worse the Biscuits & Gravy were cold! Got ahold of mgmt since our server had not checked back in on us since taking order almost 45 min ago...  Matthew Thompson(Asst General Mgr) was very responsive and corrected the situation with a smile - giving us hope again. The food came out hot this time but was missing all the loaded part to our hash browns. He informed us would fix it on the bill and we were happy without it; just too hungry at this point. The food was averaged and felt it lacked flavor - wasn't impressed at all.   This next part is what pushed me over the "edge" to write this review. The General Manager (yes head boss) treated me with such lack of respect as a human let alone a customer of his. I asked him for our check for our server was missing. He handed it to me and I informed him of the issue and the loaded toppings on the hash browns needed to be removed (over $7 charge - no biggie but when told they would felt like it should be done) he then looks at the receipt and say $39 I got this (rude sassy tone) and rips the receipt in my face! The server, hostess and busback couldn't believe  what just happened. I was so taken back I just walked away, got my family and left. I will never never be returning to an establishment that feels it OK to disrespect a customer like that.

_BlrYsNJ-fuV9NgcXSetlw.text: I don't know what seasoning they use for that moust chicken to go with these red velvet waffles, but it is DELISH!! I came here for my birthday which is today!! It's a Monday so traffic was slower which.is great because you get more attention from your servers I had the pineapple Mimosa, Red Velvet Waffle w/Chicken & Hashbrowns. Lovely environment, parking was easy to get to even with construction. Severe and staff very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food

TRmbSULwcoo5uf6vYCXnlA.text: Wow!!!! Food was amazing and I was server was even better. And her name was Kayla she actually brighten my day and gave me and my wife a good laugh.   She really our time there great. Amazing food and really good people. Thanks again Kayla !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs scramble, bacon and wheat toast

PjxlNXxJ14eCXzBJDdBAHg.text: I came to visit Charlotte for the first time and this place popped up for breakfast and brunch so we decided to come here.   This place was AH-MAZING!!!!! All of our foods were great. I came with 3 other people and we enjoyed everything! Our waitress Alex was EVERYTHING!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

caLQhboTmqzXGQmhP9eoJw.text: Stopped by this location after a magical moment and it was phenomenal! We came around 11, but had gotten on the waiting list on the Yelp beforehand so we didn't have to wait when we arrived. I ordered the red velvet waffle, which was great! It wasn't too sweet but just enough sweetness. My fiance ordered the omelette, which he also really enjoyed. Our waitress did a great job too! She came often enough to keep us happy but not enough to be bothersome. Great experience, great food! We shall be back next time we travel to Charlotte

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

gHUwPkgcqTk5AV2GZUrWYg.text: I love going to brunch & trying new places and honestly this was just not it. After reading all the great reviews I feel that the food needed improvement. The service was totally rushed. The food it's not worth it in my opinion the chicken breast I received was so greasy all I tasted was oil the red velvet waffle was just okay nothing fancy like I expected. The one big downfall I will say is that when we left our clothes smelled just like greasy fried food.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; waffle

zNixq8LHCqvcO8gBWjUZ3A.text: Last Friday my sweetie and I met up for breakfast, it was out first time in and we enjoyed it. Most definitely would recommended to friends if they were to find themselves in the area and want to grab a nice breakfast. The place was easy to find, although there was some parking situation which is understandable- it is a busy metropolitan area after all. The restaurant was ambient and clean, food came out fairly quickly, the white mocha did take a little extra- understandable and worth the wait it was tasty. My house coffee did taste a little burnt, but no problem with asking for a new one. As far as service, we both felt the place could use a servers/customer service or two for the morning shift due to the busy hours and to give a helping hand.   All in all, a great place. Enjoy our breakfast and place.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Malted Belgian Waffle Fresh Fruit
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build Your Own Omelet  Oatmeal Mocha / White Mocha
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg White Omelet Oatmeal Hash Browns

z50-Qv2UKIDOvxP4mtII8Q.text: There's some amazing brunch food here. We ate here for a work breakfast with our entire department, about 20 people. They gave us space upstairs where we all could fit.   The menu was diverse. There are plenty of sweet options like red velvet waffles and lemon poppyseed french toast. I like a more savory breakfast. I ordered the quiche of the day which was chicken, cheddar and broccoli. And it came with a side salad and fruit. I added an order of the chicken apple sausage. The food was delicious. The quiche had a nice flavor and flaky crust. The salad was fresh with a light vinegrette. The chicken apple sausage was very tasty. My fruit never made it to the table. I know we're a large party. When our server asked if we needed anything else, I mentioned I was missing my fruit and she said she would bring it out. It never came. And she seemed overwhelmed so I didn't fuss about it.   Staff was friendly, but our server clearly needed more help. We did separate checks which is a pain, but we all could see her struggling. They really should have assigned two people to our group. A large group is hard to serve and part of my meal was missing as a result.   So really great food, but probably better for smaller groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche, salad and chicken apple sausage

5Kpus8haCVUyJ5cs-Ftymg.text: I'm always on the search for good shrimp n grits!  Today at Terrace Cafe the shrimp n grits hit the spot.  I opted to leave out the sausage but non the less they were still incredible.  My mom had the carrot cake pancakes, which were delicious.  My sister had the crab cakes which were just ok, I've definitely had better.  The wait wasn't bad at all.  Our server was very attentive and personable.  Overall the atmosphere was awesome, service was great and the food was delicious.  I would definitely return the next time I visit Charlotte. I forgot to get a picture of my shrimp n grits because I smashed!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

VNK6Y4yqQr_3eYTm1Ahxxw.text: I visited this place with my friends on a Sunday. We were having brunch. Really good brunch spot. They have both upstairs and downstairs seating. The area we were in was tight but comfortable for the amount of people we had.  My issue was that I paid $40 for my meal and I can't say that it was worth it.  I had the shrimp and grits with the bbq sauce on the side. And also the crab bisque. Lastly, I got a drink (ordered it before my food but it came after). Our host was cool but a little loud.  I still don't think that this spot was worth $40. There's a free parking garage, which is nice. But the wait was like 30 minutes with only outside waiting.  I don't have any complaints about the food. Overall it was really goos. Just not worth $40.  So overall my 4 stars are for wait time and food pricing. Otherwise, l enjoyed my visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab bisque
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

SNvKbKUbKMy2rJKsLELbtg.text: I love this place a lot! It was a big restaurant (two floors) but it felt cozy. The menu is pretty hefty - a diner size menu. Everything is super affordable and everyday they have a breakfast drink special. On Monday morning they had 5 dollars mimosas but I opt to go with the Bloody Mary which was tangy, sweet and smooth accented with a bacon. For my meal I got the biscuits and gravy which came with hash. It was to die for! Very hearty. I like the the fact the hash was shredded but it should've been more crispy, my only recommendation.   For two people my bill ended up being like 35 bucks. Awesome spot if you want to get a complete breakfast without breaking the bank.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and Gravy
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bloody Mary

dJwvedn9ZXx6eiE27KKP0Q.text: This is usually a solid place for breakfast but something was off today. I ordered the red velvet waffle, eggs, fruit and whipped cream. My waffle was cold so I sent it back. My fruit was not fresh as it had sat in a fridge somewhere proportioned in advance. The strawberries and cantaloupe were dried out. My eggs were really good and scrambled hard just as requested. The whipped cream is not fresh either so it's some cool whip processed topping. My remade waffle was piping hot and fresh. The cream cheese drizzle melted over the waffle perfectly. I ordered hash browns instead of fruit and they were really hot but under seasoned. Overall poor showing today at Terrace.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

MSIrC_FGkjRpy1QfWq8DEw.text: Haven't been here in years and decided to go back Memorial Day to have brunch. When we got there about 11a it was already a full house but didn't seem to be too many people waiting. The hostess gave us an estimate of 20mins for the 2 of us but we were seated with in 10-15mins.  Our waitress quickly came over to take our drink order. They have 5 different types of mimosas but she didn't know the difference in any of them. So I asked to find out and she came back with waters and an answer. We both got the Tropical Mimosa as it came with champagne and Malibu rum. The fried green tomato with pimento cheese dip looked good so I ordered that as a starter. It was pretty decent didn't care for the batter they were fried in but the pimento dip made it better. For my entree I went with the Bavarian Creme Stuffed French Toast Sticks, at first the waitress brought something else out but quickly corrected it. It doesn't come with any sides but it is 3 huge sticks, I don't know why I thought they would be smaller. But they were cooked perfectly, not undercooked and mushy but nice and firm but not hard. My friend enjoyed her Stuffed Monte Cristo, I tasted it and it was good the French Toast was just soggy but she said she likes it like that. All in all good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bavarian Creme Stuffed French Toast Sticks

5Z1rIZjngxMbirT05QFbQg.text: Food tasted delicious and service was excellent. I have no complaints! The environment was nice and clean but a little too dim for a "breakfast" type of setting. If I had to be picky, i wish the music choices were a little more "appropriate" for the type of restaurant. There was a lot of r & b and random pop music. But other than that, everything was super nice! I wish I remembered my server's name but she had pink hair I believe. She was kind and attentive. I love the red velvet waffles too  already craving for more.

I ordered the french toast stuffed with bavarian cream(warm), topped with strawberry puree(cold) and whipped topping(cold).  For my ocd folk like me.  This is a mating of warm and cold. It tasted okay.  The sweetness I was hoping for wasnt there.  Ordered limp bacon, but it came out stiffer.  I kept it as Im not a fan of wasting food.   The place itself is very pretty, I sat upstairs with a view of down below.  My waitress was very nice!  I will visit again to try some other items.   10/26/18

There was great bar seating as well which is good for 1-2 people per group. They also had a a dining area for normal height table tops.   I order eggs and steak medallions. They were very good. The waiter is very attentive, and he was also ready with a refill. The food was very good and appropriately priced. Great breakfast place!!

jf6lp6ysw-Avk1PoytBOXQ.text: This was my first time at Stewart Penick's Terrace. Amazing food! Great vibe! They offer excellent service. I will definitely be back for another visit!

RF9_HMRJoGeb9z7-ICKKkA.text: We went here on a Sunday and it is DELICIOUS!!!! We had to wait for about 45 minutes. I would recommend the restaurant find extra space for guest that are waiting because we were out in the cold.  We each ordered pancakes, eggs, hash browns, and bacon. The hash browns did not have enough salt and the pancakes were delicious. The service was fast and the bacon was delicious too! I will be back!

6QBieA6qCQ8S7tsrVHX0IQ.text: All of the food was finger lickin good. Try one of the lattes. I got vanilla and it made my heart smile. Every typical breakfast item was on the menu and I wanted to order everything but I got the red velvet waffle and chicken with cheese grits on the side instead. We tried the spicy chicken sandwich. I forget the name of it on the menu but it's hottttttttt. Even a little sample of the sauce they put on it was too much for me. My boyfriend got an omelette and it was made to order just like he likes. I give the service a B. Overall I would return because the food was so good.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

pPvu9K4iYFT-X4c4isEfJw.text: Came in all star weekend and this place was packed. There was a projected 20 minute wait which was really like a 35 minute wait.... every decline counts when your hangry. They have parking in the garages to the side of the restaurant. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable. There is plenty of seating upstairs and downstairs. I studied the menu prior to my arrival so I had my mind made up. I got the red velvet waffle with chicken. It was filling and good. It came with a small side. I got the fruit which was fresh and good. They brought out fresh coffee which was awesome! This place is located in a prime location where you can walk to shops, nails dine, etc. I recommend and will return hopefully when it's less crowded.
