J9N6IUy-xCHYDlXntQ-bFQ.text: I've always enjoyed the food. No complaints on that. However today, my wife and I decided to meet there for brunch and the customer service was totally off. I got there first, received my buzzer for our table, and waited like everyone else. Cool. 45 minutes later the buzzer goes off because the table is ready. I turn in the buzzer and prepare to be seated, and I let the hostess know that my wife will be here in 10 minutes or less. She says, oh well I'm sorry but we can not seat you until she comes. Wait, what? Yes, you said there was a party of 2 so you have to wait until she gets here. I asked why and she says its policy and gave me the buzzer back. I waited 5 minutes and had to go back up to the desk. I'm trying to understand why I can't sit down. I said look, I've been standing here nearly 45 minutes and I'm ready to sit down. There is not another party of two, and if I said it was just me you would still seat me at a table with at least two chairs! She says well that's our policy and you already told us its a party of two so I'm sorry! She says look behind you you can sit right... Too late someone's there now! By then my wife walks in and I ask for the manager. Surprisingly, the hostess, Tasha says she is the manager! My wife asks where is your manager then. Tasha says oh he's already gone but there is his card, call him! It won't change anything! I said you know what, I'm hungry so let us eat so we can go. I'll just call the owner. She says well his name is Stuart and he lives upstairs! I was pretty pissed and it took everything in me not to be disrespectful back, but once seated we did call the manager Patrick I think. I'm starting to believe maybe she was right because although he apologized and said Tasha was wrong, I don't feel as if it was handled correctly. Very disappointed in this service today! Gotta do better to loyal customers!!!

_K4tztZRAB5WjWAsSJBJ4Q.text: I love brunch! But I don't go often because I hate the wait. Fortunately, I was hanging with friends one weekend in Charlotte, so I feeling particularly patience. My patience paid off, because the food here is awesome. First, I'll comment on the atmosphere. The Terrace Cafe is decorated to look Italian, which threw me off a little because then I was expecting Mediterranean food, but I felt warm and comfortable here. They could have a little more seating for those of us waiting, but the wait wasn't really that bad. When we did sit down, we ordered mimosas, and they came pretty quickly. I got the waffle with strawberries on the top and I was oh so happy. My friend ordered a shrimp omelette, and I was jealous because it was so good. Next time I come, I'm getting that omelette! With a waffle on the side.

ARt0_oLmPFCXENpJ2NneSA.text: Why haven't I been here before? Cute place with a great atmosphere. Their menu has a great variety.  I had their Hawaiian Chicken Salad Croissant Sandwich. Yum! I had their vinegar based coleslaw, which I loved. It's how my mom makes her coleslaw...but mayo slaw lovers my not be a fan.  The price is pretty decent. I'd rather go here for a couple extra bucks and quality than the Panera across the street.  I hear their breakfast is awesome too. Red Velvet Pancakes?? Awesome!

gebtOXmZlFeDr-CzJtVGhA.text: I am incredibly disappointed to give such a poor review. I was so excited to try this place, especially the crab cake blt. I do have to note that the flavors of the dish were fine, not wonderful, but good enough to pay for. However my mother found two short black hairs on her plate. Neither of us have short black hair. The inexcusable part was the manner in which it was handled. The server was rude and unapologetic. And shockingly only half of the cost of the meal was removed from the bill. It is pretty standard in my opinion that when a dish is deemed inedible due to sanitation issues, it should be completely taken off.

SrPGOkpryEjmeb4zU59YOQ.text: Delicious!  Went on a thursday at noon and it was pleasantly crowded.  I had the special, which was red pepper pasta with scallops, and it was heaven!  The scallops were cooked perfectly.  My dining companions loved their lunch as well, the crab cake blt, and the lemon chicken.  I really wanted the spicy bloody mary, but had to go to work, so the waiter brought me a taste of the mix.  It was great, spicy, but not too spicy.  Will be back to have this drink at some point.  Great prices too.

j9BtBqlIte69AY6t-UzE2w.text: Tried the breakfast here for the first time and loved it!! My wife LOVED the shrimp and grits, and I really enjoyed the eggs Benedict. The atmosphere is pleasant and the staff was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back again to start our day of right!

eIcCbD4MJFeT3kb601YHrA.text: Peeking out from the corner behind Taco Mac in Piedmont Row is Terrace Cafe. With a menu boasting S'mores French Toast and Red Velvet Waffles, there is often a wait list of people seeking an indulgent breakfast on weekends.  If there is no time to lose waiting for the hungry masses who beat you there, visit on a weekday, when there generally is not a wait.  Don't want dessert for breakfast? No matter, there is something for every taste and moderation level. Terrace Cafe even has a few dishes decorated with the seal of approval from the Harris Y Express and YMCA nutritionist. There is an obvious partnership there, as post-Y workout customers clad in sweats join groups of SouthPark soccer moms dining among local celebrities at Terrace. No, not Ric Flair (WOOO!) this time, but jack-of-all media, Jon Wilson (WILSON!)  According to the clearly over sat server, the Red Velvet Waffle is their breakfast bestseller. It is surprisingly airy and moist, and the well-portioned cream cheese drizzle is just the right amount of sweet to keep that nagging "sugar belly" sensation at bay.  Eggs Benedict and cheese grits that rival those at The Flying Biscuit are stars of the savory menu choices, and dishes are presented beautifully on geometrically angled platters. Seasonal fruit tops off the gluttony, and beverages are served in curved glasses that look like they'll tip, but due to the magic of physics, do not.  Your full belly may make you tip, though, after sampling the fine foods at Terrace Cafe.

h3FqGBPHQLkoCmaUlGZ7TA.text: Came here because the person I went with to visit North Carolina was useless in making decisions to practically anything.  I thought I'd go here to try where the locals go.  Glad I went.   I tried the Red Velvet waffles. Mmmmmm, good!!! Drinks were good too. Decor was nice, wait was approx 45 mins and they meant 45 mins.  I guess that's why I placed 4 stars for the long wait but worth the wait.

nk3VprelK_IRYhJQPB7lhA.text: Best breakfast in Charlotte. Red velvet waffles, pancakes, sides, including hash browns were all scratch made. So were the biscuits and the breakfast casserole I ate. All good! My hubby is a coffee snob and he loved the French press. Expect a wait but so worth it.

cyYZd70ljmFf5SrXCkD_5A.text: This place is banging! While driving through Charlotte on my way to SC I Yelped it up and found this place for breakfast. I had the Shrimp & Grits and my wife had the Red Velvet Waffle. Both of them were amazing. I was a little concerned with the corporate feel of the area and the corporate feel and design of the restaurant, but after eating her I just don't care. Banging!

5qB4pPk-GYdCTUA5IKOFnw.text: Tried it for family brunch while in town for a wedding, there was 35 min wait for tables but our group was 6 sat down in bar area right away. Ordered the famous red velvet waffles with fried chicken - waffle was soft but flavor was good (sweet) but the fried chicken batter was crispy, flavorful and delicious!

wWX_U0HnEZxfRiXjAP05QQ.text: I've heard a lot about this place and decided to visit while I was in Charlotte and was not disappointed. It is great for breakfast. I enjoyed the quick and friendly service despite the long wait lines (hence the 4 instead of 5 stars) although I will say it was completely worth it. I ordered the signature red velvet waffle with cream cheese frosting/syrup and it was especially delicious with a side of fruit. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast/brunch.

F-qNksWXtheM3go84gq88A.text: We have never had a bad experience here! Everything is always delicious. This time we tried the fried green tomatoes... Sooooo tasty! Hot and crispy with spicy dipping sauce! Service was excellent. Definitely our favorite brunch spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great atmosphere!

S8mhp65DXBG0DMz_VJSyBA.text: Had a wonderful breakfast. Our server was Amazing!! Her name was Vivian and she was beyond accommodating and suggested some great ideas for substitution that usually don't work! Would def recommend and hope you get her as a server..... Hash browns needed a little less butter.

r1glyQe7skQtSwwPayWO_w.text: Yum. Quiche. Yum.  That was pretty much my conversation with myself the other day during my lunch at Terrace Cafe. And if you're wondering, yes, it was a one-way conversation. I know you're jealous of my communication skillz.  Anywho, Terrace Cafe, a cute little cafe burrowed in the Piedmont Town Center. Truthfully, when I was seated upstairs and took in their menu for a few minutes, I wasn't wowed by their lunch selections. However, my friendly waitress told me about their lunch specials, including a "healthy" slab of quiche baked with feta, house roasted turkey, tomatoes, spinach and onions. This $10 special was served with a substantial side of greens and a generous fresh fruit cup.   Um, YUM. I love quiche in general, but this particular slab (not exaggerating here) was creamy, well made and finished with a tasty crust. It was quite a nice portion for a ten spot, especially for lunch. The turkey was ridiculously good and I was really impressed with the quality of the quiche.   I'd really like to come back and give their breakfast/brunch a shot as the red velvet waffles were taunting me.

X-6VBPbBCM0iI00J145Geg.text: Got the lettuce wraps and bf got the omelette..nothing to write home about.  Service was MEH...but the one saving grace of this restaurant is the red velvet waffle...no syrup is needed with the cream cheese frosting drizzle. So moist yet crunchy I fell in love. Delish!!  I do give this restaurant "props" for it's vegetarian options.

gLVChqtqwGbDzD6hcqr5NA.text: My girlfriend and I's favorite breakfast spot. Pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

oWsjfuRzBKZYjttnrZVMdg.text: My experiences with the food and drink are far better at weekend mornings/brunch service than on weekdays. On good days, the bar makes a very tasty chai. On not-so-good days, it's watered down and not blended well. Recommended dishes: red velvet waffle, Terrace French toast, bacon or pecan waffle. The s'more waffle is too sweet for a meal, it works well as a dessert, though. The service has always been good even when they're slammed. If you're planning to go Sunday for brunch, plan to wait for a table due to this place's popularity, but it's worth it of you plan for it.  They will not seat you until your entire party is present.

3VRex5knhXXYDZ1I54ihUg.text: Like a previous reviewer, I was underwhelmed with the Full Breakfast that I ordered during my first visit to Terrace Cafe last week for lunch.  It wasn't bad, but for half the price I had the same thing at The Original Pancake House  this morning and enjoyed it just as much or possibly more.  Granted, I could have ordered something with a little bit more imagination, but if a restaurant can't handle simple things then I have to wonder whether or not it can handle more complex items.    The hummus appetizer we ordered arrived with sesame seed covered pita for dipping.  Unfortunately, I can't say much for the hummus because it was completely overwhelmed by the flavor of the sesame seeds on the pita.  I'm not a fan of sesame seeds, so I took one bite and left it at that.  My companion ordered the tomato and mozzarella salad and really enjoyed it.  He also enjoyed the hummus more than I, but he likes sesame seeds so....  Thanks to a $30 gift certificate from Groupon, our lunch tab was only $18.00.  (I paid $12 for GC and left $6 tip.)  Without the GC, our tab would have been almost twice as much.  I'll try Terrace Cafe again because I have another gift certificate.  Hopefully next time I'll be as pleased with my meal as some of the other reviewers.

K7izvPo_cUQVZkDmpmRw-A.text: The breakfast here is excellent!!  The waffles, chicken apple sausage & steak & eggs were delicious!!!!  The service was prompt but very attentive!!!! Luv this breakfast spot!!!!  I would have given it 5 stars but the wait coupled with the parking were 2 huge challenges :(

2w8J7s-mLnj2nMG6Xkyy6w.text: Randomly stopped in for a quick breakfast.  Had the Southern Sausage Benedict.  Basically an Eggs Benedict with sausage in place of ham and a biscuit in place of the muffin.  The biscuit was a little dry, but the meal was tasty.

AkDWr2UV7A3HNswHs1nqrQ.text: Have yet to try their brunch but hear it's exceptional. Only complaint is the breakfast sandwich was a bit dry. Salads are awesome, great iced tea & service is exceptional. Very cool vibe.

fkHqIkFJATtAQJrVhn0pjg.text: Great food and coffee nice interior and employees

2KVFiG6Dpcsibl7V34Jc3A.text: Awesome food and great service!  Had the fish and chips and it was amazing!  Huge portion of fish.  Definitely want to try the red velvet waffle!  Crab cake appetizer was great too.  Really enjoyed my meal.

-hjJBg0sLZ7CEliKOnuh7g.text: Pleasantly surprised at how quickly we got seated on a Saturday morning. Service was great and the food didn't disappoint. Highly recommend the red velvet waffles. If you're in the mood for chicken and waffles, suggest you stick with the classic waffles. A little pricey but would definitely go back if we're back in Charlotte.

VOgtsGEUL3FhLiH_IyZv1g.text: I visited Terrace Cafe with a friend while on an extended layover in CLT (it's only about 15-20 mins from the airport). The restaurant was a tad difficult to find, as it was tucked into a complex of office buildings interspersed with other restaurants among the buildings and courtyards. Anyway, parking was simple and free in the neighboring garage, so that made life easier.  The restaurant interior is fairly roomy. It's a large loft-like space with extremely high ceilings. It almost felt like there was a lot of wastage of space in the setup, but it worked if loft-like is what they were going for. Definitely not the place to go if you're looking for a more intimate ambiance.  The food was good...and unique breakfast selections! Normally you get the usual breakfast options, but Terrace Cafe has some interesting versions and flavors of pancakes and french toast and waffles and the like. They also have a variety of omelettes, among other breakfast choices.   My friend and I ordered the banana pecan french toast, the egg white veggie omelette, and a side of hash browns to share. The banana pecan french toast was interesting. They literally took banana bread and lightly coated it in french toast batter. It was good, but a little TOO sweet. Perhaps one of the other many french toast flavors would've been more suitable. The veggie omelette was great. Very healthy, not overly oily, and perfectly done. The hashbrowns were tasty and very crispy.  I'd recommend this place as a breakfast place to anyone visiting the Charlotte area. I really liked the variety and unique flavors of breakfast foods available.

BjyyeDt8SZfq2jYV_f4h6A.text: The ambiance was great but the food was horrible. I ordered the breakfast casserole and it was dry and cold in the center. Instead of removing the dish from my bill she asked me to leave a customer service complaint. I highly recommend that you try the other location as this one doesn't provide good customer service.

STFa1Em2QYgv93TwB7TmWg.text: Standard line up of foods.  I've been here for business breakfast and lunch.  Nothing exceptional, but ok

jEyggClYZdMArFmgGJuyHw.text: Went here for brunch on a late Sunday morning.. There was a long wait (we expected that)... We started out with a Bacon Bloody Mary which was pretty good... After reading all the reviews about the red velvet waffle, I just had to try it. And... I was not that impressed. The waiter told me to try it without syrup which was what I did, it was on the dry side, and not that flavorful. Overall, it was ok.

d2JNUl_RBv4aJ_c4lVKRGg.text: Definitely worth the wait! Red velvet waffle or the lemon poppy seed French toast is a must! Sometimes the wait can be long but if you are willing to wait it out, go outside your comfort zone and try one of their signatures.

Rh5A0Psz6jsPCmvkMbzmAQ.text: I used to really like Terrace Cafe but the food and service has been declining. Our last visit was the last straw. It was a weekday morning so tables were readily available. It took a long time for the host to come back to the stand. That is fine. But the weird part is the two bartenders who were not busy at 10:30am looked at us like we're annoying - like we were interrupting their conversation. Then multiple servers made eye contact with us and walked by. Wouldn't it be normal to say good morning, we will be right with you? I truly felt like I walked into a private function and the dirty looks were to get us to leave. I was so close to leaving and I should have. We were taken upstairs and seated at a 2 top as close to a booth with very young and loud children. Then a table of four with a screaming child from the start was seated next to us. The other table dissolved into full blown on the floor meltdowns. We asked to move to the side of the top where no people were when we were originally seated. We quickly learned the upstairs is the child section as that section then had kids too. It was impossible to finish the crab cake Benedict given the screaming - meltdown screaming. Downstairs, there was not one table with children. Given that the food is mediocre at best, this was just unacceptable. When I asked the host why he would put two adults in the section that was clearly filled with kids, he said it was part of the rotation but did notice the tantrum  occurring on the floor. Oh well.

JTY-g5jbBTNI8tqXXAIxNA.text: Very disappointed in all of the food that myself . Visiting Charlotte for the weekend  and wasted my time at this place. The only reason they received two stars one for the hostess and the Cupcake Latte I ordered. The food was awful I spent $50 bucks for two people and neither one of us really enjoyed anything. It was hard to see all the people lined up to get Inside and not tell them how the food taste... While i did NOT any eggs I didn't not have to. This place did not make the cut!!!

6xKPFvV63bEh_72WxI9QQg.text: Hits the spot for breakfast or brunch! You may have to wait to sit on the weekends... But, that's a good sign.

LvMYU2Z9ssyM8eRXZqApSA.text: Went for the first time on Sunday and enjoyed the food! It's on the higher end in price but the food is wonderful. Everything on our plates was delicious! I had the red velvet waffle and chicken.  It didn't taste like a redvelvet but the icing and strawberry made it very good that it's one of the best waffles I've tasted. The wait is long because of its popularity so that says alot about their food.

b5RlBA0o9a-fgj9oLOIEQw.text: This is one of my family's favorite restaurants to eat brunch. The food and service is excellent here. The only downside is they don't take reservations and the wait is really long so make sure to get there early.

CSVUgcHN_c634Bc6N23GgA.text: We had breakfast there on Saturday morning.   Yelp says that reservations are recommended.   Take them at their word.  45 min wait at 11am.  It was worth it!   Excellent service and food.  My wife had the Red Velvet Waffles and I had the eggs crab Benedict.

Ob3Dz5y0pt44DY2ksr5D3g.text: The food was just meh. The "atmosphere" relatively non-existent. It does appear to be a very family friendly place, so I guess that's a plus. I ordered the veggie omelette, added cheese, subbed grits & a biscuit. The dish was intended to be healthy, but I did my best to change that. Unfortunately the food was just incredibly bland. It was disappointing, especially because of the cost. If you're going on a weekend, get there early, it gets packed. I don't think I'll be back though.

KbGt8kgQWzQcFs-BtuB3fw.text: Consistently good food here. I've only had the Belgian waffle, chicken Apple sausage, grits or hash brown and everything is good. The mimosas are pretty good as well. Waits can be looong on the weekends, so be prepared for that.  There is a small bar upfront and you can order coffee or espresso while you wait.

DUyhxBimdmjAxTBmSqBAxA.text: Get to Terrace Cafe stat if you are a professional brunch'er life myself.  The brunch was delicious.    I've actually been to Terrace Cafe twice.  The first time I got the signature red velvet waffle and chicken.  It was mediocre at best.  Nothing special about the waffle and the breading of the chicken came off as soon as you cut it.  I hate that!  So fast forward to six mos later and my brunch crew decided to go to Terrace.  I was like cool - I hear folks rave about it, lemme give it a 2nd shot.  The french toasts are awesome.  We all got different kinds.  Mine was by far the best.  It was the seasonal pumpkin.  The lemon poppy seed was good, but a little dry.  They have removed the banana nut french toast from the menu.   We inquired about it and were told it was gone, followed by our server saying "everyone asks about it."  So why would they remove something so popular.    So why is this place not 5 stars?  Well I can't forget the mediocre first experience.  I also hate  'no reservations' and the fact that they won't seat you until your whole party is there.  I have a perpetually late girlfriend.  4 of us arrived and waited, and waited and waited...they would not seat us until the 5th got there.  That is an annoyance.  I can understand why, but they'd rather leave those booths empty then seat us.  Here's why I say that.  When girlfriend finally arrived we were seated upstairs in the only tables (booths actually) that could accommodate more then 4 people...well all of the booths were empty.  So my question is why 'hold' them and make us wait in the coffee bar.  Did they think we were lying about having the 5th person?  It just didn't make sense and was irritating.  They also got one of the orders wrong.  Service seemed frazzled. We never had the same server twice actually.

Ltjw2gEP6UZ6gZByW83W-g.text: Terrace Cafe is a gem.  Everything was fresh & delicious.  The staff was professional & friendly.  We will absolutely be back many times.

TIcxk66dywN-D83wlu2SlA.text: I have only ate here once but the food was great. I had the shrimp and grits. It's a tad pricy and can be very busy with long wait times! I would still go back..cute atmosphere!

WNzxM-WiBLyVOOpp4OksyA.text: Service friendly and quick  Atmosphere light but a little noisy.   I had the BLT on sourdough which is a favorite of mine.  I also had the grits that were warm and good and fried green tomatoes. They weren't as good as moms but were very good.   I would definitely come back.

u-hPrGFCLPt2fmwTFkmjZw.text: One of my favorite places! How can you dislike a place that has bacon bloody Mary's and red velvet waffles? Everyone is so friendly and outgoing. I wish I had the time to eat here every week!

Ev_18TxiADamJ_nTc1frgg.text: I am going to say this up front from the start, best omelette I have ever had my life.  Tomato, spinach and turkey.  Wow, wow, wow.  The wheat toast was fresh and crisp and the fruit cup had fresh blackberries in it.  I have never seen that.  Add some unique dinnerware a friendly staff and great ambiance and you have the makings of one of the best breakfast spots in the Charlotte area.  Kudos!

5wlX6RD3l0ZEmHugXfhbdQ.text: Had shrimp and grits- amazing!  Great service. It was packed for a Friday lunch crowd.

1xmOzf2RelmYcW2BZPojaQ.text: Great food! The menu is huge. We love this place. It's a great brunch spot. I had the biscuit and gravy last time And my boyfriend had one of the eggs Benedict. We haven't been for dinner yet though :( we will definitely be going back,

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full breakfast
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon latte is great!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit and gravy. I couldn&#39;t wait to take a bite!!

7YEAHHfQwe6pHEfB1xqUPg.text: I have been meaning to try this restaurant for dinner. They have been serving dinner for 4 months. Prior to that they were just open for breakfast and lunch. I hear their brunch is really special.  I like the place, nice people, excellent servers, comfortable surroundings. Unusually friendly staff. I was dining alone and they made me feel like I was partying with them.  I ordered the Pork Tenderloin with Succotash and Fingerling Potatoes. The pork was cooked to perfection. Many restaurants over cook pork and it gets tough. This dish was outstanding. Great sauces, flavors, etc.  I like their condensed menu where they focus on being good at a select number of item instead of the all things to all people approach.  I will be back to try another entree. Visit this place and give them support. They are trying to launch their dinner menu and could use the business so give them a try.. Good price/value.

byee63zjt9xqrBBIcwxbSg.text: Not too long of a wait, but a packed house, which was a good sign that Terrace Cafe is the place to be on a Sunday for brunch.   Took my mom and her friend here since I've heard this is a great place to eat and treat! The atmosphere was very nice, spacious, and gave off a warm feeling. The food was very good! The coffee, however, not the best.   The service was attentive and we never felt neglected for one second.   I don't think they offer valet parking (like many of the other Piedmont Row restaurants), but the garage is right next to Terrace.  All in all, great place and I will be back...just not for coffee.

yGvYEpQ7XfG6EGye77mIfA.text: Lots of yummy breakfast options. Only been for breakfast and service was good. Busy on Sundays which I'd expect. Terrace cafe is definitely one of my top breakfast spots.

bqmkE_3AM1KGOuWN0MjDAw.text: Coffee fantastic. The guys at the bar, Chris and Ian, are always cheerful and attentive. Breakfast is a must, my Mom just adores the strawberry waffles.

cPOYWz1rKPsGOVP4wpDDcw.text: Terrace Cafe is a nice hip place for Brunch. We came on a Sunday morning and had no wait but it filled up quickly. We had two versions of their eggs benedict. The service was attentive and quick. Halfway through my Crab Cake Benedict I noticed an accumulating burnt flavor from the burn on the english muffins. I had already eaten half and it wasn't so noticeable that I didn't send it back. Otherwise I'd eat here again.

UdHnDZZktF0A9A3REv5AMA.text: Awesome brunch spot!! Red Velvet Waffles so moist and tasty!! Omelet was good as well!! Lots to pick from!!

T1XuS1NmEJcaOm3gFjuiPQ.text: Had breakfast here with three other people.  I ordered the closest thing to regular Eggs Benedict (EB) I could find, and paired it with Earl Grey tea. The EB was miserable. EB is a classic dish for a reason. There is no benefit in trying to switch it up. The hollandaise was made with whole grain mustard, which destroyed the best part of the dish. The meat disks were about the diameter of a golf ball, and I don't even remember what the bread/English muffin was like.  Our server was a bit lukewarm, and, once things got super busy, the amount of time between visits to our table became way too long. Table mates sat without beverage refills for a while.   The space is pretty nice. It's bright and clean, but I could have certainly done without all the religious paraphernalia and signage at the host stand. If I wanted to deal with that, I'd go to a pancake breakfast at a local church. Couldn't wait to get out of there.

M7tqXI4Q4v28zAECW2DLmA.text: Poor management of assistant manager. Waited for 2 hours to be seated. Food came in less than 20 minutes but the food was not hot and just warm. I ordered chicken and waffles and the waffles were pretty good, everything else was just OK. I WOULD NOT COME BACK!!

gdUY8CKIxv7TTH0z01OATw.text: The hummus appetizer was great as was the lemon poppy French toast. Cute atmosphere and great service too

XNnfKAmmxFkGSgPQAbehjw.text: I was in the Ballantyne area visiting from San Francisco, CA when I stumbled upon this cafe. OH MY!  I don't think there's enough or even the right words in the English dictionary to be able to describe the delectable flavors of this incredibly tasty restaurant. I ate there FOUR times while I was in the area.   I has the following (not necessarily in this order): - Salted Caramel Mocha with soy milk - Coffee shops of the west coast (specifically SF) please contact the chef for the recipe and let me when you get it! This would replace my beloved long term addiction to Peets Coffee. And that's saying something! If you like salted caramel and chocolate and coffee, this is a drink worth trying.  - S'mores French Toast - I don't think I could ever get this again since it was too sweet for me but despite that, I felt like I was sitting around a camp fire enjoying s'mores. Take a  trip back to childhood and try this treat.  - Garlic Hummus - Had this with co-workers and while we all really enjoyed it, we all agreed it wasn't that garlicky.  - Fennel Pollen Dusted Grouper - This was incredibly good! Although I wish there was a bit more asparagus on the plate but I am sure that's my California self showing.   If you want to take a journey with your tastebuds, check this place out!

20nilfXc6DP7JLmdRFDWnA.text: Food was great the red velvet waffle was awesome!!!! If you visit the Queen City you should try it out

aVHd1q_TzuF2dnnxwf_KvA.text: Drinks were delicious, food didn't live up to the hype.  Shrimp and grits were the worst I've ever had and the fried green tomatoes were descent.  Greeters were awesome but waiter kept disappearing and not checking in on the group... All in all I would recommend this restaurant.

eEkxMwgC6YT8q0e-3w-W1g.text: I went here specifically for the red velvet waffle. Sad to say I wasn't impressed. It was just red. No coco flavor or anything that resembled red velvet cake. It was a well prepard waffle although. I would go back to try other things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

S23YIpb7key1RPYQtx1rJQ.text: The YMCA omelet is very good. Loved the hasbrowns (they're the shoestring kind), and the apple butter was delicious.

xENnIGVML6WcaPuq64jjsw.text: Terrace Cafe is wonderful place for brunch. My husband took me for my birthday brunch and we had lovely time. It was weekend so we had to wait for sometime before we got seating but trust me it was worth the wait. We ate so much we could hardly move :) I guess this is best way to celebrate birthday! I loved their famous Red Velvet Waffles. Great Service and great food!

srDBb51HJUdNLi6zmVewFg.text: I have been here several times for Sunday brunch. The menu has a lot of options. Shrimp and grits is too good. Their red velvet waffle is excellent!! Orange juice is really fresh squeezed OJ!

4oOsSVCKISX4Frfxjlf3ag.text: Subpar food...chicken and waffle, quiche...omelet and even simple eggs. Asked for over medium with sausage and fruit...they delivered runny eggs, bacon and no fruit.  The chicken and waffle was supposed to come with a side...I asked for grits and they never delivered.  We will not return.

F4-emZ7nd6VGJ9O3c5fPew.text: The service torpedoed this review from 4 stars to 3. I went for breakfast and my eggs were cool when served. Not good. The staff made an effort to replace the eggs. I wouldn't say it took long to get the replacements, but by the time the warm eggs arrived, the rest of the meal had cooled down.  I went ahead and ate the breakfast and it would've probably been really good had it been served piping hot. To give the benefit of the doubt, Terrace was VERY busy which means they must get it right most of the time. Maybe it was just bad luck for me. My girlfriend did enjoy her breakfast.  Anyway, aside from that, the atmosphere of the place is quite nice. Its contemporary American and very lively for a morning spot. I'd probably give them another shot if I lived in the area but I was jut passing through.  Oh, and the final nitpick, the bill charged for 2 orders of eggs. The staff removed the additional order.

oPHrGUfVMLajXlGDSwlSTA.text: First time here getting breakfast.  Really good!! Loved the three egg mushroom and tomato omelette.  My wife had the scrambled eggs, pancakes, etc.  Loved the fresh squeezed grapefruit juice and coffee. Service was very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great coffee and grapefruit juice
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omlette and hash browns
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Three egg omlette!!

YTwVpFjVHf876Rtsb-31mA.text: I love brunch nom nom nom! I'm ALWAYS on the hunt for a good brunch spot so I'm glad we decided on this place. I have passed the area that it's in a few times but never really thought to venture in . It's tucked away right near the parking garage, which is kinda convenient and a short walk. We went on a Sunday around 12pm maybe and we waited around 30 mins for a table of 3. I tried a Mimosa which was good, more champagne than I expected so that was a plus along with the chocolate chip malted Belgian waffle with a side of grits and hash browns. The waffle came with one side but I'm southern so it's only right that I have grits with my meal  Overall my food was good presentation wide could have been a bit better for the waffle - looks like they literally threw some chocolate chips on there and sent it out the door. I definitely would go back to try an omelet or the French toast! The only annoying part is that they don't' have much waiting room inside so either you stand out in the cold or cram inside.

FNlyCgjByRf6v_dW26U7Vw.text: The best brunch in Charlotte!  The red velvet waffles, berry split, fried green tomatoes, were beyond outstanding! Worth the 40 monwait!

al226vwUDHfnH06f4uvQPQ.text: I found my new brunch spot and it feels so good! My original brunch place all the way in the Plaza but totally worth the drive has gotten a bit too repetitive so while enjoying dinner one night at Piedmont, stumbled on this place. Super cute inside, friendly staff and aaahhhh yes, the sunday wait line. No problem, get yourself a latte and sip away until your called to the table. The food is so good, you wish you knew about it sooner. The eggs benedict floentine is my favorite. The french toast with creme bruele butter is so good you want to ask for more butter to go. The too have the apple butter sauce my original location carried (I thought it was signature mark, guess not, its bought by a bigger vendor). I can't wait to go back on Sunday!

nGPC_pycOAaBKWPRkVS-iQ.text: Went again yesterday and again it was excellent.  Still high quality, consistent, good service, everything you could ask.  I had the steak salad, wife had breakfast, daughter had banana pancakes, all great.  Consistency counts.

Z2lqPrSw4sHUROqYM2C3bw.text: Honestly, can anyone in their right mind rate this place below a 5?    Lets break it down for someone who hasn't been here:  The food is ALWAYS (and I mean every single thing I have ever ordered) right and tastes great, even when they are slam packed, which is often.   There are some fun things on the menu (especially breakfast) that you would be hard pressed to find anywhere else.  Ex. red velvet waffle, WOW  The staff is always busy but always friendly  My only complaint is that they are so damn good they get busy and there is often a wait but I can't hate on them for being too popular!!!!!

KVPVN9R7zsjXb9IElbvM8A.text: Personally, I did not enjoy my salad. Went out to dinner with a group of friends for my sister's birthday... Our waiter forgot to put in the order for my boyfriends food. So he sat while everyone ate. By the time we got it everyone was done eating. We took his food to go instead. The waiter didn't even give us a reasoning and wasn't willing to accommodate us for the inconvenience, and to top it off, gave us an attitude when we asked to speak to the manager.  A basic plain caesar salad was $6. I had iceberg lettuce, croutons, and added chicken.... $15. $11 for a piece of chicken?? All in all, never ever ever going back there. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Over priced. The atmosphere sucks. Loud. Cramped. Portions of food are small... Leave you feeling hungry still. Would rather just go to Chili's.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

dsPolkoW2POJaMV59LJ7FA.text: The food was amazing! The atmosphere was warm and the service was great! I will most definitely go back!

lqvOuAy4zNZqZU95arRdKA.text: I was very excited to dine at Terrace Cafe, from family members raving to Yelp hyping it seemed like it was going to be awesome. Perhaps my expectations were to high? No, perhaps I should have went for breakfast? Probably. I ordered an appetizer of fried green tomatoes and pimento cheese. They came out very hot and crispy with tons of flavor, easily the best part of my experience. My main course was the trout, veggie rice pilaf and tempura green beans. The food was by no means bad but it also wasn't anything memorable. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing because my friend loved his steak. I left feeling very underwhelmed, sucks when the appetizer is more exciting than main course. Whenever I return it will be for breakfast.  PS - you would think that a classy restaurant could offer a better beer selection than boring bud, coors and miller. Sure they had Sierra Nevada and Fat Tire but that was it. Beer is just as, if not more complex than wine, recognize.

rTrxlurUrGtAUf3SxJgTlw.text: Carefully and meticulously prepared food in a casual setting ... surprisingly so actually. Service is attentive and excellent making this a sure thing for future trips to the area

ICBVR5jgeL-8B1bAAb8GIA.text: Very good food, good service.  Value, not so well.  Every item I've had there has been of really good quality, but I always seem to come away with a feeling of paying too much for too little.  I'm a guy who likes to eat (uggg, dieting now) and when I find good food I like to have it in decent quantities, I didn't feel like I was getting enough.  Example: I had their burger and fries.  The burger WAS of a decent size, but the fries, not so much.  I work in PTC so this is a place I can walk to, but to be honest, I don't go here for lunch anymore.  The one exception:  Morning coffee/breakfast biscuit $5 takeout special, was a big biscuit with whatever you want in it and a decently sized cup of coffee.  Update 10/28/2013 - I'm growing to like this place more and more, based solely on the above mentioned takeout special.  I get it, this place caters to folks who want a more upscale breakfast, and by all accounts, they deliver.  Their offering of the value breakfast makes the value proposition more.

MzDq11nkpLjEAmcz4xczQg.text: My husband and I stopped by on our first trip to Charlotte before we moved here on a recommendation from a friend. The food was excellent and I can't wait to go back and try the red velvet waffle!!

zMX9Z5vvR1Iiunm2uqAfiQ.text: food was great!!service suck!!our server didnt even refill our water until it was time for us to go.he had to send the bus boy to do it.we notice the whole hour we was there he was just to busy flirting with this two young ladies .we felt totally ignored the whole time we was there.yea great food but not worth going back is service suck!!food took about 20min and the cafe only had about 3 tables on a friday night!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

2u7LFNB_N_T8t8BE2oP9Ug.text: My family and I went to the Terrace Cafe for the first time. When we arrived we were told the wait would be around 35 minutes. We weighed our options and decided to stay. It was very cold and rainy so we waited right inside the cafe. As we were waiting we noticed that the seating arrangements made no sense. They seated two people at a table for four, when a family of four had been waiting for a while. They did this multiple times then had to push two tables together to seat families of three or four. We also had to ask if our table was ready as it had been over 35 minutes. Once seated, our waiter quickly introduced himself and asked for our drink order. Next, he asked for our meal order. Our food came quite quickly, and it tasted pretty good. My older sister ordered pancakes, and was very impressed. My younger sister ordered two animal pancakes, an egg, and bacon. She was also very happy. Both my parents ordered chicken and waffles, and enjoyed the food as well. I ordered a red velvet waffle with a side of grits and bacon. While the food was good, it was not amazing. Enjoyed the experience but the 35 minute wait was not quite worth the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle. Cream cheese drizzle. Tasted like a normal waffle, expected more.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grits and bacon. Grits were very good.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle, side of grits and a side of bacon. Good not excellent.

trFppfuv5d9YNTkA-awb3A.text: Great service. Great food.  Honestly, our server did not have a lot of personality but he was incredibly efficient. I'm fine with that. The food is definitely worth the price tag.

IdUgv4C3YX-BIeGu80bYOA.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place for brunch when he looked up terrace cafe.  I am not big on breakfast foods and was not all to thrilled.  He insisted so we went.  LITERALLY BLEW MY MIND! Everything was delicious from the drinks to the food.  My Bloody Mary was the best thing I have ever tasted,  the peanut butter latte was so delcious we ordered two.  The red velvet waffle was amazing and the steak and eggs we scrumptous! We also ordered brushetta and I highly recommend you doing the same.  The service was also great and friendly.  I will be back!!!!!!!!!!!!

iPbpm06Ly3Kirt-pYi5thA.text: Excellent place for breakfast or lunch. Bloody Mary's with bacon... What's not to love.  I try to visit here every time that I'm in town. Red Velvet waffles with fried chicken are a sweet and savory treat for breakfast.  For lunch I've enjoyed the crab cake BLT or the Nashville fried chicken.  Both are delicious and filling.  Service is fast and fantastic. This is great little cafe.

ZVF9hC79xjKqmS4637xjbw.text: Yum. I brought Mrs here for brunch on the way to food shopping and it was a hit. The restaurant was very busy when we arrived and there was a line even to give names to the hostess, but the bar had open seats and we just went over to there and ordered immediately.  She had the lemon poppy French toast and while she said the flavor was there, it was less like eggy bread and more like eggy cake. Very sweet and the berries on top were great. Especially so since they were more room temperature and not frozen like they'd just come from the cooler.  I had the florentine benedict. The poached eggs were perfectly cooked and popped when cut. The muffin underneath was a little underdone but the spinach was excellent. LOVED THE HOME FRIES. The fried onion strings on top were an interesting garnish.  We also got a "half order" of a biscuit and sausage gravy. This was really yummy with a nice peppery gravy that had lots of sausage bits and a good fluffy biscuit underneath.  Good choice for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Florentine Benedict with Hash Browns at Terrace Cafe
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon Poppyseed French Toast at Terrace Cafe

q3_i1_6ID5iHtetbdVgvqQ.text: Disappointing!  Had not eaten there in a few years and was surprised at how run down it was and how terrible the food was. I should have turned around when we saw how dirty the carpet was on the steps on the way upstairs to our table. The breakfast and coffee were just not good.

b6QfWlaoeFR9wpfDJc_AqA.text: Waffle was good flavor but very soft more like a pancake.  Latte was very good.  We also had an omelet which was good along with nice crispy hash browns.  I am giving a 3 because of our waitress.  Service could have been better.  The waitress wasn't the friendliest, when we asked questions she answered very fast and seemed annoyed when we asked her to repeat what she said.  She didn't come around to our table much to check on us either.  Because of the lack of good service it took away from the experience.  The food was good and no real complaints but service needs work.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

6eBEmAKg7rrk9rLuqQO1YQ.text: I was super excited to try Terrace after reading so many great reviews and also because of the vegan breakfast they have on the menu. To say that I was disappointed doesn't even begin to describe my experience. Our server was not only condescending and not very knowledgeable about the menu, she was not attentive at all. In fact, she came across as bored. Her behavior was an immediate turnoff. The food was "okay." I'm sure the non-vegan fare is amazing but the vegan offering wasn't seasoned well and was over cooked. I had to ask repeatedly for my coffee to be refilled, and they kept giving everybody in our party the wrong order. It was a chaotic nightmare.   The only saving grace was that my company was fantastic so the conversation made the very poor service tolerable.   I will not be returning, at least not to the Southpark location. Perhaps the Ballantyne location has better trained servers.

sBVKqOJ4-7gSCB7RbOGniQ.text: Incredible red velvet waffles. We came here for brunch around 1030 and were seated within 20 minutes. We had a delicious pineapple and orange mimosa from the bar while we waited.   The waffles and cheese grits were the best I ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffles

THmxi057PGlgDPcldscF1Q.text: Awesome service! Great menu with tons of delicious options. We we're in town for the weekend and stopped in both days for brunch. The spicy pimiento is stellar

yt0K6E3pKXWPtx2Hq5ehQQ.text: Terrace Cafe is one of the best brunch spots in Charlotte, the wait will be long, but it's WORTH IT. My last three visits I have ordered the banana nut French toast, with extra bananas... I'm not sure why the extra bananas part is so complicated but it hasn't been right any time I've ordered. I've been requesting that the bananas be cooked with the French toast and topped with the syrup dressing, but this just hasn't been the case. I probably will stop ordering this dish but there are plenty others on the menu that will make this brunch experience great.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pecan French Toast w/ &#34;extra bananas&#34;

FLaXbtNrm6fc9hB6ISfH7g.text: The red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle and fried chicken were amazing! Cheddar grits were so creamy and good. My daughter enjoyed her kid's meal of animal pancakes, bacon and eggs. The restaurant was pretty cold, however. I had long sleeves on and was freezing. Would definitely recommend and plan on going back for the shrimp and grits.

CG4Jj-6CKc2nDTiwSCQgOg.text: The atmosphere was very welcoming and it was jammed packed on a Sunday for brunch but the wait wasn't long and the food was delicious! I ordered the red velvet waffle and fried chicken and it was delicious!!!

cOnDueSaeCU-aBtEmRfWwQ.text: Honestly not the biggest fan of the famous velvet waffles, I prefer the breakfast bowls. The brunch food is great and I've eaten here 3 times. Never had any bad service. Would return and recommend

QOJ-Zop6n8UzWwCj6oV2Bw.text: Tonight was my first AND last time to visit this restaurant:( One of the wines had turned and had to go back. The food was extremely slow in coming out to the table, and then 2 items were ice cold.  There was one server for the entire room. The poor server did her best with a smile on her face, but this was unfair to her and all the tables.  We were dining with people who have eaten there more than several times in the past and were dumbfounded to explain what was happening. I know it was just a meal, but $240 later--it did matter!

0GT-LvUODVRD4XOK6zDvlQ.text: Went here for brunch a few weekends ago - on a Sunday, the food was pretty solid..the waitress was ok. We waited about 25 minutes but it was worth it, I'd definitely go back. They also had mimosas and other brunch drinks that were delish.

-cWZ2YHyKX1wLB4x5mhY3g.text: Chicken and Waffles!  Scrumptious!! The waffles are thick and fluffy. The chicken is hot, crispy, tender and juicy inside! Add hot buttered grits and Tadaaaaa!  Service is fast. Parking is plentiful. Prices are very good! Food is delicious and there are a lot of options to choose from. Breakfast, sandwiches, entrees, sides, u name it! They have it!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. The chocolate, chocolate chip muffin! OMG this is good! Add orange juice and its a wrap!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles! Chicken is crispy, flavorful, hot, juicy and tender! Waffles are light and melt in your mouth good!

6n7YqNdtKiq_fA3Enfgblg.text: The customer service by our waiter and the manager was completely inept. You would expect a complete apology and regret from the manager when you informed them that our kids ate MOLD from the fruit. Same type of mold you see in strawberries left in your fridge.   No type of communication or sincere apology. We were asked "WHY" when we cancelled our order. Well...what do you expect.   We aren't the type to complain as my wife and I have been servers in the past. But, we do know how this should have been handled.  Edit...similar review by Mai T in March. So please issue your standard apology reply here.

c1RUpaoO3NvuvUzMueWoGg.text: The best breakfast I've ever had! Restaurant was packed but it only took them 15 of the 35 minutes they originally quoted to be seated. Set up is not super crowded and it is a comfortable atmosphere. Service was impeccable! Everyone was very attentive and friendly. Food was even better. Try the crab cake Benedict and the Bavarian French toast! Loved that they had multiple drink choices including the best mocha I've ever had.

6obHPLLQ-jBhbW5RPoSyVg.text: Came here for breakfast with my fiance and my cousins. It was soooo good! The red velvet waffle was amazing! I was hesitant to get it because I'm not crazy about red velvet but I was feeling adventurous. I also got a side of cheese grits with it and it was heavenly as well. One of my cousins got the shrimp & grits and she loved it! On top of the great food, our waitress was really funny and down to earth! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffles and cheese grits. Delish!

1uCnvYO5dRxp5nBmkT8SQg.text: RUDE, RUDE AND RUDE!!!!  Seamed it was an inconvenience for them to even seat our party.

nPfOjVPu4oNl42u91aH-xQ.text: Yikes. Strike 1: After waiting for 45 minutes we asked the hostess where we were in line and she told us we were next, yet we were not called next and got completely skipped over for an incomplete party when there is clearly a sign at the front that says they don't sit incomplete parties! Strike 2: they didn't have silverware, coke, sweet tea, clean dishes, nor did they have clean glasses. Strike 3: the food was completely flavorless. Not quite sure why people eat here. Our server was overwhelmed with other tables and barely even spoke to us. I think the only thing I enjoyed was my glass of water and my walk out of the door!  Update in response to the owner: A busy restaurant explains the lack of supplies but being skipped over in line is complete incompetence by the hostess and the other staff members up front. And the other party was still taken to their table despite us calling the hostess out on her error prior to them being seated.

kThlQ-APu2BxoIpbToSqaQ.text: Perfect spot to munch on quality food.  EZ parking, warm interior, wide selection, and friendly staff make 4-stars a no-brainer IMO.  I'm a simple breakfast eater, mostly due to diet restrictions, so I cannot comment on their sweet stuff (although those red velvet pancakes were popping up on every table--damn those high carbs!).  My omelet was cooked perfectly and served piping hot.  I opted for some cheesy grits which were OK (everyone said try the hash browns but I panicked and forgot).  My server, Julie, was a joy and I hope Mgt notices her contribution.  Thanks for a well-rounded experience.  I'll bring Lori next time and sit upstairs sipping mimosas while holding hands :)

Iuk9Opk5o1MEAO-PLa_lLg.text: Little bit on the pricey side, but the food is delicious! I had the fruit platter with yogurt and warm coffee cake, while my husband got chicken and waffles. We stopped after a doctors appointment next door. Great atmosphere and friendly staff, too.

FhYIdG3CP38ahLoWJ2Z3iw.text: Went to an early breakfast and had the red velvet waffles. As you can tell by all the pictures they are outstanding!! The omelette looked really good as well. I really don't think you can wrong with whatever you order here :)

Biq5oGYE3L1mN82GNiUgsw.text: What an amazing breakfast. It's been said over and over... Get the Red Velvet waffle!! We ordered it as an app so we could both enjoy. The breakfast casserole was wonderful. My BF got the Low Country Boil Hash special. Only came with 4 shrimp tho. For $16 I would expect more than 4. That's the only reason I give 4 stars. I really liked our server. He seemed really busy but never made us feel neglected. Great place!!!

_SHiucwQZ_AB2FLeijolLw.text: This place is amazing and worth the price. I definitely order a la carte style here. The hosts, sadly, are usually always rude. The servers make up for it though because they are all very delightful. Little things but they make a difference. I love how y'all make your own jam for your delicious biscuits and have the big tea pots. My mom loves the Benedict but slow down on the salt you add to hashbrowns. Overall, love this place.

Tekd0uHHQwhXM9dOKmpueg.text: Parking was a little crazy in the parking garage but worth risking life and limb for this place! I had the braised beef with Brussels sprouts and it was divine! The meat was tender and flavorful and the sprouts were well cooked and equally as good. I got a ton of food for the price (which was very fair given the location) and I would definitely go back again when I'm in Charlotte.

MPo_yQHYchgQAwZK9wL5ug.text: I LOVE THE RED VELVET WAFFLE! It's so dang good! And I always get the fried chicken with it!

jLCvCdLKuors2XLCV9FIkQ.text: I had very high expectations of this place and I was totally bumped by such a loooooong wait. Hostesses didn't even try show that they care... We had to come over to them twice and ask about our wait and they told us that they called our name already, but they didn't, cause we were right there. I would totally recommend to reserve a table using open table app to avoid the frustration, cause the place is totally worth going to. I had Southern Sausage Benedict with hash browns and it was yummy. Spicy Bloody Mary was one of the best I've ever had. I also saw that they have a good coffee selection, which I would like to try. I will definitely give another chance to this place, so I can rate them with 5 stars:)

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobby

9zeIM0zTPXoWIWjbofy23g.text: Went here for Saturday brunch with family. The food is pretty good. It was very packed but the service was friendly and fast.

8EorwNZPp7Re9nfz8_05tA.text: In the words of my mama, wooooo child! Lol the best breakfast I've ever had hands down. The red velvet waffle was perfect! The chicke was well seasoned and the hash browns were fresh and on point. The mimosa didn't lack anything and actually gave us all a slight buzz. The rest of my party enjoyed their meals as well. From what i was told they had the best steak and eggs in the world. The steak was a small portion though. .. sort of pricey in all for breakfast but well worth it... th ey have a great selection. I would like to return and try a few other items on the menu....

UO4YSQH_qE0_b-0R8RzXFw.text: 10/17/15 Me: I need a Saturday brunch spot that kicks butt.  My friends and coworkers: You must go to Terrace Cafe!  Me: Well Ok!  Brunch is my favorite meal. I've been spoiled by all you can eat, everything included brunches...thanks DC :) so it's hard to find anything comparable to that experience in another city. I went ahead and decided to give Terrace Cafe a shot since it was so highly recommended by my friends and coworkers.   We arrived around noon and were seated within ten minutes of arrival. I put my name on the waitlist while my friend parked the car. Our table was ready before she entered the restaurant; the waitress stated that all party members, even though it was just two of us, need to be present before being seated. Luckily, my friend stepped in the door a few minutes after the news so this requirement didn't pose a problem for the beginning of our dining experience.  Our drink order was taken and we were given a few minutes to look over the menu. I asked the waitress for her recommendations, she told me two of her favorites but really didn't sell me on either as her recommendations were short, sweet, and lacked detail.  I was a bit surprised by the lack of information and decided to go with what looked good to me :).   My go to breakfast is French Toast, eggs, sausage or bacon, and hashbrowns.  Here the French toast stands alone as a menu item...bacon, eggs, etc are ala carte. This one little detail definitely influenced my final decision. I went with the Full Breakfast (Two eggs over easy, chicken apple sausage , cheese grits, and  substituted one slice of French toast for the two pancakes). Oh yeah, they have strict guidelines for substitutions and there is a charge to swap the pancakes for the French Toast. The French Toast was dense and lacked flavor. I saw what looked like cinnamon and maybe nutmeg sprinkled atop the bread but definitely did not taste it. The chicken apple sausage was delicious; I would definitely order that again. Finally, the eggs over easy and cheese grits were the most well prepared breakfast items for today's visit. Based on recommendations from trusted sources, I was expecting a better breakfast experience. I hope that my next visit will be more eventful.

kisBnYE9iz1yg-xLavpFPQ.text: Call me a rebel, but I think their dinner is better than their brunch.  I've had brunch at Piedmont once and brunch at Ballantyne once and both were great (my friends love the bacon in the bloody mary) but dinner is some of the best upscale Southern food I've had.    The only reason I don't go more often is sometimes I'm too hungry to endure the wait, but if I plan ahead and make reservations it all works out.

zzou1D1K36OaDkyN_LxDTw.text: We came on Sunday afternoon and the wait was extremely long which is understandable for after-church. We got a cup of coffee at the bar while we waited, but for 2 black coffees it was almost $6?! That kind of set the tone for what was in store. It was very busy, and the service was pretty good. I got the eggs Benedict and they were okay. Ordered the fried green tomatoes as a side. Not sure what spice/s they use, but no one at our table was a fan. We ended up throwing them away, which I so hate to do. Nothing here makes me want to return, unfortunately.

AEsR_MuqA-SsK3oOf7sJkA.text: This place is the BEST! The chicken and waffles are to die for...even my child's dinosaur pancakes were delish! Can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  They are a little pricey, but totally worth it for food that is actually really good.

C61w_Spiein_nUtiEb_h5w.text: This place has some of the best brunch I've had. I got the Lemon Poppy Seed French Toast and it was like eating lemon cake it was sooo good. Only items I didn't enjoy was the Turkey Bacon, it was too dry.   My girls friends each had waffles and chicken and no complaints from anyone! Will definitely be back for more.

SkOY2QygT-UFdXq3B3drVA.text: Food was great, service was horrendous. Our server's name was Seth. The service started off lackluster, but, got progressively worse. He didn't check on our party of five once, nor did he offer to refill our beverages when he did half ass check in. Seth was extremely rude, unprofessional and disgusting. It was my birthday and I drove an hour and thirty seven minutes to dine there. After experiencing the level of service we did, you couldn't pay me to return. If you MUST patronize this establishment, get a carry out. Thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet chicken and waffles

j-yUpG1B7TnbSBmedRVnPg.text: I always have high hopes for brunch. Checking Yelp beforehand, I decided Terrace Cafe would be worth trying. It certainly did not disappoint.  Terrace Cafe is one of the few places that I know of in Charlotte that does brunch on Saturdays. They also don't take reservations, so expect a wait due to its popularity. I went with my boyfriend at 11:40AM on Saturday and were seated within 30 minutes.  Their bloody marys were good. Warning: the Diablo Bloody Mary was very spicy, but the others were of normal intensity. We ordered the shrimp & grits, chocolate chip waffle, and biscuits & gravy. The shrimp & grits was good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the sauce they had. The waffle was a good cake-y consistency (I prefer it that way). The biscuits & gravy were to die for. And I've grown up in the south my whole life.   All in all, I had a good experience. Food was good, service was quick and accommodating, and the restaurant had a good vibe to its decor.

1MTEU-ZQI07AAlcrIqirmQ.text: I'm so glad I found this place! It was my first time, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes cute restaurants with good food.  The Good:  1) It's a great location! I am staying at the Doubletree Hilton Southpark and it was maybe a 5 minute drive. I had considered walking, but the forecast called for rain. I don't know why people complained about parking. Yeah, I had to drive to the fourth level of the parking garage, but it was completely free. Especially given the area, the parking situation was great.   2) Decor. It had a cute feel. There was a chalkboard with drinks listed which was cute. I love chalkboards. Also, I sat at the top level over looking the restaurant, so I was able to look at everybody's food and drinks before I ordered.  3) Food. The most important part! It was extremely hard to decide what to eat because I wanted everything (in part because I'm visiting from upstate NY where you can't find chicken and waffles, grits, biscuits and gravy, etc). I decided on the red velvet waffle with chicken, a side of fruit, and a half order of biscuits n gravy. I loved the waffle! It had cream cheese frosting on it. Not much, just enough for sweetness. I didn't even add syrup. The chicken was a little dry, but it had great flavor and was very crunchy. The biscuit and gravy was good. It wasn't salty, but was creamy, the biscuit was fluffy, it was just nice. The fruit was ok.  4) Service. The hostess was nice. I called before  I came, and the hostess was helpful with all my questions. My waiter was just ok. He didn't seem too happy to be there, but he did take back the one item I didn't like (lemonade) and didn't charge me. I will say, though, he was a lot nicer than many other waiters I've encountered in this area.  The Bad:  1) The Lemonade- Since I've been visiting NC this week, I've had much of my favorite fast food, Chick fil A. That being said, the bar is pretty high for lemonade, especially at the price they're charging for it. I expected a fresh squeezed lemonade with real sugar, but I think it was some kind of mix, maybe Minute Maid. It went back.  2) Cupcake Latte- They had several flavors, including Peanut Butter Cup latte, but I've never had cupcake flavor so I went for it. It was plain. It just tasted like a really sweet latte. I'll pass.  3) Dessert- Yeah, I had dessert too (but I got it to go, don't judge!) I got the pineapple upside down cake, which has a layer of cheesecake in the middle. It came cold, which is fine since I was taking it and could heat it later. It's good, and really sweet. The pineapples on top are amazing. But it was $7 for a small slice. Not that I needed a lot, I just feel like it's overpriced.  For the red velvet waffle with chicken and side of fruit, biscuit and gravy side, pineapple upside down cake, and cupcake latte, I paid $31. Not too bad I guess. I really liked the place, so I'd go again.

9ENv_MQOcYzDpvn6hNbq5Q.text: Pretty standard brunch options. Average wait for Charlotte. Love their coffee; they serve Magnolia which is locally-roasted. Family-friendly; good amount of parking in the garage.

cTGmUuraYFISTgT-1pCSvw.text: RED VELVET WAFFLES AND FRIED CHICKEN!!Wow wow wow wow wow! Simply amazing! Great food! Great atmosphere! I really enjoyed my meal! Thanks so much for the awesome service!!

_uRNMkvrR47ZHjC027oqIw.text: Amazing! First time here for lunch today with a friend. I knew I wanted the salad with salmon on it from looking at there website but what I got was better than I imagined. I don't know if I'll be able to try anything else because of how delicious it was.

Wvo876Jl3wexLlZVIsymbw.text: It's been a few months since I went were,  but my mouth is still watering for the lemon poppyseed French toast.  I will be back.

PINkvZUEltK_nbGLCnrWYQ.text: This is one of our favorite brunch spots. The breakfast food is all that I've ever gotten here and it has been great each time. They are helpful if you have a food allergy and ask up front they have been accommodating of that every time that I've been (I can't eat dairy)

-kkidAsr46vwpl5R0bzJ-g.text: My family and I visited this place about a week ago for Father's Day, and we were expecting it to be really good from the pictures/reviews I saw, but it turns out it was overhyped.  To begin, I would lie to start with the service. Since it was Father's Day, we were expecting it to not be the greatest service, which is totally fine. However, our first server seemed to have no interest in us whatsoever, and he made some poor, overworked server take his place instead. Our service from this next server was decent, probably because she had so many tables to staff. Also, when our food arrived, we had no utensils on our table, and we waited a good five minutes before any utensils were brought to us (by the way, my Dad had to get up and find someone instead of just waiting even longer for our server to show up).   Now for our mediocre food. Everything but the lemon poppyseed French toast was just "meh" food. I ordered the Bavarian creme French toast sticks, which sounded good, and they actually okay apart from the very oily taste from them being deep fried and there not being creme in the whole French toast stick. The other dishes we ordered that were just okay as well were the full breakfast and eggs Benedict. Not only was the full breakfast overpriced for what it was, but it did not come as ordered either. Not to mention, my dad got food poisoning from it as well (on Father's Day!:( )  Overall, the only good thing about this place was the lemon poppyseed French toast.

THKlTiC-cEcvKREz_c_o7g.text: Came here for the first time on a Wednesday evening at 6:30.  Me and my friend were a bit surprised to find that when we arrived we were the only people in the restaurant but this resulted in extra attention from our server. We started with the fried green tomatoes which were pretty good but not amazing. Then for our entrees I got the chicken and waffles and my friend got the shrimp and grits.  I've had some good chicken and waffles and although these did not quite reach the spectacular level it was still delicious enough that I would go back to get it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Waffles with a side of cheese grits!

KP_OiaLo4pQ680xcKkfBtQ.text: What don't they have? I'm never disappointed in this resturant. Nice atmosphere, great service, delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled salmon over a bed of fresh steamed veggies. You can&#39;t go wrong with Terrace Cafe

uqzgnKE_BfLCMrB2kOqr7Q.text: I have visited both this location and the Ballantyne Location on several locations and have enjoyed myself every time. I always order the chicken and red velvet waffles. The presentation is beautiful. The last time I visited, I took my toddler daughter who dropped several things on the floor throughout our visit. Our server kept picking them up without complaint and I was grateful. I haven't had a bad server yet. My only complaint is that space is a bit tight in both restaurants, but especially the one on Piedmont Row. As much as I try to avoid crowds, their best time, in my opinion, is brunch, so I look past that because I know I'll get a great meal. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit.

7T5-K-Yk9gjJ9OiHGvtxtw.text: Very good simple breakfast in Charlotte. The service was cool and the food was satisfactory. I can't say I was overly impressed, but maybe it's because I didn't get the red velvet waffle that everyone raved about (after we left of course). The food was good, I'll likely come back to try out the waffle and get a better impression of everything.

mv592652UTHyoIz3YxTjNw.text: It's amazing the atmosphere & the great food fits right together if you love brunch/breakfast like i do it's the best spot

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. An amazing combination

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s three words that come to mind when you mention this place RED VELVET WAFFLE and it was awesome you can taste the real cream cheese..

ApXN6aiBD3mcBjMZ9bSA6A.text: This is a good breakfast spot to bring out-of-town visitors to. Families as well as couples will enjoy it.  Ask to sit upstairs, it's a nice view.  Coffee is great and so are their hash browns...so good!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

km7zPBaSn3t2jiWaYXdiqA.text: Remember the days, when you thought you had to eat at Waffle House, IHOP, or Cracker Barrel for breakfast on Saturday or Sunday mornings?  Not so much because they were especially great or anything, but maybe because you knew they were there for you, and could be counted on to provide a hearty and delicious breakfast, time and time again.  WELL, those days are over my friends.  Say, hello to Terrace Cafe.  I'm usually not one to dote over the intricacies of the decorations and feng-shui of a place, but Terrace Cafe truly has a remarkable interior.  The second you walk in, you are transported to a wonderful and peaceful cafe seemingly somewhere in the  Mediterranean.  My gf and I arrived there around 10am on Sunday morning, and were seated immediately with no wait.  We were taken for a nice walk throughout the restaurant, and upstairs to a table in the balcony overlooking the entire restaurant (see pics).  For breakfast, i ordered the Steak and Eggs w/ hash browns and an English muffin.  I order this every time I go here, maybe just switching up the English-muffin for toast.  It's not that I think the other menu choices will be less than satisfactory, but because the Steak and eggs are out of this WORLD!!  It comes with 2 or 3 eggs any way you like, and two steak fillet medallions (see pic).  These little medallions are as good as any steak I've had.  No sauce needed.  No knife needed.  Just good, tender beef.   My girlfriend ordered a pecan waffle with the fresh fruit cocktail as a side.  She loved it.  The waffle was cooked to perfection (I just had to eat some).  Warm syrup was also brought to the table just before the food arrived.  She loved the waffle as well as the fruit.  Explaining that the fruit was fresh and sweet.  As for the service...It was magnificent.  Nothing else needs to be said.    I'm a fan of everything about this place. Ive been here three times (all for breakfast) and have had tremendous dining experiences each and every time.  I do not have a single complaint about my dining experiences there - ever; in the three times I've been there.   Terrace Cafe is the BEST BREAKFAST SPOT IN CHARLOTTE!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and Eggs entre...eggs are scrambled with cheese and hashbrowns
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the upper level
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and eggs entre

rojOUBx94IwSEyhsuKRJRw.text: Other than some over salted spinach, both our meals (Dijon chicken & chicken and waffles) were awesome. The whole menu looks fantastic and I can't wait to try other menu items. Service was impeccable, and the ambiance was very nice. It's too bad there is no outdoor seating it would perfect on a beautiful day.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

BQt2c_Z84MJJgPqm0HlP0A.text: This place has great southern food with a modern twist. I absolutely would eat here again. Fair price points for all dishes. The smothered chicken is to die for!

L-gR_eD1RKskV3Wefp0dhw.text: We just paid a $50 breakfast for two and were seated in the employee break-room AKA upper level left side, outside the server station. During our meal, up to 8 employees congregated in that space to take a break, eat, stand around socializing and prep food.  At one point, the manager dropped in too.  One suggestion: The owners/management need to build a separate employee break-room or avoid seating patrons in that area and train employees appropriate server etiquette when patrons are in view. Customer service 101.

zK_CicmspfwjNkJc1O5Wpw.text: Big portions and very good food. I had the biscuits and gravy he and my partner had the crabcakes.

wZFCy0sU02pKLloyx5JZ7g.text: After landing in Charlotte, all I wanted were some good grits and brunch. Terrace Cafe was a wise, wise choice!  Kenzie K. and I were here on a Saturday morning, with a 45 minute wait. Clearly, everyone else in Charlotte loves brunch a much as we do. Luckily, there's a nice little waiting area outside and you can also order some coffee or drinks from the bar while you're waiting.   Now, I'm a bit of a traditionalist when it comes to benedicts, but the Sausage Eggs Benedict (eggs, sausage, and Hollandaise on a biscuit) with cheese grits was beyond tasty. We also got the Fried Oyster Salad (it's a salad so it's definitely healthy, right?) Overall, great food and I wish I was able to try more of the menu when I was here!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oyster salad. I swear there&#39;s some spinach down there. ;)
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage Eggs Benedict

W6z_xmH7kD9pwP1Qgo1R4g.text: Went for lunch for the first time today, and it was awesome. I had the chicken and waffles which were delicious! The chicken was some of the best I've ever had!! I definitely recommend checking this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles!!! Delicious

s_dFDv-et_cKCUQiokzkAQ.text: Their bloody marys have bacon!  I love Terrace Cafe for brunch on the weekends! If you love egg benedict dishes you have to try this place. The florentine is my favorite, but they also have a benedict with fielt medallions! Some of their specials include salmon benedict and crab cake benedict. Make sure to let them know how you like your eggs poached...Sometimes they'll come out a little too done.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Make sure to ask for extra spicy!

0Ua2wUo2onxPaPKK31NNmQ.text: This place was really nice and had a fun vibe,but the service was horrible. Im sure everyone was hungover but wow it was horrible. I would def come here for food though. I had the soup and Cesar salad and was very happy. They also had red velvet waffles which was mind blowing.  I would def come here again

tzS31QCtLr36D7Plwbi-6Q.text: Red velvet waffles,  Crispy bacon  Yummy grits  More menu items to try later  They did struggle mightily with my basted egg request.

gmyvsNYF5Qm6ni8UkNepOA.text: I love this place! It is literally always packed on the weekends for brunch. You have to get their early! I've been for brunch on several occasions and have yet to be disappointed. They have amazing coffee, which I think they said was from the Dilworth coffee company. Their eggs Benedict is fabulous and so is their special: red velvet waffles. So good! I've also been for restaurant week for dinner and that was amazing too! A great brunch spot, but don't underestimate them for dinner!
