uK9LM5fzRQgQLWSS7tgjcg.text: I found the Terrace Cafe with a "Weekday Brunch in Charlotte" Google search. I had a friend in town for a job interview and we were in desperate need of a brunch spot. I was ill-prepared for just how many restaurants only have weekend brunch. All of that to say, my expectations weren't super high.   We began our brunch with the only downside of the experience--an extremely long wait! There were empty tables all around and folks were moving in and out somewhat quickly, but it. took. forever. Luckily, the wait was worth it. I ordered the Red Velvet Waffle. I was both excited and nervous about the choice. I mean, I LOVE some red velvet ANYTHING, but I'm also not a huge fan of exceedingly sweet dishes--especially for breakfast. I'm the girl that can only handle like 1/4 of a cupcake at a time. Max. The waffle was DELICIOUS, though, and just the right about of sweetness without being at all overpowering. My friend ordered the Lemon Poppy French Toast and was equally impressed! Our waiter was exceedingly charismatic, attentive (without being annoying), and just wonderful!  It was a somewhat accidental stumble-upon adventure. But, it was an all-around great experience and I will certainly be back!

g0iaYXEQ7qoQ7YjAIJp8hg.text: Went to this place today around 12. We were seated upstairs. Our "waitress" was less than excited to help us. My son and I sat and waited for two friends. they were seated.  Ordered water. Was wondering why on the bottom of the "specials card" said 1/2 price wine. Cool, but they don't tell you it's only on house wine. No Pinot Grigio was listed. Opted against wine.  We ordered. 10 minutes later, here comes my Cheese steak sandwich. No one else's food. Just mine. So 5 minutes later here comes the rest of the food. My son loved his, my friend got fish and chips, greasy and battered, like Captain Ds. The jalepeno horseradish sauce smelled bad. My friends' son had over easy eggs that he couldnt even cut with his fork. So my sandwich was cold and asked for another. They turned my sandwich over on the flat-top and burned the "meat". Didnt even make a new sandwich, which btw, had about 2oz of some kind of meat. We asked for another piece of fish. Our waitress brought it, fries were cold, not to mention she dropped the plate off and had already taken our silverware away. And she never came back! IT SUCKED!!! ALL THE WAY AROUND. Our waitress didnt say 2 words to us, no smile, nothing! Manager was nice and gave us free dessert. I wasnt charged for my meal and my friend got 50% off of her meals.

Ji7EfvWDQ5NDWJeqvPR5-A.text: We stopped in a for quick work lunch.  The service was prompt.  Even at 11:30 there was a good number of people already there which was a good sign.  The food was pretty good.  We had a variety of dishes.  My coworker really liked the shrimp and grits while my fried chicken sandwich was pretty good.  If you are in the area this could be a solid option.

-NHV57ura8hoh2WAFGgcyQ.text: Great food and even better service. So glad I made this choice. The red velvet waffle and chicken is the best. If you visit it's a must try. The omelettes are also great.  Make sure you have room. The portion sizes are a bit big, you'll definitely have food to take home  great choice.

2aiZwuNAUEIHkuHJLTnejQ.text: Everything I have ever had here was amazing. Every time I am in Charlotte it is a must! The wait can be a little long.... hours long in the weekend.... But it is worth it! Come with a group and you won't see time pass, by the time you are sitting down and ordering all is right with the world.

GW_ZHEF8FkLJ3Y3AOaTwTQ.text: I will start by saying this, if you are in a group of 5+ you will wait a while to get sat. Why you say? Let me explain. As we are in town for Memorial day weekend our friends decided to come check this place out, so we just decided to tag along. Get there and wait is already at an hour- hour and a half, which by Atlanta standards is ok to me, so we decided to wait. An hour goes by, nothing, so my friends decide to check with the hostess about 1:15 of us waiting, just to see where we were, to her replying "you still have 15 minutes left to wait"? Huh? What? Isn't that estimated time just an exaggerated amount for us to wait? Or plain leave so you don't have to deal with a large party? As you can tell, the mood slowly started going down hill, and attitudes started flaring. Now, i'm no stranger to waiting, but to tell me how much time i still have to wait? Were you trying to seat us or no? Either way, right at 1hour and 35mins we get called and proceeded to get sat down. Mind you, tons of groups went ahead of us. Either way, we started placing our order to a waitress that couldn't seem to focus, kept looking at us and paying attention to the next table, which she stopped in the middle of us giving her the order to go help the next table, and then coming back. Huh?? Moving on, 35 mins later we got our food; i got the Monte Cristo which was actually pretty good, nice twist with the french toast. Paired with that was some coffee, which I could have been better off with. Tasted more like gas station coffee. At this prices why not have top notch ingredients? Lastly, we paid and got out as quickly as we could. If you have about 2.5hrs to blow just waiting and to quickly eat then this is the place. I don't think i'll make the effort into coming here again. Educate that staff with better customer service practices.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Monte Cristo. Super delicious
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Canadian Ham Benedict

VidmBvtsqzQSjvsXu5KNHA.text: I LOVE this place!! The food is ALWAYS great when I come.  Sometimes a small wait, but it's always worth it!! Ask for bartender/server Kerrin for THE best service. The crab cake Benedict was the best I've ever had.  Carrot Cake pancakes are HIGHLY Recommended.  I can't wait to bring family and friends here. 10 Stars!!

9BSxj-3UuR1CmhHZZ8-R4Q.text: Seriously, there's just not too much more good stuff I can say about this place that the other reviews haven't mentioned.   So I'll just keep it simple and tell you what I like:   My absolute favorite item here is the Red Velvet waffle and of course you HAVE to add the chicken. It's the combination of sweet and savory that keeps me coming back again and again. I'm always changing up the sides but you can't go wrong with any of them.   I've never been disappointed here. This place is good for friends, out of town guests and good ol' Sunday brunch.   Get yourself there.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Waffle with fried chicken

MtEcaiFE4PfDVgoEdog_dA.text: Very cute brunch spot in South Park! We went on a Sunday morning at 11:00am and had about a 40 minute wait. It was the first weekend that they were serving alcohol for brunch and we were able to get a mimosa from the bar while we waited. There's also seating outside while you wait. I got pancakes and eggs and sausage and it was good. I tasted my friends red velvet waffle and it was deelish! My other girlfriend got French toast and loved it!! Very reasonable prices...mimosa was $7 meal was no more than $13! Great value and great brunch ambiance!! Our waiter was super attentive and always checked on us. I definitely will go back!

Talk about light, fluffy and delicious this waffle was terrific, it came with a fried chicken breast which to me was a little dry, but hey it's a chicken breast. LOL! The restaurant was very busy, we went on a Sunday around 1:30 PM even though they were crowded, we were seated fairly quickly and served in a reasonable amount of time. l6ky31TUAB4swL79RdFswA.text: Wow...horrible food and horrible service. The Ballantyne location has better food and service. There's some serious problems with this location. The prices are insane, and the service is a joke. It's unfortunate bc I work in the tower next door and can't make myself spend my money hear no more. I've called me 9x this year basically out of laziness, and have not been impressed EVER....shame on you TC

Lzm8NS6ke5GYecJWjR9Rwg.text: I love coming here! The wait can be quite long but it's so worth it. The red velvet waffles are everything and I highly suggest the sausage and gravy. I have never been disappointed when I come here. Luckily there's 2 Charlotte locations but so hoping they would consider a third in North Charlotte area.

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage and Gravy was perfect.

4e2zRUOOaFOuQsoQqDJf0w.text: I usually don't write comments for review but I need to. I was recommended this place from a family member. The food was great  but the services  was horrible. The server kept forgetting to provide utensils, substitute to order and etc. this was not a big deal because I'm flexible. However I reviewed the Sunday menu on 4/7/2019 at 1:00pm and notice that the menu mention a loyalty program and you will receive a dessert for your birthday month. Not the exactly date but birthday month.I ask the server if I sign up today would I be able to receive the birthday dessert The server forgot during dinning. So I ask again and she ask the manager. The manager told the server that they could not do it because my birthday have past.( I told them my birthday was last week) I ask why because on the menu it said birthday month.  The server ask the manager to explain and he said he could only do if I received a coupon code. I did not understand why the restaurant could not be accommodating since the menus said birthday month and I sign up. I'm really writing this review on principle . I work in service and you want to make the customer happy.  At first I could not received the birthday dessert bc it was not my birthday but now I need to receive a coupon code. I just believe they just did not want to accommodate for what reason I will not know.

lsbHA_AUBqImv-TsTjyK9Q.text: This is a must try! You have to get the red velvet waffles. Great brunch place. I've been many occasions including breakfast and lunch. A little on the pricey side. Service is great. Very fast and never have had to wait to be seated even on busier occasions.

_2fsU4U3P1eBNIaqrZLCzQ.text: I've eaten at TC once before for brunch and have been wanting to make it back. They have great mimosas, cocktails and a famous red velvet waffle!  This time, we went in for brunch on a Friday. They do brunch M-S until 3pm, which is great. We need more places in Charlotte doing daily brunches! The hubs got a chai tea latte, which was very delicious. Perfect amount of foam and spice and not overly sweet. Also, it's served in a nice comfortable large mug.  I went with the Florentine Benedict with a side of Canadian Bacon. Pro tip: add the bacon to your benedict. Delicious and adds a whole new savory flavor dimension. The Benedict was very good, and the home fries were crispy, just as I like them! I stole some bites of my husbands lemon poppyseed French toast. It's served with icing and berries and comes with 3 pieces. I found the French toast slightly too crumbly, but my husband loved it!  Service was decent, though it was pretty busy on a Friday afternoon. Next time I'll have to get the fried chicken and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chai latte
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon poppyseed French toast

MQctQI7RQnC_McMGVXNJog.text: Usually terrace cafe is packed and the wait is long but today it was kind of empty (prob because of the weather). We walked in and it took them a little while to sit us even tho it was kind of empty. Today I ordered the chicken Cesar salad which was amazing. Everything was on point. The people I was with ordered food as well with a side of fries but these fries were different from the ones we are accustomed of getting. We asked the waiter when did they change them and he said it changes all the time. Other than that and them not having any dr. Pepper everything was great

fwiNW3QuIE1ZYmY1ZYLlPA.text: Definitely a neat and original atmosphere. I'd highly recommend getting here a tad early on a Sunday to grab a seat up on the terrace so you can watch all the people roll in over the next hour. Alcoholics, wannabe big-shots, prudish housewives, and the rest, come see all the Qu3en City has to offer!!

UQiESUdnw7IbxXF6Rx6TXQ.text: I am writing this review while I'm sitting here at breakfast (which is probably rude) considering that my breakfast date is looking at me. The atmosphere is really rustic and welcoming. First- it took the server roughly 7 min to even greet us or take our drink order (not terribly an issue) but I do like to be acknowledged in a reasonable amount of time.  The food came from another server who was visible distraught because of how busy she was but the food was amazing. I had the Chicken and Waffles- it was delicious but not the best I have had in Charlotte (that belongs to NAPA). It was priced correctly and the waffle wasn't cold or soggy. The chicken was moist and breaded just the right amount. Overall I was very pleased with the food.   Problem is that- although the food was great- the service was abysmal. My server saw me twice- to take my order and then again after I was done with my food so she can ask if anyone checked on us that entire time. They didn't and I waited 5 min to get syrup. I would have waited longer if my guest hadn't gotten up went to the server station and ask another server for syrup. I would have actually waited until my server came back to the table. The server was apologetic but that wasn't merely enough for not even asking if they got our food correct. It was the first time in almost 7 years that I tipped only 15% of the bill. This was a Thursday morning not Sunday brunch. I was disappointed.  Again- great food but TERRIBLE SERVICE.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast Menu

3Qk2ajSzgbgTGIfpOvSorA.text: My friend had eaten here and told me how she got food poisoning because half way through eating her food, she found that there was mold on the fruit. She told them about it, they apologized, she paid, the end.   I thought by her telling them about their spoiled fruit, they would be more careful about it. I was craving their SEC biscuit today and wanted the fruit as a "healthier" side. Biscuit was good as usual and I even checked the fruit to make sure. It looked good but as soon as I picked up the raspberry, there was a blueberry underneath covered in mold!!!! Ewwwwww! I can't believe it happened to me too!!   I was so upset I took the cup of fruit back to show the manager and his respond was "I apologize, do you want another cup of fruit?" Was he waiting for me to say "Yes, please give me another cup of fruit full of mold. I've been waiting all my life to eat that!"?   How about give me back the money I spent on that nasty cup of fruit that I don't want? But of course he didn't offer. Of course I had to pay for that with the mold in it.   Please stay away from this location! Bad fruit and bad management overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bottom left is the blueberry with mold all over it. Please stay away from this location!

kyAQdy8bDdI4guSPDO6kJQ.text: I used to love this place.... eating here today with rude service... all because I changed my order!! The server was not friendly from the start... I'll never be back

J2wuDD423qMyfURM9OGp5w.text: Special thanks to everyone at Terrace and Nikki for hosting a lovely event!   I've had brunch at the Ballantyne location. This was my first time visiting the South Park area. I was impressed with the menu this evening. Everyone was offered a glass of white or red wine. I selected the Chardonnay. I believe the other was a Merlot.   Each course was served on small plates.  The Appetizers - Wild Mushroom Crostini and Buttermilk Calamari. I loved these items! If I had to choose, I'd say the Crostini was my favorite. The three cheese spread is life changing.   The Beet salad was refreshing, however It didn't earn my memory.   Entrees - Bourbon Braised Beef Short Ribs, Shrimp and Grits, and finally The Gnocchi & Wild Mushrooms. I was a fan of everything! I noticed the shrimp and grits came with a sauce---Which I didn't receive, I was slightly disappointed. The side of Vegetable medley was a after thought. No seasoning. I wouldn't recommend ordering this.   Finally! Dessert!! I couldn't pass up the peanut butter fudge cheesecake! I should've ordered a slice to go!! I picked off the chocolate seemed a bit much. Plan to return in here again soon for brunch.

JDasijg-zupiQEue6ESdjQ.text: Just in case you were wondering, Terrace Cafe is still awesome. The servers are friendly and quick. The Bacon Bloody Mary is still the best in the city and the breakfast is worth the wait.   If you want a pro tip, come early on the weekends. I met a friend for brunch recently at 9:00 am and we were seated immediately. And no one judges you for drinking early.

OdeCo5lhZD34TFBWyd9PHA.text: It was good, but I didn't think it was anything special. Was it worth the wait? Not really, but I'm not saying it was horrible. Just not a place I would recommend. On the bright side, our waitress was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

yWajl7QuX3kaqfMBJtxxUA.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Quoted a 30min wait. At 45 mins we were at the stand to inquire about additional wait time. We were seated shortly after.   Service: Initial service was delayed as they had cleared our section and sat everyone at the same time so our waitress did the best she could.  Food:I opted for the red velvet waffle and chicken. Both were good enough although the chicken was a little bland for my liking.   Overall, I'd return if I were in the area.

1-t13-dAzCgt3mmufwfO1g.text: Love this place whenever I'm in town. The hostesses were rude when we walked in and we're more interested in their conversation than greeting us. The waitress was nice. Chicken and red velvet waffles were delicious, but not as good as I remember. I feel like the chicken portion has gotten smaller since my last visit. The cheese grits were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

pRqy9TmxERwpvJeg_g6q3Q.text: After being suggested by yelp, we decided to give this place a try. The staff was super friendly from the host to the waitress. The food is AMAZINGGGGGG!!!! I had the chicken & waffles with red velvet waffles, & a side of cheddar cheese grit. Anytime I'm in Charlotte this is where I'm coming for brunch !!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

1leC2A8pG7FGZZGZh134tQ.text: Sunday brunch was delicious. The mimosas were yum. Nice clean restaurant with fast service. Waitress and management were very  friendly.  I think it would be nice to have a place to wait inside. We froze outside while waiting. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious!

zF50ZO-s9qUzJGg8DM7xcQ.text: I wish they took weekend brunch reservations. But I went with a party of six and everything was very good. Chicken and waffles, red velvet waffle, French toast, all good. I was perturbed that the daily drink special was a $4 Bloody Mary that they were somehow out of at noon on a Sunday, though. That lost them a star. But overall it was an enjoyable dining experience.

ds0igC7ehKYx0vpUr9ODsg.text: This was, hands down, the BEST breakfast I have ever had in my life!  It has such a hustle and bustle vibe, but not one that stresses you out.  The restaurant itself is warm and inviting, and you can tell that it's owned by good people.  Regarding breakfast, they have a full coffee bar with a bunch of delicious lattes on the menu!  They also have a fun and exciting food menu that has a little (or a lot) for everyone.  There are traditional plates and some that burst with flavor!  I was also really impressed that many things are made in house, like their sausage.  It was delicious!  You may need to wait before you get a table, but gosh it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

eIk3peqBY1QTiAr50C53oA.text: Overall atmosphere is great for a casual brunch with friends on the weekends. I ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich and the chicken was fried perfectly. Our waitress was also very attentive. However, multiple of my friends complained their food came out cold. It would have gotten a 5 stars if not for this fact.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZOalDdlpqQjv6C7BTMyXHg.text: The Bananna Nut french toast is to die for my bacon was a little cold and the eggs were fried too hard but other then that the service was good

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

pd7m4NvsDGFnfCB-5L0OBQ.text: Terrace cafe has been one of my favorite brunch spots in Charlotte, but this week, I had the pleasure of sampling some of Terrace's new dinner menu, and thank God....grits are included!! I've always loved the grits here; they aren't to soupy, not too grainy and they are now a part of a shrimp and grits dinner menu item. I also had an interesting salad that included two colors of beets and a very delicious dressing. To top it all off , I enjoyed a gluten free peanut butter cheesecake that was so good I lost track of time eating it, zoned out a little.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wild Mushrooms Crostini and Buttermilk Calamari

T3Df90l6umoc91nmzQeOHA.text: This is probably one of my favorite breakfast places. The staff was super friendly, the wait wasn't long. The sausage gravy biscuit was tasty. Best gravy and biscuit I've ever had. The chicken sausage is also great here. The pricing wasn't bad either. For 5 people (3 adults & 2kids) we paid around $60. I would recommend anyone in town to visit this place. Also, try the red velvet waffle. :) you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

qGbxhpQA9e5IlK3fgs7aRw.text: Loved the food and the staff! This family owned restaurant truly makes you feel like you are at home with good company. Actually ended up sitting at the table next to the owner who politely introduce himself and asked about our experience thus far, that doesn't happen very often! We will definitely come back!

yF3bqeJoOKDNbS4cr4oWRw.text: Normally we love this place, despite it being pricier than most.  But, after our visit Monday, we won't be going back.  There were literally 5 tables of people in this normally busy place, and somehow, we managed to get the worst service and barely warm food.  Pretty sure our food was sitting downstairs for a while when some other server finally brought it up.  Maybe it's because our server was busy facebooking on her phone a couple tables over from us?  We had to wait several minutes just to flag down someone else to get us fresh coffee!  Then we waited and waited to pay our bill only to find out she was busy going to get her own breakfast so she could plop back down in her booth to text and eat. Seriously?!   We thought about filling out the comment card that was with our bill, but even that was nasty and coffee stained.  Not good.

3BY_aEk_qDa8SOVFl343vg.text: My boyfriend and I both got really sick here recently. This is the second time I got sick eating at Terrace.

nonCXoPHBTjUL6R_ue6nMA.text: We've been to Terrace several times and the food,service and atmosphere is awesome it's a keeper.

wsUyeLscSDxrBP1SeLZXhQ.text: Seriously the best omelet I've ever had. Fluffy, with fresh vegetables (not overly sauted), and came to the table hot! Potatoes were crisp on the outside and perfect inside. I arrived at 8:45am and had no wait, which is unusual because Terrace Cafe is loved by the masses.

ZOb4vZ1ByU7snGl18Yhikw.text: Always great for breakfast. Can be a long wait so I go a little later to miss the rush. Service is friendly and quick! The red velvet waffle is a must try. Their Benedicts are tasty which is my go to brunch dish!  Lattes are the best but coffee alone is not so great.

uPXYxYPAvxJcz6cUhQZQSg.text: After hearing great things about this place my friends finally took me here and the food was delicious!   My first impression of this place was the decor. The cafe has high ceilings and a upper level seating area. The ambiance is nice. As all brunch places if you're not there before 10:30-11am the wait time will be longer. We got there early and were seated immediately (side-note: you will not be seated unless your entire party is there).   We ordered coffee's and lattes to drink. The coffee was so smooth and my friend who is picky about her cream choices was given a specially made latte to her liking. Now thats great customer service.   For food:  - Red Velvet waffle (as a starter... don't you judge us!) - Kids 2 pancakes (with choice of meat) and side fruit and eggs - sausage egg and cheeses biscuit with side of hash browns - two quiche specials (chicken option) with side salads - side order (1/2) of the biscuit n gravy  everyone loved their food. My sausage egg and cheese biscuit was HUGE! It was perfectly soft on the inside. Their sausage is hand made at the location (amazinggg). Kinda spicy but i like the heat.  My friends loved their quiches. The portions here are quite large and the food is filling for sure.   the all-star of the experience however was their red velvet waffle with cream cheese drizzle and a huge strawberry on top. we spilt that as a group and man it was perfect!!!!!!!!!!   good food, good service, good location!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle!!!!!! - $11
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage (made in house!!) egg and cheese biscuit - $8
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken quiche special

0djzBtuB8-dcpGK8B5MN7A.text: The food was okay, not great. I ordered the terrace biscuit, and I love biscuits but in my opinion this was too much biscuit, I wish they would've used a more equal portion of biscuit and egg. My husband got the stuffed monte cristo, he also said it was only okay. Our little girl got the spice donut dunker, and she didn't eat it. It had way too much spice in my opinion. The coffee was good, and the waiters were excellent. We sat at the bar and everyone was super nice, me and my little one were drooling over the fruit, one of them handed us each one. I also liked how attentive the staff was there. However, my husband dropped me off at the front so I could reserve a seat, I was told you cannot reserve until your whole party is there, which I can understand. I stepped to the side and waited for my husband and daughter. Two minutes later, another woman walked in, and I don't know if it's because she was white but they were ready to seat her even though she had clearly said a party of 4 (she was alone). The hostess saw me glare at her and set the menus back down, then proceeded to tell her the same thing. Because of this reason we chose to sit at the bar, and because of this reason I will not be going back.

fyYA2cdata0WQawNnYZDaw.text: Went here with coworkers after a nightshift and the food was delicious. I had build your own omelette with a side of grits. The omelette was very good, the grits were okay but nothing special. The mimosas were delicious, cost about $7 and were worth it. Great place and we will come back for sure.

ai9ZdaJzotyP0GSfHjGZ1Q.text: The red velvet waffle has to be my favorite. The atmosphere is nice, and the service is good. If you want to try new things there are a lot of twist to our regular entrees; such as, their chicken salad. Also, if they have tomato bisque, it is a must!

wPZgtq6pGwM1tT1o3iAoGQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked for a while now, and I finally decided to check it out with my wife. After seeing all of the glowing reviews, I thought it would be a sure hit. It wasn't.  There's tons of close, free parking in the attached garage, so that makes getting here very easy. You can expect quite a wait. Ours was 45 minutes to an hour. Since it was cold outside, most people waiting just lurked around the tables in the lower level, which would bother me if I were dining there. On the plus side, the outdoor waiting area had a nice propane heater, so we were able to wait, stay warm, and avoid lurking.  The decor is reminiscent of a late-90's hotel buffet eating area. Upstairs, where we were seated, features low-hanging pipes and unsightly, painted flexible ducting that is draped precariously over pipes. Not a great ambiance, methinks.  The food was good overall. I ordered the Crab Cakes Benedict, and my wife ordered the Canadian Bacon Benedict. She got a side of hashbrowns, and I got the cheese grits (upcharge). The eggs were perfectly cooked, and the English muffins, although they looked pretty thin, were very tasty. The cheese grits were good, but they were a little cold and were served in a tiny dish. Bummer.  I have to think that this place used to be something much, much better. At this point, most of the glowing reviews from a few years ago should be considered very, very misleading. Given all of the great brunch choices in CLT, I don't think I'll be back for a second visit any time soon.

cvTXE_xiOwb1rwJt2WpUwg.text: Used to come here on a regular basis- admittedly it was always for breakfast or lunch. Went for dinner last night and was extremely disappointed. Has this place changed ownership? Something has gone awry. Wine had to be sent back. Calamari appetizer came out cold and chewy. (When it was replaced with a hot version, it was delicious though.) Half of our party's entrees were delicious- but half came out completely cold.  We finally gave up sending cold items back. What was going on in the kitchen?? Service was so slow I had to take mine to go in the end. Server was pleasant but slammed. Manager does not go out of his way to be particularly pleasant. This used to be one of our go-to restaurants.  Not any more.

C61fMykhTjjNZ67ToxkA4Q.text: Terrace Cafe red velvet waffle was delicious!! The scrambled eggs were good and the fruit was fresh. I also had dinner at Terrace Cafe before but the red velvet waffle was the highlight of my food experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. My Red Velvet Waffle photo ~ Ty F.

tUhSxY5ZuPPWeTFSx-IFoA.text: I'm happy.  This is the first time I had breakfast and now can couple that experience with the many lunches and some dinners here.  All experiences were good.  This is a cafe with a full bar.  Nothing fancy, but it is comfortable with a good menu.  The breakfast was basic with some nice spins.  I had a three egg, must have been small eggs at that, omelet with hash browns and toast.  Juice.  The omelet was just fine, but small and the hash-browns were outstanding rounds of crispiness on both sides.  Bravo!  The surprise spin was strawberry jam, which I first thought was a form of ketchup.  I don't like strawberry jam, but tried this guy and it was terrific.  Just mushed up strawberries with just enough lemon and sweetener to bring out their best.  I must say that I inhaled that jam on a piece of rye bread and it was like dessert.  The waitress, Melanie, told me that they have some other home made jams that they rotate each week or so.  Last week I missed blueberry mango.  Yes, I sure did.  My wife and I especially like their lunches.  Menu has great plates, salads and sandwiches and all meals have fried green tomatoes available.  Dinner menu is not too different from lunch, just a few other main plates.  Nice atmosphere, good for first dates, business meals and simply a place to get fed and have a few drinks...perhaps.  They do a good job and you will like the flatware, glassware and plates. You will see.

LizfKBDE_5uqQ00wqEAN1A.text: Went there about 3 years ago and it was awesome! Back this weekend and it was Dennys on an smaller location and with higher prices. Service was bad. Empty glasses and dishes were never picked. Zero attention to detail and food quality and taste were not what we remembered from our first visit.

nn8iWp5yQ8wh60p8Pabifg.text: The recommendations were right on the money here...I also had an outstanding server whose name is Tashi...thanks for the great service

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet waffle with chicken and cheese grits

OuLBb7yK0WzC29V0Db567Q.text: The food is amazing here, I had the shrimp and grits with a velvet waffle and it was delicious. Our server Julie was also amazing.

ueOyF5e6JdzVT61pkKG6pg.text: This place is outstanding!!!! The food was PERFECTION!! The white mocha was thick and delicious. I'll tell you what, this place deserves an award and Tue people that gave it less than 5 stars need to come back and try it again

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

wNj6Q7u4L0IFtUXUtJsfEQ.text: Terrace Cafe is a solid lunch place! I've been there a couple of times and the food has never, ever been bad.   The restaurant is very well lit and has two stories so there is plenty of space. I'm not usually a salad person, but I haven't had anything else from there... their oyster salad (both Caesar and Spinach) are very good! I look over the menu and want to pick something different, but every time I end up getting the salad.   The service is good so overall I'm pretty happy going there for lunch. I've heard their brunch is even better though! I'll have to try it soon.

_nwiCb12OHIj39xkjFe9lA.text: An upscale relaxing and cozy place. I ordered the Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles drizzled with cream cheese with a side bowl of fruit and it was excellent. Chicken was cooked just right and the waffles were so fluffy. It was all very filling. I would definitely recommend this.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles drizzled with cream cheese, very good.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Velvet Chicken and Waffles and side bowl of fruit was great, better than expected! Recommend this.

95JIQRZzwGz2Za22MO4KWg.text: Visiting from Maryland we relied on Yelp to guide us in the right breakfast direction. We found Terrace Cafe and immediately walked into a warm ambient.   With pleasure we were served by Whitney and Amy. Wow. No words can describe the excellent customer service we received this morning. When we thought it couldn't have gotten any better... it did. Both were very attentive and made the entire experience absolutely memorable. Completely personable experience.   The food was impeccable. You can't go wrong with-- Strawberry French toast, Croissant: ham, egg, cheese, and Meat lovers Omelette. They are certainly not rating highly by accident.   Without a doubt we will visit this restaurant again. Check it out for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Croissant: ham, egg, &amp; cheese
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry French Toast

5wSO1WYU0661TV7swptD_w.text: Loved brunch here. My friend and I ordered the lemon poppyseed french toast and the strawberry cream french toast. The service was speedy (even on a busy Sunday morning) and our waitress was very friendly. Would recommend visiting here if you are in Charlotte and looking for a tasty place for brunch in the South Park area.

U91Dv5i-OVTCE1yhx7W6Gw.text: I came here with my wife and friends for a birthday brunch, which I thought would be amazing. Firstly, this place is extremely crowded. If we weren't happy to sit at the bar area, we would have had to wait 20-30 minutes to be seated.  When you get to your table, you will notice that all the silverware and bowls/plates are not pieces you can find in your local Macy's.  All the cutlery and bowls are designed to be very curved and give the feeling that you're about to eat in a fancy restaurant. The menu is fairly large and everything is pretty expensive but I ignored the prices and ordered the "Shrimp and Grits"  My Shrimp and Grits were spicy, mixed in with what I think were bacon bits, and had a few okras laid out on the top. While it was very unique in its flavors, the combination of spicy, okra-ey, shrimpy, bacon-et, and creamy left me oh-so-slightly nauseous.  I don't want to say it was bad in any way, but I did think it was made to "wow" guests rather than to actually be a delicious breakfast.  The past week I had just gone to a place in Davidson called Restaurant X which I thought was spectacular without trying too hard to be "unique" so I have to admit that I was a bit disappointed to pay more, and get a less pleasant experience.   On a side tangent, this is the only restaurant I have ever been to that has mouth-wash in its bathrooms.  I felt that the Terrace Cafe is trying too hard to be different, and not trying hard enough to make a delicious meal. It's crowded, a bit pricey, and too experimental to be delicious, and thus I can sadly only give Terrace Cafe only 3-stars for now.

2MC7As4UD87zZqpbs2zQrg.text: Terrace Cafe is one of my favorite brunch spots in all of Charlotte! I have now been there multiple times all for brunch and I have never left with less than a belly full of delicious food!   My first time I tried Terrace Cafe a friend and I each got a beautiful latte. We shared the florentine eggs benedict and the special lemon poppyseed french toast. As a True lover of all types of eggs benedict, the florentine was very good. The lemon poppyseed french toast was really unique and tasty. It tasted almost like lemon poppy seed bread made into french toast. Very dense and filling, but perfect with the lemon sauce.   On my next visit I decided that it was time to accept that I have moved to the South and try the chicken and waffles... Let me just say I totally know why this is such a hit! It was absolutely AWESOME. A great combination of sweet and savory, I had to finish every last bite, because it was too good to leave on the plate. It came with a side of grits, which were buttery. To drink I got the french press coffee and a mimosa, but great additions to a wonderful meal. My friend got fried green tomatoes and the BEC Biscuit both of which were very tasty too.   The atmosphere at Terrace is very inviting, for such a popular restaurant they are able to keep the wait minimized for the most part and it is very worth it. I have had nothing but friendly staff and service. Not too needy, but plenty attentive. If you want breakfast/brunch this is your place. I promise you will not be disappointed. Maybe I will try lunch or dinner sometime, if it is anything like their breakfast I know I won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Latte

JKlmoGl3F-rWTL5fllb5xg.text: This is my favorite breakfast place in the Charlotte area thus far.  The venue itself is very nice, spacious, and well designed.  The staff are super friendly.  I always get the full breakfast: pancakes, cheesy grits, scrambled eggs and bacon.  It's a very high quality breakfast.  They use very good ingredients, I can tell.  The coffee here is high octane as well.    WARNING: if you dare try coming here on a weekend, make a reservation well in advance or you will NOT get it.  Ideally, if you can come in during the weekday, that's a much better move. Enjoy!!!

Cf6uJtRrz5Ge6W_UylK12w.text: Disappointed. I've been to Terrace before for breakfast and it was good, but skip this restaurant for dinner. Not enough bread for our table and it took forever to take our order. They were severely understaffed for dinner service. Waited at least 20 minutes for our waitress to return our bill so we could pay and leave. Our waitress wasn't at fault: it was management who gave her no support.

htwmzUqUdZQmO5H9t_-llA.text: Every time I am in Charlotte I come here. I have never been disappointed. It gets packed though and there can be a wait. It is well worth it.  The location is great because you can park in the deck and there is always parking. It is a smallish place, but they have some seating upstairs and a small bar as well.  I love the bloody mary here. The best anywhere. I love the hash browns and the red velvet waffle - OMG - to die for! Really good coffee drinks and great service.  The last time I went, some friends were in the area and wanted to join us, but we only had a table for 4. So we asked the server if we could add 3 more people and they moved the tables around to accommodate us, even though they were pretty busy at the time. I was really happy that they were able to do that, since I was visiting and wanted to be able to spend more time with my friends.  I have had dinner here as well and it has been awesome, but I keep coming back to the breakfast because it ROCKS!!!!  I wish they had these on the west coast!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Upstairs
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle. Yes!
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Everything breakfast

tWSPZknM76gWcPGrfyNoEw.text: Biscuits don't get any better. I'm on that Bacon, Egg and Cheese team #basic. If you have a sweet tooth for breakfast, be ambitious and get the Red Velvet Cake Waffle. It's insane!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Heaven in the form of fish. I usually like my salmon plain with salt &amp; pepp, that&#39;s it. This rendition was well worth the risk!

wNBVNETBLozYziCp1J_S5A.text: Best brunch in Charlotte hands down! Super packed on Sundays! I love their breakfast choices!

iXLdXc3zZRnb3bnZQYcBXQ.text: One of my favorite places to have breakfast - from their eggs Benedict to the famous red velvet waffle, everything is delicious and up to par!  I'm not a fan of their grits, but to each his own. This place definitely gets four stars! Atmosphere is comfortable and inviting. Definitely a great eat in the South Park area!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle with a side of eggs and bacon.

mV236zJt5ZLIxZ0qaxh3zQ.text: Our waitress was very attentive and friendly during brunch. Since I just recently moved to the south, I had never had chicken and waffles before. She recommended I get that dish with a side of sausage gravy, since I am more a fan of savory dishes than sweet. This dish was absolutely incredible. I have not ordered chicken and waffles anywhere else since this occasion because I am afraid it won't compare!

VXhy2Wpa3EgGZqeNppcQgA.text: The chicken and red velvet waffle are awesome! Lunch menu items were only so-so. Service was good and had a nice atmosphere. I would give it 5 stars if some of the prices were a little less-drink prices were not with what you get

bVKL0QU6kqLXXZmPNDvlag.text: Customer Service: My family and I have eaten at Terrace Cafe on many occasions, and never had the need to say anything negative about our experiences. We have always gone during the morning or early afternoon hours. On last Friday, (1-2-15) we ate at Terrace for dinner.   The cafe was mostly empty except for 3 other tables of patrons. My family placed our orders and my husband and I asked for "sweet" tea. First of all, the waitress took about 15 minutes to bring our drinks which I thought was very odd, considering there were so few patrons in the restaurant. When my husband and I tasted our tea, it was unsweetened!  Mind you, as I mentioned earlier, we have eaten at Terrace many times and have ordered their sweet tea most of those times. Each time, it has been appropriately sweet, even to the point of being too sweet.  This time however, the tea was definitely unsweetened. We told our waitress and she apologized and bought us out two more glasses of "sweet" tea. Again we tasted out tea and it was just like the first glasses, UNSWEETENED!!   This time, my husband walked to the front and told the waitress the tea was still unsweetened. 10 minutes later she comes to our table and says, " I'm sorry but I don't understand, I usually don't drink tea but I tasted the tea and thought it was sweet and my co-worker tasted the tea and she also thought it was sweet!  Are you kidding me!!!!! So what she was really trying to say is that there must be something wrong with our taste buds because we, the employees think it's sweet!! Mind you, I have tasted Terrace's "sweet" tea and it has always been appropriately sweet! I ended up canceling my drink order and just drank water.  So, here are my comments  to this situation:   Firstly, as your patron, please don't insult my intelligence by putting the burden of proof on the customer. In this situation, the customer is ALWAYS right! (Customer Service 101).  Secondly, The manager on duty usually comes to the patrons table whenever there is a dispute or misunderstanding of some type with the patron. The manager on duty never approached our table.  Thirdly, repeat customers are bred as a result of repeat positive customer experiences, even during challenges.  Finally, My family and I initially went to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner but had to wait 1 1/2 hours for a table. This was the reason for our dinner trip to Terrace. Terrace is known for it's long lines during breakfast hours but I wonder why there was hardly anyone there during dinner hours???? Hmmmmmm just an observation!!

kSvrQYGDqcARAR1pb-IXPQ.text: Terrace is great! I work very close and love to walk over for coffee or a bacon, egg and cheese sandwich some mornings. Its always very fast and the service is great. I have also been to numerous lunches there and have never had a bad meal. Highly reccommend if you are in the Southpark area for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Ol6e4K58wYYpU8nYS8IOUQ.text: I've had all great experiences trying new restaurants in Charlotte until this one.  The best way to describe my experience would be like when you get overcharged for a buffet at a fancy hotel. I ordered the "chef's special hash" for $15, which was very plain, simple, and small. Eggs, hash browns, and a few peppers.  I looked at my plate and told my wife, "this is something we could have easily made at home"

UpzlNqD7lpUalHWsgwaZfg.text: Awesome place!! The fried green tomatoes with pimiento cheese is absolutely to die for! Also the omelet you make yourself is amazing with goat cheese!!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States

a4AJ3kVUSmzDZBtz-g-hag.text: Great food and delicious cocktails. Had a coffee infused drink how I wanted it! Absolutely delicious! Ordered the full Breakfast.... delicious! Good costmer service and the food came pretty quickly.

T2NBs70TAMG_mL5I6AKHew.text: The food is amazing! I had the red velvet waffle, fired chicken and fruit. I loved the cream cheese icing on the waffle. I didn't care for the fruit. On the down side, our waiter Seth was very dry and gave is a vibe he didn't want to be there. Poor service that day but greatttt food!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle &amp; chicken
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love the artwork!

eRvLGgoaiOcthmbrI1-F9w.text: Food is decent but expensive for what you get.  Consistently very busy.   If you work in Piedmont Town Center and you have to eat real food quickly before your next meeting, Terrace is a great option. If you're not in a huge rush, there are better options (both in quality and in price) within a few minutes drive.

3l-fQ07H3NhxBVWwEX92Qg.text: Went on a Friday morning and we were sat upstairs.  It took forever to get someone for our water, to take our order, for the food to be served, and even for the check.  The breakfast here was nothing to write home about.  Had their egg benedict, but they put whole grain mustard in their hollandaise sauce - which gives it a very sour taste instead of the slight hint of lemon juice - and it's just wrong.  Overpriced for the subpar service and mediocre food.  Will not be back.

YTbsLKE8n9fMWqTR_wKrUg.text: Great place for brunch! We went for my birthday and the waiter was awesome and attentive. Both locations have consistently good food. Only thing I would recommend is a little more seasoning on the grits. Everything else was flavorful!!

I-WaVVIL61pxQUCBhKPIHw.text: Went for breakfast.  Great menu (breakfast served all day).  Nice decor and cool upstairs seating.  Lots of variety on the menu.  The eggs florentine perfectly cooked poached eggs, breakfast casserole was delicious with a little kick to it, but not spicy. Service was attentive and not intrusive.  We will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patriotic breakfast on the 4th.

RZ5YRcllPtQEBPV9lS42uA.text: Great food. Loved the omelet and chicken sausage. The coffee cake was awesome!  Our server went above and beyond.  Thank you Joan!

FC0negvPIAbCvuAX2XYCQA.text: Next time I go to Charlotte I will be having breakfast here!  I got the omelete and added turkey bacon, spinach, and cheese it was delicious.  Instead of toast I opted for the pancake and it was actually undercooked, but the delicious omelete made up for it.  Everyone else had the red velvet waffles which the place is known for and according to all my friends it was heavenly.  Not much of a red velvet fan but everything else was good and $5 mimosas are a win!!!  The most surprising thing at the restaurant is the speedy wait time.  When we arrived it was really busy, but the hostess said 30mins and in 30mins we were seated.  Unfortunately, our entire party was not there and they won't seat you unless everyone is there. However, since we were starving we sat without the missing people, but the staff was very accommodating to allow our remaining friends to seat at the table next to us once they arrived.  All in all, this is a great place with amazing food!

photos.caption: Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and eggs. The steak was too well done for my taste, but he liked it
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red velvet waffle, scrambled eggs with cheese, bacon and fresh fruit.
Photo of Stewart Penick's Terrace - Southpark - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey bacon, spinach, and cheese omelet with fresh fruit! Super yummy!!

Zk4cnPDTULluV4ZVMsiGSg.text: So, it's a Saturday morning and I'm in the kitchen making over-easy eggs accompanied by toast, baby tomatoes and fresh basil and my boyfriend in the living room says, "you're cooking? I thought we could go to brunch." Oh... okay. I never say no to brunch so stopped in my tracks and plated the "breakfast appetizers," considering it a good idea since any good breakfast place in Charlotte seems to have a 20-30 minutes wait.  I was right. We drove down to South Park and put our name in (30 minute wait, as anticipated) and decided to do a little shopping at the Container Store while we waited. We're getting pretty good at fitting errands into dining based on location. Anyway, once 25-30 minutes had gone by we headed back to Terrace, where the hostess was ready to take us to our table. Perfect timing! We were seated upstairs overlooking the restaurant and ordered coffee and fresh orange juice. I had the shrimp and grits (I'm becoming quite the southerner) and we shared a side of the red velvet waffles... OMG. Both were so amazing. I'm not even a waffle person when I brunch, but these were stellar. Also, give me something cajun with a side of okra and I'm a happy girl- big fan of Terrace's shrimp and grits. I left full but surprisingly not feeling TOO full- we still had a lot of errands to run that day. Oh, Saturdays!

s95SSH-cVKn8dNDf3fSVhw.text: This is mediocre at best for dinner.  I have to assume the good reviews are based off a breakfast experience because our first time dinner experience was blah across the board.  It felt and tasted like an upscale cafeteria experience... not good.

nldH-0RHaUIQAKkeNfXXEg.text: Came here for brunch with a coworker. The reviews on yelp and the unique menu selection is what enticed me to try this place out.  The service was good - they seated us right away.  I ordered the infamous red velvet waffles.  They were a little too sweet for my taste, but good.   The atmosphere was homely feeling. It was small, quaint, and nicely decorated.   I would recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. If I'm in the area again, I would revisit this place.

K6of78MP4YsuIlnfOHLlnQ.text: We had dinner here last Saturday night. Couldn't decide what we wanted to eat and saw an add for them in Southpark magazine. Oh what the heck.. The place is rather unassuming from the outside. We arrived at around 6:30, and I would say around 40% full. The wait staff is very friendly. The first thing that grabbed my eye, was their wine list. The prices are very competitve! We had a nice bottle of pinot for $38! I saw an Italian wine on the menu that I paid $130 2 weeeks ago, and it was going for $75. On to the food,,, the menu was quite good and the thing that impresses is that all the food is organic and humane. Big plus! I had a chicken dish that was very tasty. My wife had a tender loin with a jalepeno sauce that was just right and not overpowering. I enjoyed our dining experience and would return definetely! A couple of things,,, lights are a little bright for dinner and they need some type of background music. The atmosphere was some what generic. They have a big breakfast and lunch crowd, so will be curious how they will compete in Piedmont Row(especially with George's opening up)

v8bnNIeX9us50JbYma5R-Q.text: This is a fantastic place for brunch.  Ask what the homemade jam is that day and if it sounds like something you like, be sure to get toast!  Hashbrowns are phenomenal as well as the banana split parfait.  Caramel coffee cake is dangerously addictive.

-RayV8HWpfbDoYmCZpWeGg.text: Sunday brunch -- First of all, I've tried many a bloody mary in various restaurants and bars in charlotte and I must say, theirs is by far the best I've had!  So, I'll be back just for another one of those!!!  About the food, we ordered the veggie egg white omelet served with fruit.  The omelet was pretty good but I have had better.  However, I always order a side of salsa to go with the omelet and their salsa was yummy.  So, I'd recommend adding the salsa to give the omelet a bit more flavor!  The fried green tomatoes are average.  My friend ordered the steak and eggs and declared that steak was delicious.  Coffee drinks were a big hit at our table as well.  The service was ok...they made a couple mistakes but nothing that wasn't fixed quickly.  I'll definitely be back.  There's more I want to try on their menu!
